Reviews.Title: “EX-CELL-ENT”
Reviews.Author: Kvos1
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in vancouver. Holding class with there new updated modern chic look. Excellent stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Phus
Reviews.Content: First time in Canada and in Voncouver. What a great experience we have had. The city is fantastic with amazing views and people are very friendly. We stayed at the Pacific Rim Fairmont! If you want to have a great memory do yourself a favor and book this hotel. We got a sweet with a fantastic view of the city' bay. Very clean and with an extraordinary service. Special cudos to the Clefs d’Or concierge they had on site. We felt like we have met a new friend. He directed us to great places in the city. When we will go back we will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place that we have found in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: snickers98
Reviews.Content: Not only is this the newest hotel in Vancouver it is also the best we have found. Great location across from the new convention centre. Spacious rooms, good service and food options. Would definetley stay here or shangra la next time.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant surroundings, welcoming staff, marvelous stay”
Reviews.Author: carole0223
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days at the Fairmont PR on business last week, 4/13-4/17, and I can't say enough about how lovely it was. In fact, I can't wait to return with my husband to see more of beautiful Vancouver. The hotel is quite modern and stylish in design, the rooms are large, the lighting excellent, the beds comfy, the bathrooms amazing with big soaking tubs to relax into at the end of long working days. For all that elegance, the service is warm and friendly and considerate. Staff learn your name quickly, are always prompt and friendly, and go out of their way to help with anything that arises unexpectedly. I left prescription eye drops at home and the valet immediately arranged for me to obtain an emergency prescription which he then picked up for me and brought to my room before i had to run out to meetings. All done with a genuine smile that helped make the day that much better! I remember Travis's name but in fact, every person I dealt with at the hotel was just as kind and willing to go the extra distance to make my stay excellent. Bravo, Pacific Rim!! I will seek out Fairmonts now because of you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: WpgTT
Reviews.Content: We mixed business with pleasure and this hotel was the perfect spot. Right from the moment we arrived the staff at the hotel made us feel totally welcome. We had an early flight and the rooms were not yet ready. Nina at the front desk took care of our bags and made it her mission to get us the nicest room coming available for us. She did not disappoint. The room was fabulous with many unique amenities. They certainly thought of everything when they designed the hotel. Electronic curtains, TV in the washroom mirror, Nespresso coffee maker are just some of them. And the view was amazing - great view of Coal Harbour. We highly recommend the Fairmont Pacific Rim. One of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: mmd1966
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at the Fairmont PR the last week of March 2012. He was there for meetings and I tagged along and worked from the hotel. It was such a great experience at the Fairmont, we're doing it again in a couple of weeks. We had a beautiful corner room (#2010) on the Gold floor. Similar to the Ritz Club Floor, the Gold Floor offers a lounge with breakfast, coffee, honor bar, etc. Both our room and the lounge overlooked the water with beautiful views of the mountains and the bay. Each morning, I planted my self on one of the very comfy sofas with one of their fuzzy throws and "worked" while watching the float planes take off and land from the bay. Being from Phoenix, I never got tired of watching these planes. Of course, not all work and no play. The spa was wonderful and I had one of my best massages with Melissa. The hotel is also within walking distance of Stanley Park with has a great trail along the seawall which became my exercise routine. Even though it was typical winter weather(rainy and overcast), Vancouver is beautiful and the rain didn't really hamper being outside. The location of the hotel is perfect for walking, and the hotel also offers rides (in the hotel BMWs) to downtown locations. The only downside is that the food is good but not great. Breakfast in the lounge was very good but room service/restaurant was just okay, especially given the cost. Nonetheless, we'll be back - our new home away from home in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: silvervexcebo
Reviews.Content: I think this has to be my favourite hotel, ever! (I'm an events manager so I see A LOT of hotels). I stayed here for two nights in March and had a wonderful stay. I can't wait to come back! Bedroom was lovely, very clean, lovely big bath and nice toiletries. The light/curtain controls took me a while to get my head around but they were a very cool touch. Gym was excellent. The bed was so comfy. I don't think I can find one fault. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Saskwatches
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first time while at a conference a while ago. Our room had a view of Canada Place which was amazing. I am quite lucky in that my work takes me to a lot of five star hotels but on the down side that also jades me a bit I think. This property certainly lives up to Fairmont standards as our room was very nice and the service was exactly what I expected. The lobby isn't to my tastes but we all have different tastes and I don't sleep in the lobby. I try and rate hotels within their category, that said this is a five star hotel and it certainly meets all the criteria for a five star. But as a five star I rate it very good. If I was the one paying the bill I wouldn't stay here, but for a conference or other business it is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Return to Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: WEARECANADIAN
Reviews.Content: Last time that I was in Vancouver, I had the pleasure of Staying at the Fairmont Waterfront (of which I am a fan). THis weekend I decided to try out her sister hotel, the Fairmont Pacific Rim. It most certainly did not disappoint. Check-in: Our taxi pulled up to the property and we were helped out by a very nice bellman. He proceeded to check our name and since we had pre-registered online, he gave us our keys and registration and escortedus past a very sleek lobby and bar to the elevators, where he let us know where the gold floor was and how to use our key to assist in the elevator. We arrived to our room (for a much appreciated) early check in on the gold floor. Room: Beautiful walnut faced door and entry lead us into a very sleek automated room. Divine italian linens, on a king bed, 2 uber comfy chairs and a work desk made for a very luxurious room. Marble adorned most of the bathroom with a separate tub and shower. My only criticism is that this space could have used a second sink and instead of a frosted glass door, perhaps a solid walnut one so that lights at night would not disturb the other person in the room. Service: Gold floor service was outstanding. Friendly staff amongst a beautiful view facing the harbour truly make this a winner. Evening noshes and breakfast offerings were nicely presented and yummo. Restaurant: THeir main asian fusion restaurant was elegant and sleek, again with wonderful staff preparing and serving wonderful food. Lobby bar was a happening place on Friday night where we enjoyed a glass of wine and some nibblies. Checkout: Bill was correct. Easy! Conclusion: Absolutely would stay here again! IT was nice to be amongst the Fairmont hospitality once again. Check on Fairmont's website for deals that they may be running. We found a 20% off slae on room, food and beverage. It worked out great, as we were also able to use the discount at Heron's at the Fairmont Waterfront. Happy and Safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Pacific Rim”
Reviews.Author: Flogel
Reviews.Content: 8/2/12 I stayed at the hotel for one night on my way back to Britain from Australia. I was given an early check in at 8.30am on the morning of the 8th and late check out at 2.00pm on the 9th. This was at no extra charge which was excellent. The hotel in a great position for the city centre and shopping. I used the sky train to come from the airport and the hotel is a 10 minute walk from the nearest stop. The pool and hot tub are outside but lovely and hot, you get a robe to go back and forth. The room was very nice with two queen beds, even a TV in the bathroom. Would use the hotel in the future for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Martinizer
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what to say other than this is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. First, the location is wonderful: right in downtown Vancouver overlooking the harbor, and right across the street from the Vancouver Convention Center. It is easily within walking distance of Gastown, and a short ride or long walk to Stanley Park and the aquarium. It was very easy to jump on the Sea to Sky highway to Whistler from here also (approximately two hour drive through some of the most beautiful country I have ever seen). What really separates this hotel, however, is the remarkable friendliness, courtesy, and thoughtfulness of the staff. You are basically treated like royalty from the moment you enter the hotel. Everyone that we encountered, whether it was the doorman, front desk, concierge, or housekeeping, was incredibly nice. I have never seen anything like it. The quality of the hotel is top notch. The rooms are amazing. The hotel restaurant (Oru) is top notch. The pool is located outside on the roof, but is heated such that it was comfortable even in outside temps of 40 degrees (F). In summary, I cannot think of one negative thing to say about the hotel, other than it's a little pricy. Sometimes you get what you pay for though.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly and amazing.”
Reviews.Author: swankmommy
Reviews.Content: We stay here every couple months. It's our home away from home. We stay on the Gold Floor which is worth the extra cost and more! The breakfast is amazing to wake-up to every mornings. All the snacks, teas, coffees through the day are fabulous as well. They make us feel at home and do everything they can to make all their guests feel comfortable. All the staff are amazing with children and even once sent a little doll home with me for our daughter when I was staying here without her. So sweet. The pool is fantastic and even on rainy days you can use the nice hot tub area. We love the property. The entire hotel staff are friendly and we love the modern design feel of this Fairmont. There is only one little tip. If you have allergies or are sensitive to scents, ask for your room not to have room spray during your stay. It's a perfume they spray to freshen up the room/bed. It gives me a migraine style headache, so I ask for none. They are happy to accommodate the request though!

Reviews.Title: “What were they thinking when they designed the lobby?”
Reviews.Author: thetraveldoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before the long flight to Sydney for a vacation in Oz. Of all the numerous Fairmont hotels I have stayed at, this one has the most unappealing lobby. Marble everywhere, quite opulent. But the lobby feels cramped for space, given the size of the hotel. Not a big deal, but noticeably poor design choices, including the lobby bar seating and furniture.The hotel room was very modern and well equiped. Beautiful bathroom, where the ever present use of marble is in good taste. The coffee and food in Giovanni's lobby cafe are great, and the food for lunch in Oru was also very tasty. Service in the hotel is very professional and friendly. But then I tried to print boarding passes- asked for business center. There isn't one! How can a 5* Fairmont hotel not have a business center? Especially since the hotel is immediately adjacent to the convention center? The concierge helped, but I wasn't able to choose seats (he was busy) and I had to provide private passport info to him. As they say, there are choices.......not sure I'd choose to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Dazzling”
Reviews.Author: Grahamrobertson
Reviews.Content: I felt lucky to stay here. True luxury. I walked around my room saying "wow cool" the whole time. Great lobby as well.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: I was here for 4 nights in early March. The hotel is excellent. Got a good rate as I was attending a conference in the hotel where we had a special rate. Got in after a long flight into the hotel at about 1 AM. The first room they gave me was on the 7th floor and it overlooked the spa. And by that I mean the people there could see into your room. No privacy so I asked for another room. So they moved me to a corner room on the 18th floor. Great views but the room was very small. So I moved again, and this time to 17th floor. This room was nice. It was good size and there was privacy. The rooms are pretty high tech, the drapes etc move on a touch button. I have a back issue and I only like memory foam pillows. This is the only hotel that I have stayed in that could provide it. They sent me a tempur pedic memory foam pillow. Now this was amazing. If you are a Presidents Club member you get free wifi. Else it was 10 bucks. The hotel has a free BMW drop off service anywhere in the downtown area. It is FCFS so in the evening be prepared to wait a bit. The hotel has a great bar scene in the lobby. They have live music every evening and it gets very busy. Absolutely worth checking out. I ate at the deli at the lobby level once and the food was good. I have stayed at 4 different hotels in Vancouver till now and found this one to be the best. I will surely repeat this one.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good quality”
Reviews.Author: amospurs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. There are cheaper options available in downtown Vancouver. However rooms are very well appointed with modern delights. On e Friday night, the Lounge bar aw really hip and happening with great crowd and some live music - nice food at restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug2080
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pacific Rim last weekend from Wed-Sunday. Its such a great hotel! The lobby smells amazing from the minute you walk in...they have orchids all over the lobby and a little flower shop selling them. The room was the perfect size and we had a bit of a harbor front view. I loved the Electronic Mirror with TV in it, awesome to turn on and soak in the tub. The shower was also great with a rain shower head and an additional fixture on the side. The bath products and soap smelled great and are made exclusively for Fairmont in NYC. The bed was comfortable and all the lighting is controlled by touch pads on the wall which you can dim to your liking. There was a great wall lighting feature above the bed which had lots of trees which were illuminated from behind. Giovanni's cafe in the hotel served really great food and awesome coffee! The location of the hotel was close to the Pacific Centre Mall (I think that was the name) as well it was close to lots of high end designer stores and restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel, had a very great stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Harry J
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on the Harbour by convention center. Great rooms, both luxurious and great business amenities. Very high tech environment. Beautiful views. Excellent service from all staff. Courtesy transportation available on request. Fine food in restaurants. Always my first choice in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Not child friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Huli10
Reviews.Content: We checked in this afternoon (14 March) for 8 days with my wife and 2.5 year old son. Check in was fantastic! Express check -in meant that a room was ready when we arrived and the paperwork was handed over as soon as I stepped out of the taxi. Location is also great. However, this hotel is not somewhere you want to bring your 2.5 year old child for many reasons 1. It has a few in-house dining options but today ORU was shut for a private function and so was the Cafe leaving only the lounge which doesn't exactly have many child-related eating choices! Having just arrived in the city an hour back on a rainy day, we really feel very stuck and helpless as to how to feed our little boy! -- I am not sure how management could allow limiting eating options so significantly for in-house guests. 2. There are no things/activities to do with kids at all within the hotel 3. The outdoor heated pool is great but on a cold wet day, while the adults will enjoy themselves, lack of any patio heating means that it is impossible to really take young kids outdoors dressed only in swimming trunks. Oh, by the way, they have a children's in-room dining menu- perhaps so that kids can stay locked indoors and not be seen disrupting their very pristine surroundings. Already feeling homesick on the first day of our family holiday...... Rahul Deb

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find anything negative...”
Reviews.Author: SPIKELEE007
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get a Harbour & Mountain view corner Suite. Room was like a small luxury condo apartment with fantastic views and all amenities you can hope for. Ipod station, good soundsystem, great HD TVs and a perfect blend of hi-tech environment and Pacific Northwest-like decoration twist. A real delight to stay here for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay in a while.”
Reviews.Author: DCOE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference across the street at the convention centre. Couldn't ask for a better location. Although there were no rooms available to use my upgrade certificates (FPC premier) the standard rooms are huge and more than adequate. Very modern design with neat touches like lighting themes, cool artwork and a media centre that let me hook up my iPad to listen to my own music in the morning (and not through a cheesy clock radio). Used the BMW car service a few times to go to restaurants. A nice service indeed. Concierge recommendations were spot on every time. Drinks in the lobby bar were pricy, but fresh and interesting. For sure, a stay here lighten your wallet, but it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful everytime”
Reviews.Author: jeo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times since it has opened. Cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Location is great with lots of interesting places to walk. Rooms are large and always spotless. Outdoor pool and hot tub is lots of fun even in the winter when it is raining. We have had a suite on the pool level and there were two fireplaces with our suite. Kids love being able to go in the pool and warm up by the fireplace. The staff in the restaurant are so amazing. They remember our kids and what foods they like. Jackie is our favorite server, we always ask for her section.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect as usual”
Reviews.Author: cityNeil
Reviews.Content: I stay at many hotels in the world and have become fussy and picky in my old age!. I, however, get genuinely excited at the thought of staying here. Front desk staff amazing, rooms quiet (an underrated quality in a big hotel) and the food and bar fantastic. My only slight criticism is that the breakfast is not great value for money and only OK. For a $30 buffet I would want something similar to what they serve in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Ever”
Reviews.Author: fred k
Reviews.Content: I was given a room in this hotel by my ski tour operator{TLH Heliski} . Have to say, it is the nicest hotel room I have ever been in. I am not a seasoned business traveler and rarely fly first class so my experience with high-end accomodations is limited, but with that being said I know a good thing when I see it. Room was very clean, outstanding decor, new mattresses and very quiet. What more do you want??

Reviews.Title: “It's everything you'd expect from a luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Smooth_Obturator
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of 3 Fairmont Hotels to choose from while staying in Vancouver. The Pacific Rim is the newest and most contemporary. We had a northward facing room with a view of Vancouver Harbour. Ordinarily it would not be a good thing to have a hotel room overlooking airplanes taking off regularly, but the best part of our room was being able to sit back and enjoy the scenic view of seaplanes taking off from the harbour with Stanley Park in the background. The room was well appointed with a comfortable bed, rain shower, TV integrated into the bathroom mirror, and a media console that you could plug in iphones and laptops into. We had a spa credit to use so we had a chance to check out the spa and fitness center facilities, which are top notch. The lobby bar scene was happening every night of our stay. It was always packed with people eating, drinking, socializing, and enjoying the live music. The service was what you’d expect of a Fairmont Hotel. It’s worthwhile to sign up for their Presidents club membership because it’s free and it gives you access to free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Canada”
Reviews.Author: Isabel39_10
Reviews.Content: View - service - quality - comfort - location - lobby bar - food - Best hotel in Canada

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY IN THE HEART OF VANCOUVER”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: Truly an amazing experience. You feel like you haven't left home as the staff makes sure you feel comfortable and welcome. The Fairmont Olympic is a beautifully hotel, modern, new, welcoming and elegant, located in the heart of DT Vancouver, right in front of the Convention Centre. you can do it all by foot, or use the hotels car for free!!! : ) I want to specially thanks Camila Parks, (She helped me right at the moment I stepped in the hotel, preparing my check in and guiding me, personally to the elevator, so I could get to my room as soon as possible... This is 7 star service, isn't it? Highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: student14
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Fairmont Pacific Rim to celebrate an anniversary and I could not have made a better choice. Everything was perfect from the moment we walked in. I had spoken with the concierge a couple weeks beforehand and had asked for rose petals, sparkling wine and chocolate-covered strawberries to be ready when we walked in, and even though we checked in fairly early it was all ready and waiting. We stayed in a Harbourview room that gave us a great mix of the city lights and the waterfront. We continuously marvelled throughout the trip about all of the added features in the rooms, including the rain-head shower, the amazingly comfortable beds, the turndown service and bottle of water and ice that was waiting for us when we got home from dinner, the fact that the lighting and drapery was controlled by panels throughout the room, and so much more. We ordered breakfast to our room and it arrived right on time and was absolutely delicious...probably the best cinnamon buns we'd ever tried! All of the service throughout the hotel was very prompt, we never waited for anything. And the staff was extremely polite, professional and helpful in every way. Our only regret is that we only stayed one night and didn't get a chance to sit in the lobby bar and listen to the piano or visit the pool and hot tub. However, we are already planning to spend our next anniversary at the Fairmont Pacific Rim, and the next stay will definitely be longer!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: XclusiveTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married at the Fairmont Pacific Rim, and we've stayed here a few times since. The accommodations are spectacular, with every room amenity you could imagine, great views, and courteous staff. The hotel's location is within walking distance of most downtown features (shopping, arts, restaurants) and very close proximity to Stanley Park. My wife enjoyed her visit to the Spa, we both enjoyed our brunch at "Oru", and we would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver. Although its expensive (everything in Vancouver is!), it's well worth the pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel. Impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: edelstein7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the pinnacle of customer pampering, from routine services to the on-site spa. The fitness room, with Technogym equipment (love the wave machine!) is several cuts above what I've experienced at other higher end hotels. Also, *both* on-site restaurants, one Italian themed, the other Japanese themed, are superb, unlike the case at many hotels where the on-site restaurant has 'last-resort' status. The vibe throughout this posh hotel, enriched with gorgeous granites (some with labradorite inclusions!) and marbles, is super modern, high tech, stylish. Check out the 'electric mirror' in the bathroom, which is a TV embedded within the mirror, with Bose speakers, of course. All lighting is touchpad controlled: welcome settings, relax settings, night light, etc. The drapes are also automated, and the balcony affords stunning vistas onto the Pacific and 'Canada Place', the Vancouver Convention Center. This has to be the nicest, and largest, convention center I've ever experienced (and I attend many conventions). By the way, the room is serviced in the evening (turn down service, ice bucket, fresh towels/cups, etc.) as well as in the morning. The daily paper is at the door each morning. The buffet breakfast in the Oru restaurant, though a bit pricey at $30 (= $40 with tax and tip) was superb. Everything you want, and even fresh smoked salmon. In a word, this place is fabulous. My guess is that the non-convention rates would be pretty steep.

Reviews.Title: “51st Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Pete k
Reviews.Content: Nina at the front desk ask if my wife and I were celebrating any special occassion. I replied that this was our 51st anniversary. With that came the hugs....the balloons and treats in our room. The staff constantly called us by name for two wonderful days. We enjoyed being taken by a hotel BMW to the resturants and retrieved again without delay. Our room on the 19th floor facing the water was splendid in every way. The location is supurb. just across form Canada Place and the Convention Centre. Easy walking the the highend stores in the commercial district. Well done to all the staff. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: TButte
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for a late Valentin's Day, stayed on the gold floor and it was amazing. The level of service out did it self. The only downer was the fire alarm going off and the fridge in the room dying in the night and no repairs while we were there. Had to ask for cream in the morning for my coffee

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel minus the restaurant Oru”
Reviews.Author: donnasinc91
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel and I was once again taken aback by the wonderful service provided by Fairmont hotel staff. The minute we dropped of our car rental we were welcomed by staff and handed the keys to our room. The car was whisked away and our luggage was on its way up to the suite. I was fortunate enough to have a suite upgrade left in my profile so we had taken advantage of that and was I glad we did. The Harbor suite has stunning views over the mountains and the water! The bell hop was so pleasant and extremely helpful. The staff were all very helpful during our stay. The lobby bar is very inviting with music playing and a great fireplace. The hotel is quite contemporary which at first made me a little nervous but it is outstanding and they have successfully married contemporary with warm and inviting. Our only regret was the restaurant Oru and that was a big regret but I will save that for another review. When we left the hotel the car was there in minutes and we were loaded up with maps and water and sent on our way! Once again, all the fine details really make the Fairmont chain the top of the list for me of exceptional places to stay. Oh, and the beds.....out of this world. I even asked the receptionist about them at check-out!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Class”
Reviews.Author: Melissa056
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic - from the arrival to departure nothing was too much trouble for the staff here. This hotel is fairly new and seems to be a trendy place to stay in Vancouver. The decor is clean and fresh, the rooms are lovely (I never thought I would need a TV in my bathroom until staying here) and the conceirge staff were fantastic. My only gripe, and I am being very picky here, is that the music in the lobby of an evening does sound very loud but that is what you get with a custom Italian piano and hard marble surfaces. I would happily recommend this place and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Service Did Not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: thirty-something72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently booked a "staycation" in our hometown and selected Fairmont Pacific Rim. We were keen to try this hotel out and as it turned out I conducted numerous meetings there during the week as a lead up to our Friday night repose. Rarely do I feel so compelled to rave about a hotel... This hotel had at every staff transaction and interaction "five star treatment." We were very impressed. While the modern design implies a little chill the staff and general attitude are many degrees warmer than anywhere I've ever stayed. The Fairmont Pacific Rim service was consistently EXCEPTIONAL. While all the staff were "top shelf" one big stand out was STEPH, the front door valet and concierge. She helped ensure we had the best stay possible and really left us feeling great about our choice of hotel. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Lobby lounge poor service”
Reviews.Author: Vanman2012
Reviews.Content: Just having lunch at the Fairmont Pacific Rim in the Lobby Lounge.first impressions are a very modern new property.Second impression is from are greeting by the three model like waitresses, basically cold stairs , no hellos or welcome.Even though the lounge was empty we had to seat ourselves being offered no assistants. First impression of our waitress was that she could care less about two normal customers.Rather then engage us she was looking blankly around away from us. Quality of the food was fine but for that kind of money it should be.we were never asked how are meals were, which is a huge thing for me. All in all very disappointed with the service.Guess you do have to be a Rock star to get decent service & I guess Fairmonts new standard for hiring is young, beautiful & not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views, Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: MaulikVaidya
Reviews.Content: (review based on 1 out of 6 days of stays)... Closer to my check-in day @ this hotel, received an email from Fairmont to perform a task akin to 'check-in for an airline'. After completion, I received a confirmation that my room was ready for arrival (prior to me showing up on the property). when i pulled in the hotel, the bell staff had room keys ready! No hassle. After passing through the grand lobby entrance, i proceeded to visit my room. The only other time i've been spellbounded and happy-as-a-child to see a room has been at the Westin Chayong in Beijing. I was greeted by fully integrated music and lightning experience in quite a spacious room w/ a gorgeous view. Marbled bathroom w/ integrated TV_in_the_mirror, shower area, well equipped garden tub -- functional and yet appealing to the eye. At 7am the next morning, I dialed Royal Service to see if my shoes could be polished and delivered in under an hour (usually, overnight request is preferred for this task). Polished shoes were delivered a half hour early, and well wrapped! Mighty impressive service. I look forward to spending another 5 days at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous State of the Art Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveJ43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent the weekend in Vancouver for a family function. We stayed in the new Fairmont Pacific Rim downtown by the waterfront. What an amazing hotel with absolute first rate service and ammenities. The hotel upgraded us to a massive suite with two amazing bathrooms that was very state of the art. It had a patio with a gas fire place and you can walk out from the patio to the pool and hot tub which are open year round. We had dinner in the restaurant (Oru) and it was outstanding. The biggest thing that stood out from this weekend was the service at the hotel and the proffesionalism of all the staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Not cheap but definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jclassvan
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the beautiful Pacific Rim. It was a one night get away for my wife and I. Using my PC certiificates I got an upgrade to a suite. It was a one bedroom suite with a view of the harbour and Stanley Park. We were very surprised upon entering the suite to find that it had two bathrooms. The "guest" bathroom off the living room had a shower that was at least 8 feet long - 4 people could have showered in there without touching! The ensuite had another shower, huge soaker tub, double sinks, and the TV in the mirror. (Not to mention the floor to ceiling window). It has been about 18 months since our last stay and although I still give the hotel an excellent rating, I did notice that the room and hallways did not not seem to be as clean as they were during out last stay. Housekeeping seems to have slipped a bit. The only other issue that we encountered was loud music coming from either the residences above us or from a night club 20 stories below. It actually started around 11 pm and went to after 2 am. Although we eventually fell asleep, the music did awaken us several times until it stopped. Other than that another fantastic stay at the most technologically advance hotel that I know of.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: emcgoo
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here between Christmas and New Year’s. This hotel has beautiful contemporary rooms and stylistically, is nothing like other Fairmonts. I had a standard room and it was a large L-shaped room with a stunning bathroom. The hotel was lovely and quiet and the service was extremely professional. I was a little... cranky and the staff were very patient. The fitness club was a little dark and ho-hum. The ambiance in the lobby lounge was adequate, but not amazing. The food and drinks however, were great. This hotel is definitely in the top two or three for Vancouver and I would jump at the chance to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is Why I'm a Fairmont Junkie!”
Reviews.Author: packed_bags
Reviews.Content: I will begin by admitting that I love the Fairmont chain, that's not to say that I haven't ever been given a room that could have used a little updating or one that was noisy because it was too close to the elevator but I love the Fairmont chain because they clearly value great service and empower their employees to provide it. Upon checking into the Fairmont Pacific Rim, I discovered that my laptop had been stolen out of my rental car sometime earlier that day. The theft had nothing at all to do with the hotel however they simply decided that they should to their best to try to brighten my day. I was paying for a basic Fairmont room but using a room update coupon that I had as a president's club perk. The kind young man at the front desk decided that he would give me room two upgrades up from the one I should have received and we ended up on the 18th floor with a spectacular harbour view. Now I will say that if you like the character and charm of the old Fairmont hotels, this is a departure from that style. This hotel is modern and sleek. At the push of button, you can open and close your drapes, change the lighting from "welcome" to "relax" mode and let housekeeping know that you want privacy in the morning. The bathroom has a dreamy soaker tub that you can relax in while watching the TV built into the mirror. The room also had a kit full of connectors which would allow you connect your electronic devises to the large HD television - this was very handy as my cell phone charger had been on my laptop bag. Despite the great surrounding, my luck hadn't completely changed. While unpacking, I discovered that I had left a jacket behind at the Fairmont Whistler where I stayed the night before. I went down to the front desk and was helped by a different staff member. I told her about my jacket and asked if the hotel might be able to get it to Vancouver for me. This young lady told me that she was headed up to Whistler on a personal trip the next day and that she would be happy to pick it up and bring to Vancouver for me. At this point we decided to take advantage of the "Dine Vancouver" $28 three-course menu at the restaurant. Once seated our friendly waitress, took our orders. When the two glasses of wine we had ordered arrived, she told us that she had heard about the laptop theft and the two glasses of wine were on the house. The meal was terrific, especially the short ribs. The wine list was extensive and included many wines by the glass including some reasonably priced wines at around $12 glass. Now given this stellar service, you may think that perhaps, we are big spenders who frequent the Fairmont regularly but in fact we only stay about 8 nights per year but we do make a point of trying to spend a few nights in a Fairmont when we are in city that has one. We have had the occasionally less than satisfactory situation but typically all you have to do is let a staff member know that you are unhappy and the problem will be solved. So clearly, I give this hotel top marks for customer service. I can also say that the hotel public areas are remarkably beautiful with a very modern clean look. This can however make the lobby a bit noisy when the lounge is full however I felt this gave the place a high energy feel that was very “big city”. The rooms (especially the beds) are very comfortable and provide all the amenities one could ask for. I’m definitely still hooked on Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sharit911
Reviews.Content: Best choice in vancouver, great location right by the harbour, beautiful views, nice front desk staff .Got upgraded to a pool facing room, very spacious with two queen beds, large bathroom, very modern , well equipped, very clean and nicely decorated.Service was good, breakfast buffet excellent.A very nice hotel...I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Best in Town”
Reviews.Author: Warren M
Reviews.Content: In past reviews I had had some issues with Fairmont's. However this hotel exceeded all expectations. Booked three for 4 nights for my staff from the US and Mexico. The rooms were amazing. Quiet, well laid out and clean. Service was excellent. The only recommendation is that you book the breakfast package. Breakfast "al a carte" is insanely expensive. Other than that enjoy the views and close p[roximity to downtown Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel in Canada”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim while on business in Vancouver, November 2011. I was very impressed by this hotel, in fact I think it is my new favourite in Canada! The design of this hotel is beautiful - modern, but organic with plenty of warm-toned millwork throughout. The rooms are not only beautiful and comfortable, but are technically advanced. The computerized room lighting has different "scenes" depending on your activity or time of day. There is a comprehensive connection center to enable use of the TV with your laptop or portable media player. The in-room music system is very good. Each room has a Nespresso espresso machine, which makes me feel at home! The only quibble I have with room design is that the lighting panels are not backlit at night, so it is difficult to select the desired lighting scene. Service was generally excellent. The only time I had trouble was when I had forgotten my running shorts at home and I ordered a loaner pair through "Fairmont Fit" room service. I only had an hour to work out, and the shorts took too long to arrive so I couldn't work out that day. The Milanese bakery on the main floor becomes a very nice wine bar at night. I ordered a wine flight which came with a sommelier-selected match of cheeses and condiments. The sommellier brought the items to my table and gave me a full explanation, including a description of the regions of Italy they hailed from. A memorable experience! The gym is well-equipped with modern machines. The spa is excellent (though pricey). There is an outdoor heated swimming pool, whirlpool and sauna. Overall, 5 stars! I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jam18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December for one night, Once you pull up to the hotel, you are greeted by the doorman with a warm welcome,help you unload your vehicle, and guide you to check-in. Did not wait long, again, very welcoming and fairly quick. We had a harbourview room looking over the new convention centre, you must request this view! The room is gorgeous, modern, nice king bed, automatic curtains, LCD TV, touchpad switches, mini bar and drawer with conveniences, single shot codffee maker, closer had mini safe, umbrella for use, iron. The washroom had separate tub and glass rain shower, mirror in washroom had a built in TV. Last year they brought up complementary macaroons, this year was a bottle of spring water in a Fairmont Branded glass bottle. We attended an event in the convention centre across the street, there is an underground access tunnel that is open certain hours.The people and service here is what made the stay enjoyable. By the way, parking was $43.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: princessvontrapp_7
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have visited at a very reasonable rate. We stayed at the hotel over New Year for 3 nights and got the Gold level for $249 on Expedia. Our room on the 21st floor was beautiful, as the whole lobby, and everything - brand new from the Olympics. This was our first time on the gold level at a Fairmont, and we loved it. The view from the lounge was amazing, the food presentations where great and the staff could not have been any nicer or more helpful. In addition, we could get a driver to take us to locations in Vancouver, for dinner or for sight seeing. We felt so spoiled. On New Year, we ate at Uri, which is an Asian restaurant that cooks with local ingredients. We had an amazing 6-course-meal. Some people around us had to wait for their food for a long time but we had no problem at all. The bed was very comfortable, the room had huge windows looking onto the Bay and very cool art = back lit photographs, as well as automated blinds and lights as I had never seen them before. The bathroom was huge and gorgeous, with a TV built into the mirror. At night we got water and some delicious treats, presented beautifully. My husband and I highly recommend this hotel for it's location, rooms and staff. A lot of great restaurants are in walking distance (ok, not short walks) and we walked all across the city from there. If we visit Vancouver again (what a lovely city, so much to see), we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: gibsonsmolly
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver and Waterfront and must say the Pacific Rim is miles above these two properties. It is modern, contemporary and very state of the art. The lobby lounge is a great place to hang out for drinks and people watching. The rooms are large, well appointed and comfortable. The tv in the bathroom is a great touch. The location is good especially for tourists. I usually come to Vancouver to shop and go for dinner so I prefer being closer to Robson/Burrard. I can't fault the service it's very good and very professional but after a recent stay at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia I must say the service at the Fairmont hotels lack a little in warmth and genuineness. Overall if you enjoy a modern contemporary hotel this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: titannick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Pacific Rim for a long weekend to treat ourselves and what a treat it was!!! We were on the gold floor wish was to die for... The view we had from our room was amazing. The service, the staff, the food everything in this hotel was amazing. I do recommand this hotel and will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Expected the best and not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: rlfbark
Reviews.Content: Stayed Fairmont Pacific Rim for 2 nights for Christmas and Boxing day. We had a long flight from Perth, Australia so we wanted really good rest in a comfortable & luxury room to get over the jet-lag before heading to active family ski holiday at Whistler. Fairmont Pacific Rim was perfect place to veggie-out. The check in was breeze, we were taken straight to the Gold Floor reception for check-in and shown to the room within minutes on arriving the hotel. Room is not big but well appointed with 2 Queen size beds which was ideal for family. Most impressed with bathroom with TV on the mirror, quality amenities, big shower and bathtub. No complaint about the hi-tech lighting system as some travelers mentioned. They all worked perfectly well and very functional. Free Wi-Fi worked well in the room & Club lounge. The Club lounge is very spacious and has breathtaking harbor view and serve complimentary meals throughout the day. Breakfast were served 7am to 11am, then coffee & tea throughout the day, Canape with drinks between 5pm-7pm, then sweets (& chocolate fondue) was served between 8 pm and 9 pm. It was raining most of the time and most shops and restaurants were closed over Christmas, So We spent most of our time in the room or lounge and take advantage of Club lounge which was well worth the extra we paid for the Gold Room. My only gripe was alcoholic drinks are not free. It's honor bar so you write down what you drink and they charge to the room. The price of alcoholic drinks were quite expensive (Glass of Moet $25 each, Glass of Wine $15 each, Bottle of beer $9 each ) which helped us not drinking too much, on the bright side. This was only hotel executive floor lounge we had to pay for the alcoholic drinks, but it must be standard for Fairmont. Overall it was great place to stay we will definitely return to Fairmont Pacific Rim when we visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Marifaci
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for new years eve, with the american express program. we reserve a deluxe view room and we call in advance because we have a 6 months old baby. we arrive at the hotel (long line in the check in) and the room had a shower and not a bathtub,the views to a gas station and they offer a basket to clean the baby!!! , we ask for a room with a bathtub and we wait more than an hour with a baby to have the room, we were so tired so we decided to stay. horrible managment and the rooms very small and outdated,go to somewhere else because is really dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Hotel Design Perfection & Service to Match”
Reviews.Author: PugetSoundGirl
Reviews.Content: We have been lucky enough to stay here twice and both times have been exquisite. The hotel design was planned to show elements of the earth to represent the beauty around Vancouver. So, there is an incredible amount of marble, wood and water features. The lobby is entirely in Calcutta marble and other types all over floors and walls, but it's all very contemporary and modern clean lines. The lobby bar with live entertainment a lighted marble bar is quite the place to be on weekend nights. The rooms are almost too much to describe, more incredible modern design and marble baths you have to see. Of course, there are the staler Fairmont beds that I swear give me a better nights sleep than at home. Definitely worth a special holiday or birthday and you will not be disappointed - Gold club or not.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBHAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before departing on an Alaskan cruise and found that the entire time we were on the cruise, we were anticipating our return to Vancouver so that we could once again enjoy the hospitality and pampering provided to us at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. You have to realize that there are two Fairmont's in Vancouver. This one, by far, is the choice to make! We joined the President's Club which is the Fairmont chains rewards program and it was well worth the time it took to simply fill out the information card. They upgraded us to a magnificent room upon on our return after the cruise simply from joining prior to leaving on the cruise. Can't beat that! The corner rooms on the water side are stunning. The seaplanes take off right below you and if you never left your room, you'd still have a fabulous trip just looking at the breathtaking views of the mountains, the parks, the seaplanes and the ships. I had never been to Vancouver and was not particularly excited about going. To me, it was just an overnight before the cruise. Now......I can't wait to return!! The people in Vancouver were charming and friendly, the restaurants, both at the hotel and in the surrounding area were an adventure every night, the shopping was top notch and the parks provided endless ways to exercise outside (and that beats the gym any day of the week)! We received endless suggestions and help from the lovely Concierge staff and upon taking their direction to drive to Whistler, we found ourselves oohing and ahhing at every turn. That was yet another day in the Vancouver area that was unforgettable. If you decide to do that day trip (which I suggest you turn into a two day overnight), make sure to stop at the waterfalls on the way up. And DO NOT go without a camera. There is literally a photo opportunity at every turn of the drive. My suggestion is to drive to Whistler early in the morning, check to see if they are having one of their fabulous outdoor festivals (we lucked upon one), have lunch at the Fairmont in Whistler, take a rafting trip (they're fast and don't require an entire day to do) and then time your drive back to put you at Stanley Park (a not to miss destination) in Vancouver in time for an early dinner and sunset at The Tea Room (which is not a Tea Room but a lovely lovely and charming restaurant on the point at Stanley Park). That was our schedule for the day and I can honestly say it was a day I will always remember. The sunset at The Tea Room was unparalleled in my opinion. The Tea Room gets very crowded and they do take reservations so if you intend to do this, plan ahead. All in all the Fairmont, and Vancouver are something I recommend highly. And if you are so inclined, stay on the Club floor and request a corner room. Yes, there are upcharges, but if you join the President's Club it will help offset that a bit and you will not regret it. The food presentations are lovely, the Concierge staff at the Club are so attentive and helpful, and the corner room is huge with amazing views. The windows literally wrap the very large living room with pull out sofa and the bedroom and two baths are almost spa like.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern chic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Erikjonahluke
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim hotel August 2011. Upon arrival the staff on duty at the door welcomed us with friendly smiles and made us feel welcome right from the start of our stay. The hotel is very chic and modern with a lively vibe. Beautiful lobby with large glass fireplace with seating-bar area with music and lively conversations. The rooms were very comfortable, again ultra modern with many nice amenities! Would definitely recommend the Fairmont Pacific Rim to anyone staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Vancouver by far”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here over a handful of times by now and each visit has been an excellent experience. The lobby bar sets a great atmosphere as you enter the hotel. The rooms are modern and well cared for. The service has been excellent throughout the hotel with a few exceptions at the Lobby Bar when it gets very busy. I've enjoyed many good times at the Lobby bar and suggest you enjoy a glass of Van Weston wine and the samosas with mint dip. If you have the $$$ and enjoy spending time on balconies go for a view suite. The hard product at this hotel beats the 4 Seasons with ease. I've stayed once at the Shangri-La in a suite and prefer the Pacific Rim experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelerWashDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Rim after having skiied a week at Whistler. The rooms were nice, large and well appointed. The room service menu was limited though the food ordered was good and the service prompt. The only issue we had was that the rooms were not ready when we arrived mid afternoon...otherwise a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option for Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luxuryhotelcritic
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a number of Vancouver hotels I was pleasantly surprised by the new Fairmont Pacific Rim. This hotel is NOT your typical Fairmont in that there is nothing traditional about it. The hotel is a modern and beautiful transitional style hotel with an amazing vibe. The restaurants and service are terrific. Location cannot be beat. Rooms are amongst the most beautiful and modern I have stayed in. The electronics in the room are controlled by master panels. Bathrooms are gorgeous. We had a corner suite with a 180 degree view of Canada Place from our bathroom. Beds are amongst the most comfy I have experienced. Room service outstanding and very timely. Beware that people from adjacent buildings CAN see into your bathroom when the sun shades are up. Would absolutely stay here again on my next visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: silver 57
Reviews.Content: Great room, views, building and conceirge . Can't rave enough In room details , toiletries, electronics all top class. Food great especially the breakfasts and the bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “You'll never want to go home.”
Reviews.Author: Ann5710
Reviews.Content: This hotel is sophisticated, warm, friendly and very comfortable. We were met with friendly people from the moment we arrived at the entrance until we sadly left for home. It was Christmas and the lobby was decorated subtly yet festively. The rooms are amazing - every detail is well-considered. We will return as often as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: holidayer80
Reviews.Content: If it is luxury, pampering, great service, awesome atmosphere, and good food that you want...look no further. We had a room that looked out to the harbor, and it was absolutely stunning. Room service was a little expensive, but that is to be expected. The staff were helpful and efficient from the moment we stepped on the property. The bathroom was the most swanky bathroom that I have ever had in a room....we spent a lot of time in there enjoying the tub, tv mirror, and shower. It was pure heaven! This hotel delivered on everything. Don't waste time and money on other five stars...stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Beautiful Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: evelynmonica30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this glorious hotel during the Christmas week, I have nothing negative to say about this luxurious hotel and I am a very picky traveler. The location is wonderful, the service is excellent, they greet you by your name, valet parkers was beyond excellent, providing us water everytime they delivered our car, asking if we needed directions or anything for our journey, left valuables in the car and they were untouched. The hotel is wonderful, the lobby is wonderful, the drinks at the lounge in the lobby were perfect. Giovane bakery was our stop most mornings, their coffee was one of the best in Vancouver for us. My son enjoyed their pastries. The room is fully equipped and very modern, my son enjoyed the tub while watching his cartoons. This hotel represents all Fairmont should be, not very much like the one we visited after in Whistler, but that will be reviewed next...

Reviews.Title: “No complaints met all my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Domicake
Reviews.Content: Hallo fairmont pacific rim met all my expectations for a Vancouver hotel this hotel was brand new smell in the room was fresh big room very comfy bed with beautiful nice sheets the bathroom had a nice tub nice glass shower and a tv in the mirror. The style of the room was more like a fancy hotel room in las Vegas was modern big and I would give it 5 out of 5 . I stayed there only one nite but it's top of the class for hotels only small downer if u stay more then one nite with a second person the bathroom only has one sink:( maybe cuz it was a standard room. But I recm this hotel it's top of the line!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: LuxusTravel
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite Fairmont Properties, I have multiple stays at this location in the last year and they are consistently flawless, this is a term I use Very Sparingly! The property is amazing from their very well appointed standard room to their amazing suites. The service in this location is what puts a smile on my face each time we stay. Their Presidents Club rewards program is a free sign up and very very worthwhile. They will provide you with Adidas workout gear (shorts, Shirts and Yes Running shoes) all is your size. Just ask! This makes traveling with only carry on so much easier! If you are in Vancouver or want a special get away, this is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Christmas Eve”
Reviews.Author: traveladikt
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful Christmas Eve here, blissed out in the Signature Room's Japanese tub (with the killer view). Room Service was excellent, staff were professional and attentive, we could not have asked for a more perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: fromRoseville
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels, and many that are quite wonderful, but this hotel is, without a doubt, the best. It is new and right near the water and the convention center. The minute you walk into the lobby, you are just pulled into the elegance and peacefulness of this hotel. The lobby is all stone, and just stunning. There is a lovely bar/cafe area on the left side as you enter where you can have a lovely cocktail or have high tea in the afternoon. I did not partake but the tiered tray of treats at teatime looked marvelous. My room was model, had lovely appointments, and the bed was SOOOOO comfortable. The bathroom was magnificent. There was a tub with water jets, and a very nice stall shower (which I prefer over tubs). The toilet had its own separate space. The sink area was large and spacious. I also received a small evening sweet both nights I was here, and they were delicious. In addition, I had the breakfast buffet, and every single item I tried was tasty and well prepared. If you are in Vancouver, I heartily recommend you stay here. I should also add that the fitness center is first class. While I prefer a different brand of equipment, there were plenty of machines as well as a room for stretching that was quite lovely. It is nice, when you are traveling for work, to be in a place that is much nicer than one's own home!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: CaroleCoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim Hotel for 1 night and were treated exceptionally well. Every staff member was warm and friendly. We felt like important guests and made to feel very welcome. The hotel is in a great locationn. The room was modern, very comfortable and had a beautiful big bathroom. Our kids loved the TV in the bathroom mirror. The hotel is in walking distance to downtown. There are lots of great resturants close by. The bar at the hotel has a good atmosphere and the service is great. Breakfast at the hotel is excellent too with great service. Nothing is a problem. I would highly receommend this hotel to families or business travellers. The service is of a very high standard and the staff are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and modern”
Reviews.Author: nasbr
Reviews.Content: Quite surprised how nice the standard room is. Spacious, stylish and modern. Very nice bathroom with separate bathtub and shower. It even has a small tv in it. Comfy bed. Great selection of complimentary coffee in the room with fancy coffee maker. Decent gym. Friendly staff. My only not so happy moment was ordering two deserts and one bottle of water for room service and had to pay $47 ($15 was fees ). So I would think twice before ordering room service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fishboy100
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here in May 2011. Had an upgraded room, overlooking Canada Place and the Water. Think it was around the 12th or 14th floor. Excellent location & service as expected from a Fairmont Hotel. Room was really nice. View was fabulous. The tub was probably the highight. Being able to sit in a nice, jetted tub, overlooking the water at night, is really something. Price was pretty good all things considered. Certainly worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Marble Heaven....”
Reviews.Author: TravelBhoy
Reviews.Content: My first stay in a Fairmont - this is a very very good hotel. I had a harbour view room and waking up to harbour and Canada Place and mountains was wonderful! Position was perfect - plenty of eating places around - tourist office across the road were very helpful - walked to Gastown - used the Skytrain - went on a seaplane tour (very handy for hotel and GREAT fun). The room in the hotel was amongst the best I had stayed in - very comfortable - fabulous bathroom. Some may say a bit too high-tec (and as I couldn't work out how to get the plug out of the bath that should include me) but its just fab. Live music in lobby was nice as was the amount of marble in the hotel! Staff very friendly and this reflected all the people I met in Vancouver - the only place in the world outside the UK I would happily live in. You pull the overflow plate to empty bath... Def go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Modern and Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LUVINVACATION
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of the action, Steps away from Stanley Park and Canada Place. They even gave us bikes for a few hours on the house so we could explore the park. Our room was beautiful, the service was perfect and their breakfast is awesome (not the cafe on street level)...They don't promote the breakfast option at the hotel enough...it is great food, good ambiance and great views of Canada Place. I always find something wrong and it was stellar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: westcoastgal11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before a show in town. My bf had arranged massages earlier in the day so we arrived early and had lunch at Oru beforehand. Our lunch was excellent Japanese cuisine - though a bit limited on the selection for lunch. We valeted the car with the concierge who was friendly and another gentleman was waiting at the front door - he opened the door, greeted us and walked us to the front desk to check-in. Nice touch! We had a harbor view room with a stunning bathroom! I loved the Westcoast style of this hotel. After changing into robes (with no slippers though?) we wondered down to the spa which was gorgeous! We waited in the couples room and had an excellent 90 min couples massage. After our massages were finished we went out to one of the outdoor hot tubs overlooking the harbor and convention center. Bring your bathing suits! There is also an outdoor fire pit - a definite WOW for a spa lover! We had some wine in the room as we got ready for dinner and the show - and the manager sent up a bottle of sparkling water and some chocolate and dried fruit - another wow! After some appy's in the lobby bar (with live music) and a cocktail we headed out to the show. We missed the free car service provided by the hotel (if you are willing to wait they will drive you anywhere downtown!) so we just took a cab to Rogers Arena. The extra service/staff at this hotel definitely take it from great to outstanding. We have stayed at almost all of the Fairmont's in Vancouver and this is my favorite! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Islandpegger
Reviews.Content: I recently took my mother and teenage children to Vancouver for a mini-break and chose this hotel. The location is great. The rooms and amenities were luxurious but not over the top and the room features were very modern but not cold. Although they don't have a lot of adjoining rooms (and none with two beds in each), they were able to give many two rooms beside each other and that was sufficient. The pool area is very nice. Service . was top shelf!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vicki000
Reviews.Content: We came to Vancouver for a few days this summer after a week in Whistler. I can't give enough superlatives. Top notch in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ANSQ8
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Vancouver, I strongly recommend staying at this amazing, modern, yet very warm hotel. Great location, friendly staff, very modern rooms and nice restaurants with health options. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy room!”
Reviews.Author: mytrip784
Reviews.Content: Got a social shopper rate last spring. Upgraded to a poolside room. Was a bit dissapointed it did not go right out to the pool. Just looked over the pool had to go down one floor to get to pool. The room was great. Gas fireplace on the balcony. T.V. in the bathroom mirror. big shower and tub in bathroom. Had a credit of $50.00 for spa. Had a manicure. Was $65.00 plus tax and tip. Have had better for $30.00. Breakfast buffet at Oru was ok, nothing special. Would stay again for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and service”
Reviews.Author: bcmom_7
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the Pacific Rim. The rooms were fabulous, we had two adjoining rooms since we were traveling with our daughters. The beds were very comfortable and the room always clean. The service was excellent. My husband and daughters contracted food poisoning at the airport (we think) and the first day there was not a happy one. The staff offered ginger ale and soup and took great care to make sure they were comfortable. They even brought up mouthwash for my daughters after they started feeling better. When I asked them to change all the sheets and make sure everything was sanitized they happily obliged. The great thing, they did all that and brought up sodas and soup without charging for them. We love Vancouver and plan to stay at the Fairmont everytime we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “The modern Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: UsBizTraveler01
Reviews.Content: I found it difficult to offer up a complaint about this hotel, but I will get to one shortly. I stayed here for 3 nights in early November - not the best time to visit Vancouver as it's the rainy season, but this Fairmont certainly allowed me to make the best of it. I'll start with the meeting space, as this was the main reason for my visit. We held a one-day meeting in the Garnet Room including catering for a continental breakfast and some wireless internet connectivity. Ok, so I don't have much to say about this, as there was nothing to complain about. The meeting was for 5 people, the food was decent, and all staff were attentive - exactly how you want an important business meeting to go. Now, on to the hotel itself and the overnight accommodations. This is a newer property for Fairmont (there are THREE in downtown Vancouver), apparently built for the olympics. It screams luxury. I had a standard king room overlooking the pool area. Spacious floor plan - especially the bathroom with huge, glass-walled, walk-in shower. All very modern and very tech-savvy - plug-in your iPod to your alarm clock to play or wake to your own music, in-mirror TV display/tuner, touch-pads for shades/lights. All very nice. Now, to be honest, this is the one grip I had - the touch pads for lights (on entry, near desk, near bed, in bathroom) were very cool, but not really practical. Settings were unclear (ok, "day" and "night" modes are obvious, but other options weren't) and when the lights were off, one could not tell which touch button to push to turn the lights on or open the shades or whatever - so I just ended up slapping my fingers anywhere on the touch pad so that *some* light would turn on. Oh well. With respect to the hotel itself. Beautiful. Great service. The Buffet breakfast at Oru was excellent. Doorman would greet me with a water bottle each day I came in from my morning run. Used complim car service (a BMW X5) to get dropped off twice at destinations downtown. All around a great stay. I was slightly concerned about the area it was in (near the convention center), but it turned out to be perfect - my morning runs along Cole Harbour and up to Stanley Park were amazing (and while it was about 40 degrees F, the rain held off).

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel In Van”
Reviews.Author: pugz d
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is nice but the service is completely horrible. Every employee at the Pacific Rim is Stuck up and rude. 0.5 out of 5 stars is what i rate this hotel when the maids arent trying to frame you for a raise they are snooping through your items to see if theres anything they want to take. Even if you have the privacy light on you can bet someone will be in there when you return to your room. We went to the Grey Cup Game left the do not disturb sign on the door when we came back a few hours later are items had been looked through. Do not stay at this hotel stay at the other fairmont in downtown van.

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself, you will not regret it.”
Reviews.Author: geenes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pure luxury done in such a understated way that it's never stuffy or forced. I stayed for 4 nights early November in a Deluxe Mountain View room. First of all, I have to say when selecting your room it's really about what view you want. Room sizes (not counting the suites obviously) are pretty much the same, what sets them apart is the view you desire. There are city views (still very nice generous sized rooms, decorated exactly the same and views over downtown Vancouver) or harbour views, mountain views, pool views with patios and fireplaces, some rooms have balcony's, etc etc...so the choice is really up to you about how much you want to pay for what view. This Fairmont is also not like other Fairmont's at all - it was newly built for the Vancouver Winter Olympics and is all modern furnishings, large sleek spaces, trendy design - the book in the room talking about the design of the property is an interesting read to see how it all evolved. I arrived very early in the morning and was treated with exceptional customer service from the moment I arrived, by everyone I encountered. My room wasn't ready yet, but after only about an hour relaxing in the trendy lounge, they had it ready for me. Even the woman who delivered my bags to the room was genuinely kind, friendly and seemed to be happy in her work - happy staff make SUCH a difference in the customer service industry and this really came across during my whole stay. I had a complimentary fresh fruit bowl and bottle of sparkling water waiting in my room for me - well received and appreciated after a long flight! Free wifi throughout the room worked perfectly the entire stay - this is included if you are a President's Club member and why wouldn't you be, as it is free to join online. I didn't require anyone to show me how the high tech room controls worked and didn't find them difficult to figure out at all, although I could understand how some who may not be used to such things might find them a little confusing, however they are simple touch pads to control all lighting and curtains in the room. I experienced no problems at all as some have reviewed about random lights turning on during the night and I also figured out the trick as some have mentioned the 'night' light under cabinet lighting in the bathroom stays on all night - simply hit the 'night' button on the touch pad twice or until it goes off - this will turn it off completely. I did find with all the glowing up touch pads through out the room, there was a lot of light when sleeping - I like a pitch black room, however with a little thought this can easily be overcome - just covered each touch pad with a book, etc - even the one half way up the wall can be covered up by propping a pillow up against it - so don't be worried by that if you too like a dark room! The room style - large and spacious, great entry way with large wall mirror and wardrobe with safe, ironing board and iron. Lovely walnut paneling and furniture - good desk for working at, large very comfortable king size bed (though I do wish hotel's would do away with the over the top stuffed feather pillows or at least give you a choice as I always find these rather uncomfortable). Arm chair and foot stool, plus nicely designed art/light installation above bed, however the lightbox above the bed with what looks like local forest picture, was popping out of it's frame so I could see right up into the light and the staples that were hanging from the wood frame, so that didn't look so great. This and the dust around the ornamental vase were the only two negatives I could pick about the property though - so that's saying something! My room had a balcony (no furniture on it though, which was a bit strange so could only stand out there) but it was great to be able to open the sliding doors and look out over the harbour, watch the sea planes land, look right down onto Canada Pl and the Olympic torch, just a magical view and so relaxing. I could occasionally hear the sea planes outside and only ever heard a door shut every now and then in the hallway, otherwise I would have thought I didn't have any neighbors at all - very very quiet. The bathroom....ahhhh, on another level. Grey marble throughout - huge tub, including free bath salts. Rain shower head, plus another normal one meant for a great, great shower experience. TV in the bathroom mirror, makeup mirror with light, plenty of towels, robes, anything you could need provided, toilet in separate frosted glass area at back of the bathroom. I ordered room service twice - both times it arrived quickly and hot. Delivered again by smiley, happy hotel staff who seemed to just genuinely enjoy what they do. Food tasted great also. Cafe attached to hotel has all sorts of coffee, teas, hot chocolate, etc along with breakfast pastries, muffins, and more substantial lunch items. It turns into a wine bar at night. Every day it was buzzing with locals stopping in to enjoy their coffee. The gelato place on the corner of the hotel, also very good. The location of the hotel is decent. Easy to get around - right on Canada Pl, so perfect for walking around the waterfront, looking at the Olympic stuff, right next to the exhibition centre and literally one block from the Waterfront centre - which had a Tim Horton's, Subway, McDonalds, Starbucks, etc in it, plus links you to the SkyTrain station to get around town, or just walk a few blocks and you're in the heart of the shopping district. From start to end, my stay was perfectly easy and relaxing, whilst making me feel special and luxurious. This hotel creates the hard to come by balance of modern, clean lines, simplicity, whilst still feeling cozy, comfortable and warm. I definitely did NOT want to leave and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a princess :) I like this feeling”
Reviews.Author: Ladypelt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 13 others on our way to whistler for a wedding and ski holiday! What a blast ! Enjoyed every single moment, this place didn't miss a beat!!!! Wonderful staff, beautiful place, great bc bubbly and sushi:) enjoyed my very early outdoor swim and hot tub!!!! I love my life !!! I love this hotel xo to all - Gigi

Reviews.Title: “modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: farrer
Reviews.Content: great room overlooking pool and harbour.Modern decor and furnishings with hip lobby bar where you can people watch all day.

Reviews.Title: “Proof that hotels do evolve over time”
Reviews.Author: FrankWeho
Reviews.Content: This incredibly stylish property will cast aside any thoughts you might have that Fairmont hotels are traditional and a bit stodgy. Some major money was put into building this hotel, and it shows. We were in a corner balcony suite facing the harbor. Foreground view of the convention center's green roof was pleasant, and the panorama beyond of the bay and mountains was spectacular. But the inside of the suite was just as interesting: walnut paneling and ceilings, beautiful bathrooms, nice furnishings. The lighting controls were a bit too complicated, but I appreciate any hotel's effort to have sophisticated built-in lighting instead of just lamps. The gelato place on the property facing Cordova St. is seriously good. The breakfast buffet is terrific and the gym might be the finest hotel gym you'll see.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: schayward
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Pacific Rim is a top notch hotel. It is the perfect balance of modern elegance without feeling too stuffy. The rooms are generous in size with modern conveniences and the bathroom is what hope from most hotels but rarely get. The staff is friendly and helpful with a conplimentary car drop off and pick up service anywhere in the downtown area. That is, if you get tired of walking because the location of the hotel is perfect for strolling all around downtown and the water front. I have always been a fan of Fairmont Hotels but the Pacific Rim is one of the best of I've ever stayed in. I wouldn't hesitate to go back and in fact was sad to leave it was such a superb stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent staff and 'must-visit' lobby bar”
Reviews.Author: faye b
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary (and first night away from the kiddies) last weekend at this fabulous hotel. Spectacular room, central to amazing restaurants and easliy some of the best hospitality experienced in the city. My favorite part - our luxury Japanese soaker tub and the incredibly creative lobby bar drink menu...yum! Modern, comfortable and luxurious. A+

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel, 5 star everything”
Reviews.Author: Holnek
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel for three nights in early November. I have zero complaints and tons of compliments for the staff and their service from check in to check out. This is truly an amazing hotel.
