Here's a short list of why it deserves a 5 star rating: - Excellent service - we arrived late, room was already checked in, my keys were out front and handed to me when I got off the taxi, and someone escorted us upstairs and explained all the little details about the room (definitely very helpful if you are not used to all the electronics). The concierge was extremely helpful as to point out walking directions, best scenic routes, different transportation options, etc. - Cleanliness - from the floors to the bathroom to the public areas, this hotel is squeaky clean! The hotel is very modern (which might be very different from other Fairmonts), and the decor and design is very sleek but welcoming. Housekeeping does an amazing job (twice a day) at getting your room ready for the daytime and the evening. Simply amazing - Lobby bar - fun place to hang out. They've got a good selection of drinks at a very reasonable price. Live music is pretty much played all throughout the afternoon and until closing at 1 am. This place gets pretty packed so secure your spot early when everyone's out at dinner. - Location - it's definitely the best place to stay at if you're in Vancouver for tourism or even for business. We did not rent a car and walked everywhere. Buses and the subway are very convenient and within walking distance. There are also lots of great restaurants nearby (Japanese, seafood, snacks, etc.). The one thing that was probably missing was a supermarket, but there are several drug stores that open late nearby. Oh, and a gelato place downstairs that opens from 8 am to late in the evening (11 pm?) - Food - We only had the chance to go to Giovanne (not Oru) for breakfast. They have a fabulous selection of breakfast items. The breakfast sandwich was amazing. I was not a big fan of their coffee and think that they can improve on this, but other than that, I was a happy man by starting my morning off there. I have to try their main restaurant the next time I'm in town. - Price - I almost forgot... Yes, I paid 240 CAD / night. It comes with a 25% off breakfast buffet coupon which we didn't use, and internet was included. I'd say this is an amazing rate for what you get, don't you? Complaints? Well...none really. I have to try their complimentary BMW car service next time too. We just simply ran out of time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beach47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June, 2011 with my husband and our 16 yr old daughter for 6 nights in the Concierge/club level. I cannot say enough about how worth every penny it was to pay the extra and stay on this level. From the food presentations throughout the day, to the service and comfort that you received, it was the perfect. The lounge itself is very spacious and has beautiful views. There were times when we didn't want to stay in our room, but didn't want to go out either and this lounge provided a place to either read, go on the internet (free wi fi), or even chat with other ppl. The food was also very tasty and we ended up only eating one main meal a day because they provided for everything else. The rooms and bathrooms were extremely spacious and very comfortable. The service was very good. They staff was extremely hospitable and accommodated our every need. The spa was very nice as well. The location was very convenient. You can walk quite a few places from here. Otherwise, they have complimentary cars to take you places as well. All in all, this was a great hotel and highly recommend it, especially the club level.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Metropxp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on business. Had nothing to do with selection and it was direct billed, so I'm not even sure how much it cost, but it was awesome. Good sized room, comfortable work space and the bathroom is huge. All the amenities and service I expect when I stay at a Fairmont (one of my favorite hotel brands). It's right on the waterfront, so great views. The only real complaint, but this is with most hotels frankly, is why install HD TV's, but only have a handful of HD channels. If you are going to install HD, get TV service that has a ton of HD channels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday Stay”
Reviews.Author: ACE_2011
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for my wife and I to celebrate a special occasion. From drive-up, check-in all the way through to check-out, the service was wonderful and the property top notch. We had a harbor-view room on the 17th floor with amazing views of the north shore and stanley park. The room was beautiful - the right combination of luxury, comfort and high-end details made the stay very enjoyable. The staff, including front desk, bell staff, concierge, lounge servers and especially the valet team did a great job. Take advantage of the drop-off and pick-up service in one of their fleet of luxury vehicles if you get a chance - very convenient. Can't say enough how much we enjoyed our stay. We will definitely be back as often as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a special night”
Reviews.Author: NVanTraveller
Reviews.Content: My guy and I went for one night to celebrate our anniversary - we splurged on a Signature King room and could not have been happier - there was a small private outdoor deck so we could sit and drink wine looking out over the beautiful view. Jet bathtub is big enough for two, and has enough room on the sides to carry your wine with you for a relaxing soak. Beautifully appointed, very comfortable bed, we had room service twice and were very pleased with the meals. Will go again next year :)

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: roxhills
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights on the Gold Floor of the Fairmont Pacific Rim last June before our Disney Cruise and we are still talking about how superb the experience was. Catherine Nolan and the Fairmont Gold team went above and beyond to make sure every detail was taken care of. We had a pet fish on loan for our stay which my kids loved. The breakfast and snacks were of the highest quality (and the week on the Disney Cruise made all 6 of us long for the Gold Floor Breakfast). The kids loved the pool and having snacks on the patio overlooking Stanley Park. After our cruise ship returned to Vancouver, we went back to the Fairmont to store our bags for the day because we had an evening flight home and the entire staff from Mark at the Bell Desk to the Gold Floor concierge team welcomed us back, allowed my husband to work from the lounge while we toured the city, and made sure that taxis were ready, with our bags inside, when we came back to the hotel to leave for the airport. We travel quite a bit and really enjoy nice hotels and the Fairmont Pacific Rim has raised the bar quite high.

Reviews.Title: “Olympic Suite or should I say Olympic Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: DJWYVR
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Fairmont Pacific Rim recently. I've been down several evenings for their live entertainment and Raw bar in the Lobby but this was my first stay. I live in Vancouver so they were able to send the BMW to my house to pick me up and take me to the hotel. This is a great service. Friendly driver who was right on time. When I got to the hotel I was pleasantly surprised to hear that I had been upgraded from my booked suite to the Olympic Suite. A specialty suite on the Gold floor. You entered this massive corner suite through 2 large wooden doors. The Suite was Olympic themed with many special touches. On display in the suite were an actual Olympic torch, a Sydney Crosby signed Team Canada Hockey Jersey, a pair of the famous red mittens under glass, enlarged photo's of the Team Canada womens hockey team in celebration of their gold medal performance, and a hockey stick and puck under glass. (pictures attached) Other little touches were. Olympic ring throw pillows on the bed, stuffed Olympic mascots, and a selection of books written about the games. (My favorite being written by John Furlong entitled "Patriot Hearts".) If you ever have a chance book this suite. Amazing views of the ocean, North Shore mountains, Coal Harbour, and Stanley Park. I have nothing bad to say about this world class hotel. Location, Location, Location.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: SalernoCalgary
Reviews.Content: There simply isn't a better hotel in Vancouver! In fact, it's easily one of the top hotels that I've ever stayed at. I travel a lot for business and pleasure and this property is absolutely top rate. The customer service from the front doors to your room is nothing short of spectacular. The staff is very attentive and friendly - and it's not the forced type of "friendly". You genuinely get the sense that the staff truly cares about making your experience memorable. The rooms are amazing - everything is touch controlled, beautiful use of marble in the bathrooms and every creature comfort has been thought of. The main lobby is so welcoming. Lots of areas to have a drink or a light snack and they always have live music. Once you sit down, you never want to leave. The hotel is in the Coal Harbour area. Easy access to lots of wonderful restaurants, a walk along the ocean or a short hike to Stanley Park. I know there are other great hotels in Vancouver but the Rim is in a class by itself.

Reviews.Title: “I've never stayed anywhere that's better ...”
Reviews.Author: 0567cg
Reviews.Content: I travel alot. I've stayed in lots of hotels. I always try to find the nicest places. I'm willing to pay for nice accommodations. So far, no place has surpassed this one! Reserve a Signature Suite. It costs quite a bit, but it is worth every penny. The rooms are fantastic. The view is breathtaking. The service is unsurpassed. The Fairmont Gold service is also unmatched. My only complaint, as some other commenters have noted, would be regarding the BMW hotel car service. They don't seem to want to go anywhere that you want them to take you. The car seems to sit unused alot in front of the hotel. Don't count on this service and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in vancouver”
Reviews.Author: BellevueJennifer1
Reviews.Content: Did a weekend trip with friends, stayed on the Gold level (20th and 21st floor)-not that much more and you get breakfast and snacks throughout the day + your own lounge and service. Spectacular views and excellent service. I travel a lot and this is by far the best hotel I have stayed in. The entertainment in the lobby level lounge was excellent as well. Spectacular rooms, very modern and new.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL DREAMS ARE MADE OF!”
Reviews.Author: ELLE T
Reviews.Content: Spent an afternoon and night at this magnificent latest hotel in downtown Vancouver. Spent a few hours at the rooftop pool, saw the beautiful suite Tom Cruise had during the shoot of one of his movies, spent a few hours at the Willow Stream Spa where I pampered myself by having a terrific 90-minute massage. Enjoyed a beautiful Signature Room with a view of the Convention Centre and the harbour. What a wonderful way to end a vacation especially since this was a gift from my son! I highly recommend this hotel, it is perfectly located in downtown Vancouver yet, in your room, it is peaceful and very relaxing. I will definitely return to this terrific hotel where service, comfort and customer service is a top priority.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NorthBayTraveler62
Reviews.Content: Very cutting edge technology- tv screen in bathroom mirror! Great service and great location with water view. East access to the waterfront. Outstanding, although brief stay. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Willow Stream Spa at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: TW501
Reviews.Content: I spent Saturday afternoon at the Willow Stream Spa and was not dissappointed. After a relaxing steam and hot tub, I had a facial that was excellent! The staff are very professional and polite and the facilities are beautiful. I will definately be back for more pampering!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great service”
Reviews.Author: BTMJ
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this Fairmont. Though not cheap, for downtown Vancouver and its great harbor location, the value is certainly good. We took advantage of their 3 for 2 special so paid for only 3 of our 4 nights. We originally had booked a Signature View King room, but once we arrived we realized that in order to enjoy the view we'd have to be in the bathroom in the tub the whole time! We can only bathe for so long. =) And the balcony that we had been promised (by Fairmont's head reservation office) was not there. So we called the front desk and they kindly offered to move us to a harbor view room with a deck, so we got to choose between the two. The bathroom wasn't as fancy, but it was certainly more useable space for us. The hotel is ultra-modern and comfortable, with great pay-per-view and room service options. They surprised us with chocolates and a card for our anniversary, nice touch. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Now this is what I'm talking about!”
Reviews.Author: schneeballe
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this beautiful, new hotel in downtown Vancouver this weekend. From the moment we arrived, the staff were remarkable. They were very efficient, friendly and helpful. Even thought we arrived early (12pm), they were able to get a room for us right away. The hotel lobby is stunning and has a modern, Scandinavian vibe to it. There is a lobby lounge with a spacious seating area and it had a great, live band each evening. The room was gorgeous! It had plenty of dark, wooden accents and a modern feel. Everything was automated: the blinds, the lighting etc. You could set the lighting to a few different settings to create various moods in the room. The bed was very comfortable and had nice white linens. There was a little table and two chairs by the window. The window was basically floor-to-ceiling and allowed an amazing view of Vancouver. We had a nice view of the harbour where the cruise ships dock. The bathroom was great! A huge, deep bathtub surrounded by marble. There was a separate shower with a rain-fall style shower head plus an additional handheld shower head. The toilet was in a separate room with a sliding door. Again the lighting in the bathroom was automated so it could be set on groom (brightest), spa (dimmer) and night (very faint) or turned off completely, of course. I loved that there was a TV inside the bathroom mirror! I liked watching some TV while in the bathtub or getting ready in the morning. The room had other nice touches; pod-style coffee maker, nice flat-screen tv, safe, plush robes, turn-down service, Globe and Mail on your door in the morning, and nice toiletries. What else do I love besides the beautiful room? The breakfast buffet was really nice. It is $30/person and that seemed liked a great value for excellent food. Our friends went to the Pan Pacific for brunch and it was $50/person! In my opinion the ambiance at the Pacific Rim is much better, the staff far friendlier, and the setting less dated. We ate lunch at Giovanni's. It is a great cafe to pick up paninis, soup, salad, pastries, coffee and an extensive Italian wine selection. Everything is made in-house, from scratch. There is also Bella Gelateria that offers a great selection of home-made gelato with some unique flavours: Earl Grey, salted caramel, lavendar, chocolate and sea salt, along with many of the usual flavors. I have to admit, the chocolate/bacon gelato seemed like a crazy combination. It is perhaps a bit pricier than a typical gelato place but it is made in-house each day and you can look in to see where it is all made. The location is nice as this hotel is right near the water and close to the convention centre, Canada Place, Stanley Park and anywhere downtown. It was a thoroughly enjoyable stay! Highly, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: lazigirl
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Was fairly new when we stayed. Good sized room, great view over the water/convention centres. Great amenities. Loved the TV in the bathroom mirror- not sure how useful it is though!!. Connected underground to the convention centre which was useful. Quiet room, room service good- perhaps a bit more choice would have been good. Staff excellent Definately recommend

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights on the 21st and the 22nd floor. The food and service were impeccable. The rooms were very high tech and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-modern high-rise hotel in great harbor location”
Reviews.Author: bhencey
Reviews.Content: Don't mistake this for an old-world grand hotel. This is all glass, chrome, modern styling, etc. The rooms are a high-tech wonder...so many buttons and features you really do need to pay attention to the training. Pay the extra price and get a view of the harbor. The lobby bar is INCREDIBLY loud with live music - but once you get to the guest floors (all secured with keycard access) it is very quiet. Rooms are large with excellent bathroom and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rob3066
Reviews.Content: Able to checkin before arrival on line, having received an email from them, so was able to collect our keys immediately on arrival. We arrived by train at Pacific Central Station then caught the skytrain to Waterfont Station from there it was an easy 10 min walk, even with 2 suitcases. Its located about 200 metres from Canada Place, the cruise terminal we were to use the following day. We were completely taken aback on entering the hotel, because as you enter the building, its vast and really posh. Ground floor was a large area for a bar and a huge land mass for the reception. Our room was on the 19th floor which when we entered our room, we were gobsmacked, it was huge, furnished really well with push button electrics for lights, curtains, nets etc. Everything ultra modern, LCD TV & coffee maker. Bathroom was huge as well with blinds over the full height windows, enormously deep jacuzzi bath, shower etc. even a TV with remote in the bathroom. Push button electrics for lighting and the blinds which provided superb views 'to die for' over the harbour and the mountains beyond. Drinks in bar very expensive, min of $18 for a glass of wine. We went to a nearby reataurant for dinner and a cafe for breakfast, so cannot comment on food. Staff were excellant.....just could find nothing to be unhappy about, an absolutely lovely place. Yes, ok, not cheap, but once in a while, you have to treat yourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Total disappointment for a Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: shastaball
Reviews.Content: Wow - I am still dismayed by our experience at this 5 star hotel. I am a Fairmont Presidents Club member and have used the Fairmont Gold level service in Kona, Hawaii a few years ago. The service and amenities were so incredible, I'll hit a Fairmont whenever I can and get a Gold Class room if one is avail. After looking at the 3 Vancouver Fairmonts and despite the $600+ price tag per night, I decided to try the Pacific Rim. It was 5 star, looked magnificent and had a Club room avail. We got in about 7:30pm just as the evening drink/snacks were just winding down and we missed any opportunity to take advantage (bummer). To our dismay, our room was right next to the concierge/club room. Since I didn't receive any special discount, was traveling for leisure (unlike alot of the business folk I ran into) and am a Fairmont President's club member, I thought for sure they would have given us a better room. The view was all city - but not an attractive city view (directly facing some office building). We were exhausted so went to bed early despite all the chit-chatting going on outside our room at the concierge desk (well beyond 10pm). The noise did keep my husband from sleeping. In the morning, the coffee machine was on the fritz. We called to see if we were using it wrong and the concierge said she'd have some coffee delivered. 20 mins later we just dressed and went to the Club lounge and told the concierge to not bother sending the coffee. The poor overworked girl in the Club lounge apologized profusely, while the 2 concierge girls giggled at the desk. The morning breakfast on the Club floor was decent, but not the same level of service as Hawaii. In Hawaii eggs were made to order and the warm food selections were more abundant. Surprisingly, there was not a Wall Street journal available in the lounge either. Proximity to the water and Stanely Park was the only saving grace of this stay. We explored the city and were offered a late check out that we very much appreciated. The late check out was really the only benefit we received for our $600+ night. When asked if the BMW car service available for Gold rooms could take us to the train statione, we were told it was 'just outside their boundary' but 'a taxi will surely take you straight away'. I was flabbergasted! I'm quite certain the Fairmont Orchid folks would have stretched their limit for us. As I jumped in my taxi, I looked over at the Gold floor BMW sitting unused in the parking lot. I don't think it had moved all day. I smiled to myself ironically. I wouldn't be coming back here. On the flip side, the room was pretty well appointed, with electronic controls for everything and the in mirror TV in the bathroom was a hit:). Additionally, I could see a fabulous looking lap pool and the gym looked promising. I will never return to this Fairmont and probably none in the Vancouver metro. I will certainly never recommend it to anyone. My expectations for Fairmont hotels have been reset and I will not automatically gravitate to them when making hotel plans. I am so disappointed. The Cascadia was 1/3 the cost and I would recommend that (as well as the free breakfast buffet) over this Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kenmaestro
Reviews.Content: I am a fairly regular visitor to Vancouver and this trip was in town for just one night so decided to give the Pacific Rim a go. What a beautiful hotel and a perfect location beside Coal Harbour and a five minute walk into Gastown. An advance request for early check-in after the flight from London was taken care of without fuss - in fact upon stepping out of the taxi we were given our registration card and keys and then escorted directly to our room. Wow - what a view (see pic) - I had booked a 'Bay to Mountain view' and that's exactly what we had - superb view of Burrard Inlet, Stanley Park and the Lions Gate with West Van and Grouse Mountain in the background. The room was beautifully appointed - contemporary but practical, spectacular bathroom with '4 minutes to full' spa bath, separate shower stall and ample space. We used the pool following morning. This didn't appear to be attended and it was slightly odd not to have any locker service but maybe we missed something here. The lobby, coffee shop, restaurant all excellent. I would love to be able to stay here again, next time for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel and Excellent Staff. Highly recommended...”
Reviews.Author: Craig1965
Reviews.Content: We spent a 4 days at the Pacific Rim during August. It was our first time in Vancouver and the staff and amenities at the hotel was a large part of our enjoyment. Here's some of the highlights and a couple recommendations. Pool: The pool is heated to a very pleasant temperature. Our two daughters really love playing in pools but usually get cold fairly quick. The pool at the Pacific Rim is the perfect temperature for them to enjoy it and the surroundings are very pleasant for us to relax as well. Service was excellent and the decor and chairs very comfortable. Spa: My wife had a manicure and I went for a massage. Both were excellent and the lounge area that overlooks the harbor makes for a very romantic setting. There are chairs the shape of an egg (funny sounding huh...) resting at a slight angle and open on the front. Two people can comfortably sit inside with with a high amount of privacy like you are in your own little oasis. I recommend spending the money to use the spa or just get a massage and its free. It was a very relaxing get away in the middle of our trip. Its a nice place to get away from the pool areas if you want hot tubs that are more private and less people. Biking: The concierge was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They even have bicycles you can use so the 4 of use took a 2 hour ride around the park. The one aspect I would recommend is reserving them as soon as you arrive. That way you are sure you can have them at the time you are interested in. They recommended a drive up to Whistler and it was spectacular. Many short hikes and waterfalls along the way and in the summer there are numerous activities for the kids to enjoy in the ski area (rock climbing, etc). The rooms are well appointed, clean, and in very good condition. The hotel has some rooms with unique shapes so if you booked a suite you may want to call ahead. Some of them have the sofa in the same room as the bed and if you have kids that can be inconvenient. When I raised this to the hotel they were very helpful in offering to change rooms and really pleasant. The breakfast was excellent. More than I usually like to spend but it was well worth it to us. The staff was amazing too. Stopped by just the right amount of times, made hot chocolate for our girls and its the first place in a long time my wife enjoyed Eggs Benedict - they were very well made and fresh. Overall really spectacular and it really made our stay in Vancouver enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel. Terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: liznyny2010
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Pacific Rim in room 1201, with a terrific water and bridge view. As a female solo traveler, I look for location, security and good concierge services and, of course, a clean and attractive room. This hotel met all my requirements +. Firstly, the room was gorgeous. I want to live in the bathroom! The hotel is perfectly located, a few blocks from the Sky Train, right next door to the Vancouver Tourism office (which was great), across the street from the Seaplane Terminal and Canada Place (where all the tour and local buses pickup) and across from the beginning of the bike path to the Stanley Park seawall. An added convenience was the food court/mini mall next door, for quick coffee at Tim Horton's, some sushi or a taco, if I didn't feel like going for an upscale meal. If you are a member of the Fairmont President's Club (free), you can reserve the BMW bicycles for three hour rides, which I gladly did (the ride around Stanley Park is a must). The hotel valets also have BMW SUV's, which if available, can drop you off to your destination in town (which was great!) The concierge staff was terrific. Ivonne and the tall blonde fellow during the day (forgive me for forgetting his name) were wonderful. The front desk staff was great, too, running over to help you if the concierge desk was busy. Also enjoyed having the cafe off the lobby and the gelato shop. Just a great vacation. Thank you, FPR. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: PhelpsRoad
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Pacific Rim in Vancouver is a fantasitic luxury hotel. It is modern, it has excellent views of the water, and it's in a great location. The hotel has bikes availible for riding around the city. We took advantage of this and rode the whole seawall around Stanley Park. The pool is set on the sixth floor, outside and overlooks the new convention center. It is chic and peaceful at the same time. The service was excellent from the time we opened the car door to the time we checked out. The only two negatives, were the breakfast included in the room rate did not live up to the same standard as the hotel and also included in our room rate was a "welcome gift" which was not in the room when we arrived and we never received the gift during our entire stay. While a "welcome gift" is not something I would care about, it was something that was supposed to be included with my rate and was not. Therefore, it was disappointing. Overall, our stay was amazing and it was certainly someplace we would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSelect
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. Couldn't really fault it in any area. We had never been to Vancouver before (and buy the way I seriously could live in Vancouver, what a city) the concierge was excellent, the room was brilliant. We ate out each night of our 5 nights in the hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our time

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kups23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while in town for a wedding and absolutely loved it. The room was perfect with an amazing view of the water. The staff were all fantastic and the hotel was close to shopping and stanley park.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: scott r
Reviews.Content: Was there with my family. Bicycles when available, close ride to Stanley Park, and city center. Best Hotel In Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ActiveTraveler1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at probably half dozen luxury hotels in Vancouver over the years (we live about 1 hour south in the US). A decade ago, it was difficult to find such hotels, but over the years several new ones have opened up. In our opinion, the Fairmont Pacific Rim is far and away the finest of all of them (including several other Fairmont properties). This hotel offers full services, a beautiful location, clean, well designed rooms, and a top notch staff, interested in making your stay an enjoyable one. The location is terrific. Of course, you will pay for such luxury, amenities and attention. We decided on the Fairmont Gold floors and were more than impressed with the professionalism of the staff there. This also allowed us to get a room with unbelievable views of the harbor, float planes, etc. Provided you have the opportunity and it fits your budget, we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay with an awesome view”
Reviews.Author: dennycrane888
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel. The first time was in July last year during the Vancouver Jazz Festival. This time we missed the Jazz Festival, but there's always something going on in Vancouver during the Summer months. First of all, the view from our room on the 19th floor was outstanding. We had a panoramic view of Coal Harbour, overlooking Stanley Park and North Vancouver. The early morning sun shining on the water and the glow of the late afternoon sun, was just mesmerizing. Our room was top notch. As has been posted, there is a modern aesthetic which we really liked. All the light switches and draperies were controlled electronically. The bathroom has a big mirror with a tv in it. When you switch off the lights, a very low level nightlight glows under the counter as an aid in case you need to get up in the middle of the night. The bed was extremely comfortable and the linens were good quality. All the finishes were just top notch. This is how a luxury class hotel should look. The service was also top notch. From the valets to the front desk to the household staff, everyone performed their tasks pleasantly, efficiently, and with a smile. I was almost embarrassed to show up in my el cheapo rental car, set among a sea of Bentleys, Ferraris, and Porsches parked out front. The valet staff was great. As long as we called down first, they had the car waiting for us by the time we came downstairs. Despite the fact that we missed the Jazz Festival, there is still nightly live music at the lobby bar entertainment area. The space has a natural resonance that is ideally suited for jazzy type music. Our only disappointments were that the coffee and desert were very mediocre. As for the location, it can't be beat. You are right in the heart of everything. The waterfront is right there. Canada Place is right there. Stanley Park is a short distance. Robson Street is a few blocks away. Or you can zoom across the Burrard Street bridge to the Kitsilano neighborhood (great walking street for shopping) or Granville Island. I give this place 5 stars. I've been all over the world and stayed at some pretty fancy places. This Fairmont is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views + amusing lighting features”
Reviews.Author: violetvale
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights (Fri, Sat, Sun) in August and chose the Pacific Rim based on Tripadvisor reviews. I arrived at the hotel at 7:30am and when I asked if I could store my bags, I was told that my room was ready and I could check in right away. I picked my room specifically for the view. It was a harbour and mountain view room on the 14th floor and was quite expensive (for me), but the view was worth it. I stayed up later a couple nights just looking out the window, watching the lights on the harbour and the Lions Gate Bridge. From my room I could also see the pool, so I could go swimming when it was empty. The lighting features in the room were fun to play with, there's "welcome" lighting, "spa" lighting, "relax" lighting, etc. The usual Fairmont Miller Harris toiletries are provided, plus bath salts. And for some reason, I got 3 (!) bathrobes. The location was good: about 15-20 minutes' walk from Stanley Park (it sounds far, but it's a scenic walk along Coal Harbour), & maybe 3-4 blocks from Waterfront Station, which connects directly to the YVR airport. There's a Cafe Artigiano for most excellent coffee about 2 blocks away, and a Japadog stand about a 7-minute walk along Burrard.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest City Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: jesslin114
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in the beginning of September. The location is fantastic, it overlooks the harbor and you can walk to Stanley Park in about 15 minutes, right along the water. The hotel itself is beautiful, especially if you prefer a modern aesthetic (which we do). The rooms are spacious and the room we stayed in had a lovely view of the harbor...well it was a partial view because we were on the 7th floor which looked out onto the roof of the convention center, which has a lot of wild grass growing on top. But the water was visible if you looked to the right and the mountains in the distance, and we were fine with that. The bed is super comfortable, but it is a very technologically advanced room. The lights are controlled by touch pads, which did get confusing in the dark because the text is not illuminated and there are at least 6 buttons. There is a TV in the mirror in the bathroom, and the curtains are also controlled electronically. It took a little time to get used to, but it made us feel very fancy. The shower is fantastic, it has both a rain shower head and also a handheld, and you can turn on both at the same time. Ahhh. The staff is very friendly - the guys running the valet parking checked us all in, even before we got our luggage out of the car, which was very convenient. The concierge was really helpful in making last minute lunch reservations for us at Cardero's the first day. The lobby gets pretty crowded at night, a lot of people come there for drinks and events (there were a couple weddings) and there is a gelateria that is attached to the lobby. So, if the staff does not recognize you as a guest and you are coming in at night, they won't be as nice...until you say you are staying there and then the service turns on high. They also have a car that can shuttle you around downtown or even to the airport, and I believe it is free of charge (though we never used it because we had a car). Highly recommended for people wanting a luxury hotel in Vancouver, and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: goumetcruiser
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Pacific Rim is in an excellent location near the waterfront right at Canada Place which is the embarkation point for cruise ships. We booked the Sailaway package which includes breakfast daily and transport for you and your luggage either to or from the port. While this hotel is pricey it sure is a delight! The design is subtle and cool with lmarble and natural wood,very contemporary with clean lines. The lobby has a large fire place open on both sides to give the space lots of warmth. The guests rooms are really nice with similar woods and neutral hues. The baths have a shower with a rain shower head and tv in the vanity mirror. Also a very nice feature is electronic drapes and touch panel controls for the lighting. The view of the harbor and mountains from our room was a real plus.It was fun in the afternoon to see the float plane take off. The real stand out at this hotel is the staff,incredibly helpful and not at all stuffy like some other deluxe hotels. The breakfast which includes the full buffet tax and gratuity was excellent. High quality ingredients including made to order waffles and omelettes. The gym is first class with high quality equipment and waters towels and tv screens at each station. Another major plus was the high speed wireless Internet included for loyalty club members.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PWortley
Reviews.Content: This is a quality hotel - excellent room, location, service, and breakfast. We stayed in a Signature Room on the 16th floor for a few nights in August 2011. This was relatively expensive, but well worth it given the large size of the room and amazing views over the harbour and the mountains which surround Vancouver (best viewed from the enormous jacuzzi tub in the bathroom). The room had extremely high quality fittings and was well soundproofed. Service was polished and the location, slap in the middle of the downtown area on the waterfront, cannot be bettered. The breakfast buffet was delicious and offered a wide selection of food. The swimming pool and patio area (with TVs, bar etc) are excellent for a city centre hotel. Even the hotel bar has a great atmosphere (which is not always the case!). Highly recommended for a luxurious stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: derbbs
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal in every aspect! Extraordinary rooms, service, location, staffand a very energetic bar scene. Their attention to every detail affords anyone a stellar experience and the essence of Vancouver's welcoming hospitality. Bicycles available on premises, wonderful food and a staff that is well versed and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Mothers Day weekend, bliss”
Reviews.Author: pammyvancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for the Mothers Day weekend, I started out at the Willow Stream Spa on Sat afternoon. Beautiful spa with outdoor terraces and meditation pods. I had a facial. One thing I would recommend is to allow at least 1-2 hours before or after your service to enjoy the amenities...outdoor hot tub with mountain views, eucalyptus steam room, full body showers and even cookies and tea. Giovane serves wonderful Napoli style pizza. We didn't eat dinner at the hotel but we did do brunch at the hotel. It was a special mothers day brunch so they really gouged on the prices....ridiculously priced. Good high end selection though. The hotel itself was really nice and modern, great architectural features....beautiful lobby lounge. Staff attentive, but not the quality of say the Fairmont Savoy in London. Swimming pool really nice. Spa treatment was good....attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Howard_Marilyn
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling a lot this past year on business. It's given me an opportunity to see the best and the worst characteristics of some of the better hotels in Europe and North America. This is the second time I've stayed at this property. I've stayed at other Fairmont properties but none is as memorable as this one because of its exceptional staff (everyone!). Friendly, helpful, understanding, knowledgeable, the list goes on. Of course the property is immaculate and beautiful too. We stayed in dbl queen room with a balcony overlooking the pool. It had a fireplace on the balcony which made it confortable at all times. The time before was a corner room with a view of the city and water. Breathtaking! We also enjoyed some quiet time in the spa area which was really nice relax away from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and would not return”
Reviews.Author: Mylo_Dallas
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was poorly designed and the hotel was too noisy. Poor front desk service but the valet staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of June for two nights. The service of the staff is outstanding - from the doormen to check-in and housekeeping. Since the hotel is still relatively new, the rooms and the common areas are in excellent shape. The rooms are wonderfully sized, with spacious and relaxing bathrooms. I appreciate the in-room Nespresso machines! I also availed of the free car (X5) shuttle provided to President's Club members. The gym is well equipped and the small cafe downstairs serves good food. The lobby lounge turns into a party atmosphere in the evenings, but it will not bother your sleep. I was surprised though that they did not recognize me despite having just been a guest two nights prior - a nice touch that would have been noticed at a Four Seasons. However, I would definitely return and stay at the Pacific Rim!

Reviews.Title: “Superb - and possibly the best views I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: Lulusmum
Reviews.Content: I can only add the same as already said about this hotel. Apart from a slight communication problem on arrival, the two separate stays we had here in August were fab. The rooms (Gold level) were on the smallish side but furnished with the very latest high-tech wizardry and the bed was divine. Turn-down service produced some delightful sweeties and the breakfast and appetizers in the 20th floor lounge were lovely. The ORU restaurant was an Asian version of Heston's alchemy. The ORU signature cocktail was fabulous and they even provided a 'birthday plate, with lit candle' for my special day. Would certainly stay again. Its also next to the best park in the world - Stanley Park, which is unbeatable/unmissable. The hotel pool/pool area is small and inadequate for the size of the property. No separate kids pool area so the inevitable screechathon if more than one kid in the pool. Its an honor-bar system in the lounge which, compared to other 'club' floors we stay on, is unusual (we normally get free drinks at this level). Still, for the view alone - a definite keeper.

Reviews.Title: “All the amenities anyone could ask for”
Reviews.Author: DRPETE24
Reviews.Content: Absolutely gorgeous hotel with beautiful views of the cruise ships and mountains. Super modern. Beds are like sleeping on a cloud. Minor negative----curtains and lights are all push button but the imprints on the dials are so faint you need a magnifier to push the correct button--a design flaw that could have been easily fixed. Once you figure out the correct buttons its nice to have curtains close and lights go off with 2 flips of the switch. Although expensive, we felt it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant 5-Star Hotel. Facility and staff are excellent!”
Reviews.Author: numbersgirl
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Pacific Rim is a fabulous 5-Star hotel conveniently located next to Canada Place. Our room was very comfortable, modern (there is even a TV in the bathroom mirror) and kept immaculately clean by an outstanding housekeeping staff. The view from our room was beautiful! Throughout our stay, all of the staff were excellent! Each staff member with whom we had contact was pleasant, informative and accommodating. Everyone at the concierge desk went out of their way to help us with any plans that we needed to make - dinner reservations, tours, suggested itineraries, transportation, etc. After only one day we were personally greeted by our names when they saw us enter or leave the hotel. The Paciofic Rim's location is great! From the hotel we were able to walk to the Seawall, Stanley Park, Gastown, Robson Street, public transportation, and a number of excellent restaurants. We had a wonderful vacation and would have loved to have stayed longer at the Fairmont Pacific Rim.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spotless, and exceptionally luxurious”
Reviews.Author: GreasyWheel
Reviews.Content: From the moment cross the threshold of this hotel, it displays luxury and modernity. I stayed here on business, and the hotel offers wonderful views, great bars and restaurants, and a perfect location. I will be returning for a two week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Fairmont Pacific Rim”
Reviews.Author: dash1_98
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel. Great, comfortable room (and bed). Very accommodating staff and concierge. Location is good especially for Stanley Park, and river front activities, Gastown. Nice pool and hot tub. small but nice fitness center. Very helpful concierge. Good restaurants at the hotel (the sugar coated cream puffs in the cafe are awesome). The gelato in the building is one of the best in town.. If you are a Presidents Club member free bike rentals and rides within town are a phenomenal value. Reserve bikes early and ride to Stanley Park. I have stayed in 4 Fairmont hotels now and the chain can be relied upon for excellent service and quality. Walk to the Cactus Club for good reasonable food (JD ribs were great).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: LaurK
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel! The reception staff were very fast and made myself and my partner feel completely welcome. We really enjoyed dining in the very swanky lobby lounge- especially because of their exceptional live music! Highly recommend going there for a drink. Also loved the wine and cheese plates in Giovane. Our server, Ainsley, gave us perfect service- she was warm and friendly, making us truly feel at home. Overall, the service in the hotel was exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, with stellar service that can compensate for any problems.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingWrench
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stay-cation/ weekend getaway for I and my wife. From the moment, we arrived we were treated very well and were made to feel that the experience was great. We chose to stay here instead of the Pan pacific due to the pool and we really enjoy the Fairmont level of service( we had obtained a rate that was equal for both which made the decision a no brainer). We were to attend 2 christmas parties over the same weekend and it was a perfect location to Canada Place and the downtown core. The room overlooked the water to the east , and had comfortable chairs for reading and admiring the view. The bed was soft, and what you should expect from a hotel of this level. I loved the fact that the outdoor pool was open in December and it made for a delightful afternoon to look out to the snowy North Shore mountains and have relaxing soak in the hot tub after a swim. They have an excellent complementary car service within the downtown core that we utilized, it is first come-first served and subject to a car being there. The only hiccup was one morning, when I and my wife were enjoying some time with out the kids, the Housekeeping staff let themselves in at 8 am without knocking and our "do not disturb" was on. After we called the front desk to let them know what happened, the Assistant Manager was excellent and truly apologetic. she did her best to make sure that we were well taken care of, for the remaining duration of our stay. A great place to spend some time away from the kids and enjoy the downtown of Vancouver. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: M7104
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in Vancouver and had never stayed a a Fairmont Pacific hotel before. Based on my experience of this hotel I would certainly check if there is a Fairmont in any city I visit in the future. Simply fantastic in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: RunnerMom123
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay at the Fairmont Pacific Rim, following an Alaska cruise. The hotel is clean and modern; the staff is friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Fairmont city hotel there is”
Reviews.Author: spenclo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at almost all of the Fairmont properties as well as lots of Ritz Carlton's and Four Season's and the Fairmont Pacific Rim is one of my all time favorite. The hotel is wonderfully designed and is a great location near the harbour. We have 2 kids ages 8 and 6 and they love the Fairmont Pacific Rim as much as we do. The staff are wonderful and no detail goes unnoticed. I highly recommend this Fairmont property, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: kawarthas1
Reviews.Content: From the time we pulled up in our car until the time we left we felt so welcomed and at home here. The staff was friendly, courteous, and went out of their way at all times. Especially Patrick and the other valet parking attendants who were so personable and always took a moment to chat with us. They made sure we had bottled water and juice boxes, and that our children had fish food to feed the goldfish out front. We spent 6 nights here, the first three in a Fairmont room and the last three in a Signature suite. The basic rooms are modern, with a beautiful bathroom and separate shower. Our kids loved the TV in the bathroom mirror. Beds and pillows are very comfortable. To avoid obstructed views make sure you are on a higher floor. The pool area can be noisy since it doesn't close until 10 p.m. so if you are travelling with younger children the sound can be an issue on the lower floors overlooking the pool. One night there was still music playing and people noisily swimming after 11 p.m. I would have been content to stay in our 2 queen harbour/mountain view room, but we had to upgrade to the suite since the hotel was sold out for all other room categories for the last three nights of our stay. The suite was a bit over the top for us, huge, 1200 sqare feet, with a separate bedroom, two bathrooms and a living and dining area. It had a balcony with a table and chairs, and an incredible view. I found it a bit strange that a room that size would have a microwave but not a fridge other than the small bar fridge, but they were happy to provide one for us. We did have one issue with our duvet not being clean but the problem was quickly corrected. The pool area is outdoors but chairs were always at a premium in the afternoon....could be nicer if they added more loungers. Never saw anyone using the private cabanas. The lobby had live entertainment each evening but drinks in the bar are very expensive. We loved the coffee and thin crust pizza at Giovanes. Breakfast in the hotel was excellent, and the servers were amazing, we enjoyed talking to them every morning. Special thanks to Minho, John and Sherry, our favourites. We loved how the hotel was within walking distance to the seawall to Stanley Park, Gastown and Robson St. for shopping. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated for the price”
Reviews.Author: pranzieri
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from the Pacific Rim. It's a very contemporary hotel. I really appreciated the style of the lobby and restaurants, but the rooms were a bit too contemporary for my taste. I am not a big fan of wooden walls which caught my attention. The electronics in the room were state of the art and the in room movie selection was excellent. The room was very comfortable in size and amenities. The big thing you need to know is exactly where your room faces. We paid for an upgraded room and we had a completely obstructed view of the water and mountains, however, the reservationist told us we had a grat room. Fairmont does offer nice complemtary bikes and it is located right on the waterfront with walking and biking roads right outside the hotel. You are also in walking distance to the water taxi and train station. Overall, we thought the hotel was nice, but $500/night for an upgraded room (not suite) was a bit pricey for what we received. If you are able to find a deal for your stay, I would try it out. Lastly, there are several different areas within walking distance which we walked and rode through just about all of them. Gas town is one of them and they often recommend you check out. I am pretty adventurist, but the people living and walking in the gas town neighborhood are a strange crowd especially if you you are looking to avoid drug users/dealers, homeless, and the mentally unstable.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Aloha3080
Reviews.Content: We are regular Four Seasons guests and could not stay there because the hotel had no vacancies. So we decided to try the Fairmont Pacific Rim and we are very happy that we made this choice. We stayed on the Fairmont Golf floor and were most pleased to experience complimentary appetizers that were served in the Gold lounge. An amazing variety and wonderful selection of beverages too. The rooms are beautiful and spacious! The reception desk employees were friendly and most helpful. Another bonus to staying on the Gold floor is that breakfast is also complimentary and offers a wide selection of breakfast choices. Overall, my husband and I were thrilled with our stay and plan to return to the Pacific Rim at the end of August. Well done Fairmont, Vancoulver should be proud!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels EVER!”
Reviews.Author: robwat23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best ones I have ever stayed at. The rooms were incredible. Location the best. Amenities top class luxury. BMW car service was a nice touch of class. Concierge was extremely helpful, friendly, and accomodating. I am already planning my return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...”
Reviews.Author: Iceman73
Reviews.Content: We were hosted by my organization for 3 nights at this amazing property for a award ceremony and what a place this is...It's right on the waterfront /harbor and the room we had gave us an amazing view of the Canada Center and the Convention Centre too. You could sit in the balcony for hours and watch the skyplanes take off for Victoria or see the gigantic cruise ships roll in with their greying travelers. Fairmont Pacific Rim is a fantastic hoel with great service, nice plush rooms and gadgetery to make you smile. An iPod docking station instead of a regular alarm clock..TV in the bathtub facing mirror, remote controlled curtains and a nice big TV. I think this is the best hotel to stay in if you are loaded and want to chillax in Vancouver. Especially loved their bar and restaurant in the lobby. Perptually packed and lively crowd made it look like a very happening place. We landed there on the night the Kanucks won their second game against Boston and the lobby was rocking like crazy with couples partying dancing and enjoying themselves. Loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the place to stay at while in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: katepg
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night at this hotel on our way back from Vancouver Island and can't wait to return for a longer stay. This is a very new hotel with spectacular views, luxurious amenities, exceptional service and very convenient location in downtown Vancouver next to Canada Place. Our dinner at Oru was also excellent - interesting fusion menu with various Asian dishes and good wine selection. Our room was on the 20th floor (Gold club level) so we were offered complimentary breakfast served on the same floor. The selection was way beyond our expectations - selection of fresh juices, amazing breads and pastries, fruits, cereal, oatmeal, boiled eggs, smoked salmon etc etc. We are looking forward to our next visit to the beautiful city of Vancouver and the Fairmont Pacific Rim.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible concierge service”
Reviews.Author: Meda_C
Reviews.Content: we arrive in Vancouver from a cruise and asked the concierge from the hotel to organize the transfer for us from the harbour to the hotel and a city tour.But the driver didn't come to pick up us and we were waiting him for 45 minutes. After this time we took a taxi that costed 4.2 dollars.-the hotel was at 2 blocks from the harbour. The offer from the hotel -only for this transfer was of 120 dollars!!!!! And even so the driver didn' t come. And for the city tour they asked 450 dollars for 3 hours.After we arrived at the hotel the concierge told us that the driver is waiting for us and we have to pay penalties of 280 dollars for not meeting him and because we didn't want to go on the city tour with this driver.it is unbelieveble!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Trendy Hotel to Stay in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: avalon99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 3 children. The sky deck suite was beautifully decorated and well appointed. Fabulous highend ensuite bathroom and second BR. Kids loved the TV in the mirror! Staff very attentive. Room service prompt. Great food. Fabulous concierge. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel but the Willow Stream Spa Reception Staff was like a BIG BLEMISH ON BEAUTIFUL SKIN”
Reviews.Author: whistlerhost
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on two occasions (November and December 2010). One was during a conference at the new Vancouver Convention Centre when it was more convenient to stay here than drive home after long conference session days. The other time was for our Corporate Christmas party. Both times were perfect and everyone was fantastic. The catering team was absolutely outstanding. It was so smooth that I have already confirmed our return. The reason for this review is to give heads up to all about the Spa. I gave myself birthday present (July 2011) - a whole afternoon at the spa enjoying a couple of services. My aesthetician, Irina was fantastic. BUT THE RECEPTION STAFF AT THE SPA WAS A LIKE A BIG BLEMISH ON BEAUTIFUL SKIN. They should take lessons from the hotel front desk where they are efficient and friendly. Not cold, inaccurate and artificial. Unfortunately, I will go back because of the quality of the aesthetics and the spa's wonderful surroundings. I just cringe at the thought of checking in/out. We gave away 10 gift cards to the spa to some of our guests at our Christmas party. Usually, people send thank you cards or a thank you email after a wonderful experience. I haven't heard back...

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: TezzaBails
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave me a great impression from the moment I stepped out of the taxi with three porters ready to grab my bags and escort me to the check in counter.Once I was checked in I had a staff member take me up to my room and he explained everything and even pointed out the television built into the bathroom mirror -yes that's right the technology they had was incredible.The location of the hotel was simply brilliant being located right in downtown Vancouver and adjacent to Canada Place where all the international cruise lines leave from.Every staff member was so helpful and there was not any thing that I could fault about the place.The buffet style breakfast was magnificent and just the thing that we needed at the start of our 15 day insight vacation trip across Canada.Thank you Fairmont Pacific Rim you have left an everlasting memory I will always treasure and hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBrits
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel, fantastic staff. A special thanks to David the concierge who helped with our plans, and to Cherie a wonderful server and to the outstanding doormen and valets who greet you so warmly. Everyone greets you by name when possible and the service is outstanding. Good job Fairmont with your training and selection of staff. Also, best hotel shower ever. Great beds and we had a lovely room. Thank you for making a special occasion even more special. Any minor hiccups were too tiny to bother with and were also handled immediately. To the angry man who complained at breakfast I wish I could have told him to relax and chill out because he had nothing to complain about! Keep up the good work and I will recommend your hotel and your city to everyone. Thanks Join Presidents Club to get free Internet. Also, wonderful high tech features in every room including integration with HDTV for photos and presentations

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect location, Perfect Room....just perfect perfect perfect”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the last hotel I stayed at on my recent trip with the Rocky Mountaineer train journey. Check in was a breeze - staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I stayed in the Deluxe Harbour Mountain View room and when I selected "Daytime" on my little control panel - the drapes opened to a perfectly lovely view of a Crystal cruise ship docked in the harbour. The bathtub was amazing - such a treat after walking all over the city that day. The elevators had to be the quickest I have ever seen.. never waited more than a few seconds for a elevator. I have never stayed in a Fairmont property that I didn't like and this hotel is keeping with the top notch service. The location is perfect - close to Gastown and wonderful Robson street. Giovannis is a must - great pizza. For those President Club members - you will love the complimentary bicycles to visit Stanley Park - the BMW car service which is also comlimentary within the city (restrictions do apply) - wifi service. The bed was soooo comfortable - I can see why guests go online to buy the bed/linens. I highly recommend this hotel for business + leisure or any reason at all. Keep it up Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FF13
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience in a Fairmont Hotel and we were not disappointed. The Pacific Rim is a new facility located across the street from the Convention Center and the Olympic Torch. It is a short walk from the waterfront and the seaplane terminal. It is also convenient to local tour buses that depart on drop-on/drop-off tours of the city. (Take the Stanley Park bus tour if you can only do one.) The cruise ship terminal is also very close. The concierge and bell staff were all excellent. Taxis are quick to respond. Outstanding buffet breakfast if a little expensive. Ultra modern rooms. Overall, a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: libbywithnall
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night post Alaskan cruise. We were able to check into our suite at 9am - which was very appreciated. Our suite was STUNNING. Definitely one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in. The spa was unusual - in that it was a sit in square bath - and the view great. Staff were wonderful.The location was great. And the view from our room spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, but bring your wallet, and skip the restaurant completely”
Reviews.Author: robS101
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice fairmont property with spectacular views of the harbour and mountains of the beautiful city of Vancouver. For a treat we stayed for two nights and had an upgraded room with a wonderful view. The reception was warm on arrival, and the bed was great, as are all Fairmont beds. We arrived after 7pm and the lounge had "reserved" signs on many of the tables so there were no available seats at all there, even though there was space, and the wine-bar (really a lunch counter spot by day with a different menu at night) had plastic chairs to sit on, with a cafeteria feel that doesn't suit a Fairmont property, so we tried the restaurant. The restaurant was not value for money at all - going elsewhere is easily done as there are numerous restaurants just a few blocks away that could give you a much finer meal than we had for our $200. The atmosphere at the restaurant wasn't matching the hotel either. Every noise echoed around the stark floors and walls, and made it very loud and un-inviting. Just not an intimate dining experience at all. Room service was great, and we loved our room. My wife enjoyed her spa experience, and the location is fantastic, so overall it was enjoyable, it just needs to re-think the "wine bar", reserving the lounge tables, and frankly the restaurant is a complete miss.

Reviews.Title: “tasting the home away from home experience in Vancouver Beautiful British Columbia”
Reviews.Author: vantellcare
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at the outdoor pool with other families visiting on board to Disney cruise to Alaska, this hotel is right across the cruise ship terminal, me and my daughter tried out the Heron restaurant at the fairmont waterfront nearby , we had a lovely dinner, we would not know how lovely Vancouver is until we actually live in this beautiful hotel at our leisure time. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to everyone”
Reviews.Author: Em-trepid
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many, many 5 star hotels all over the world and this one ticks all the boxes. We were celebrating my husbands birthday and the staff went above and beyond to make our stay feel special. The suite was lovely with wonderful views. The lobby and bar area has a very energetic atmosphere and a real wow factor to the design. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Hotel - Elegant Design with Friendly and Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: rpgold
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Pacific Rim sits across the street from Vancouver's cruise ship terminal and has a lovely view across the water towards North Vancouver. The hotel feels very new and I wouldn't be surprised if it weren't less than two years old. We stayed in a Signature Room which gave us a few extra hundred square feet of living space, more windows through which to enjoy the view and a large plunge bathtub that we never ended up using. The room was very comfortable and very high tech. Electric controls for curtains, sheers, lights and just about everything else were at our fingertips. The room's desk also had a panel with assorted audio and video inputs (including S-video, component and HDMI) that were directly connected to the plasma tv and the stereo amplifier... very high tech indeed. Had I known, I would have been able to plug my laptop directly into the room's audio-visual system. The hotel is happening, particularly on weekend evenings. There is jazz in the lobby bar and young people by the score dressed up for a night out. It was noisy in the lobby, but kind of fun to return to the hotel after a day's exploring to find we were the only people in sight that weren't all dressed up. Despite the lively scene, our room was whisper quiet and we slept very well indeed. Particular mention should be made of the staff which delivers impeccable service yet remains very friendly and relaxed. They seemed more like the staff at a high end mountain resort hotel than a city hotel. They are very attentive and we felt exceedingly well looked after. We've been fortunate enough to stay at some pretty great city hotels around the world. At first glance, the Fairmont Pacific Rim seemed to be comfortably in the middle of the pack. However, with each passing night (we spent 3) we found our fondness for the hotel steadily increasing. Add the fact that they had a room in the fitness centre where we could adjust the heat and do our morning yoga practice, we were very happy indeed with our choice. No other hotel in the city (including the Four Seasons, Shangri-La and other Fairmont properties) could offer us this all-important amenity for us. Overall, we had a great visit and we wouldn't hesitate to stay again the next time we found ourselves in Vancouver. Enthusiastically recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Too cool for school ....”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls17
Reviews.Content: Ah so i feel a little like a party pooper , but as flash and slick as this hotel is after staying at the fairmont whistler (where we we got married) it was a little switch of pace and felt like a few things have been missed.. My now wife and i where on our wedding/honeymoon from Australia! We arrived from whistler latish and soon as we walked in , it was like pow .. modern , sleek and new.......but the welcome wasnt that warm and the music in the bar was too loud to hear the welcome if there was one .. The room was impressive modern and large and our room led on to a court yard and then on to the pool .. was gorgeous .. My fav was having a shower while watching the news in the tv that was set into the mirror ! We didnt have breakfast at the hotel but after ordering 1 bowl of vanilla ice cream and getting the receipt with a 23 price tag we decided not to ! There was no free internet anywhere in the hotel. Just up from the hotel is a little food court where you can get a cheap breakfast from one of many food chains . As a final say in all my reviews i say if i would stay here again .. i wouldn't stay here again for all of its modern style i think its a hotel trying to be "to cool for school i would have enjoyed the fairmont waterfront much more ..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: paulmac44
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel and doesnt really seem to be suffereing from too many of the "brand new hotel" growing pains. The service is very good, the food was excellent and bars very good as well. Location is superb with views of the harbour and nearby mountains spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nerad
Reviews.Content: This is probably the nicest hotel that I've ever stayed at. It is the little things that count and this place has it: new & fresh hotel (brand new around Vancouver Olympics), lovely pool deck, close proximity to downtown for work purposes. The room even had ipod hookup to allow you to play your favourite music throughout the room (and I'm not talking about the ipod-style clock radios you sometimes see in some hotels). The part I loved the most was the short run along the waterfront to Stanley Park with the ability to run/walk/bike along the beautiful seawall. Bring your running shoes! Access from the airport via Canada Line train is just a short walk along Cordova.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Fairmont in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: SeascapeScott
Reviews.Content: Beautiful modern rooms, amazing views, attentive and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girl Pampering get away”
Reviews.Author: hiyahVancouver
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend our annual girls get away in Vancouver this year and had a great time at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. Lot's of great shopping nearby, gorgeous views for walks (and then drinks) on the waterfront and the hotel was great. Loved the little touches like the TV in the bathroom mirror (we're girls and spent a lot of time there). The lounge was a fun place to hang out (but as expected the drinks were pricey), but the highlight was the the spa day. We'll be back for our 2011 trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Fairmont I've Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: threeiron333
Reviews.Content: Hotel is top notch. Rooms modern, clean and beautiful. Located at the center of action. Breakfast at the cafe was fantastic. I was debating between this and the four seasons which is my favorite hotel chain. I chose Fairmont, because I know it's a Canadian chain. This was every bit as nice as any four season I've stayed at. Highly recommend to anyone going to vancouver. Concierge and bell staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Our choice for travel in Canada”
Reviews.Author: chris528934
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the gold level floor which gave us afternoon drinks,canapes & b'fast in a gold lounge and gave access to our own concierge which was very useful. Rooms were ultra modern and extremely comfortable and hotel position was great. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Enjoyed all meals and the hotel even supplied their limo to take us to an appointment uptown. Every aspect of our stay was enjoyable and management need to be congratulated for providing an environment in which staff can give their best. Unusual requests were handled impeccably and with good humour and all staff on gold floor were soon calling us by name.Not stuffy,just a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It cannot be that good!”
Reviews.Author: croatiandude
Reviews.Content: I spent three night at the Fairmont Pacific Rim this July (2011) and it wowed us! From the electronic wonderland of the room (I was on the top floor) with its built in TV in the bathroom mirror, to the bathroom's SPA vibe and setup, to divine views and supple mattress, to outrageous on the premies restaurant and the lobby bar with live music to a beautiful outdoor pool - the hotel rocked me. On top of it all, the hotel's kitchen catered a black tie dinner for us and I had one of the only vegetarian dishes (no surf and turn for me) and all the people who observed the kitchen's creation with lobster, tofu and vegetables wanted to eat mine! Top of the pops! Exquisite stay! Superb staff! Romantic! Groovy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: chefdave
Reviews.Content: As you would expect another fantastic hotel run by Fairmont, if you are staying in Vancouver stay here I haven't got a bad word to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: jemuller
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Pacific Rim was one of the most beautiful hotels we've ever stayed at. The service was remarkable! The hotel was clean, had great restaurants to choose from, was in a great location with beautiful views and had a fabulous spa. We stayed in a corner harbor view room and the views were amazing. We would love to stay there again and will recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, gorgeous -- and cold and techy”
Reviews.Author: srs-seattle
Reviews.Content: Our overall impression is a beautiful, quiet, amazing hotel with an excellent staff. We felt welcomed and pampered. However...if a few things were simpler I'd love it even more. (Above all, as an aside, it is ridiculous that they charge for internet access.) For instance, in the bathroom, the toilet is in a solid marble chamber behind a heavy glass sliding door, and it is impossible to use it without everyone hearing everything -- much less not wake your partner. And I have to agree with others about the lighting; the bellman was careful to explain everything, but we experienced one light turning on simultaneously multiple times, another flashing on-and-off like a strobe, and drapes with a mind of their own. We'd absolutely stay there again, but it could be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in the universe - PERFECTION”
Reviews.Author: Sarasingh
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite hotel in the entire world. Each time I come here my heart explodes with pleasure. I have visited many times but was waiting until I had completed the most recent booking, as it was a two-night stay that included a trip to the in-house Willow Stream Spa. When you arrive at the hotel check that you are in the right one, as the Pacific Rim can easily be confused for the other Fairmont hotel next door. The Pacific Rim entrance is distinguished, among other things, by its fabulous Lobby Bar, which consistently plays excellent live music nightly. During our last visit the bar served as a venue for the Jazz Festival, so we paid a particularly long visit one Friday night there. There is a menu of “old-fashioned” (and I’m talking the olden-olden days) drinks which are very expensive and strange tasting. I tried one (bitter flower cough syrup, anyone?) but ordered a brown sugar mojito for the second round (f-ing BEAUTIFUL and PERFECT) and was blown away. On the Lobby level there is a flower shop (for your suite parties!), a bakery/lunch place, and a coffee bar. All are wonderful. One morning I went down for lattes and bought two giant cream puffs that were so indulgent the server actually tried to talk me out of them. Luckily I ignored him. Imagine a large, sugared donut shell ten times better than any Tim’s, and then fill it with like two cups of heavy sweetened whipped cream. Yeah, do that. Dude. OMG. Feeling guilty about that but also not (this is the Pacific Rim, pimpin’ ain’t easy) I decided to take a dip in the pool. Beautiful but not overbearing, the pool area is lined with the standard loungers as well as a small bar. Beyond the pool loungers, the area is rimmed with some Las Vegas style cabanas, complete with TV’s and bar service. They have to be booked and paid for separately, but none were used the day I went. The Willow Stream spa is a fully-equipped bliss centre. After being greeted at reception, you are led into gender-specific dressing rooms, which are lined with digital lockers. You are given a plush robe, a bottle of water, waterproof slippers, and usually a product sample of some sort. If you arrive a couple of hours early for your treatment (which I HIGHLY recommend), you’ll have time to try the giant eucalyptus steam room, the “experience shower” (only on the women’s side!), the indoor and outdoor lounges, and the co-ed hot tubs outside. They serve light snacks and beautiful teas, and citrus infused cold water. You can also stay and relax after your treatment. It’s totally amazing, absolutely the best spa I have ever been to. I had a Stress Relief massage, which was outstanding, but during another visit my husband and I had a couples treatment which included a mud wrap and a soak in a Japanese tub and that was really outstanding too. Treatments are really excellent value when you take into account how many amenities are available to you both before and after your appointment. During our last stay we had booked a spa package, and during our two night stay we were allowed unlimited access to the hydrotherapy and lounge spaces in the spa. It was so great to be able to begin and end each day with a steam, shower and hot tub at Willow Stream. There is a semi-private hot tub on the deck, just behind a rock wall, perfect for a romantic couples’ soak or a BFF bonding session. I have stayed in many different rooms at this hotel, including a couple of suites, and all are really gorgeous and modern. Everything feels new and clean, which is more than one can say for many hotels in the city. Beds are wonderful and comfortable, and some suites include a bubble-jet tub. Pool-view suites have TV’s in the bathroom mirrors! The stunning decks have wall mounted gas fireplaces, perfect for relaxing at night. Amenities and toiletries are high-end – don’t forget to use the provided bath crystals to soak in your bathtub! ORU Restaurant serves modern Asian food – you really must visit. It’s a bit expensive but worth the money. They also serve a fabulous breakfast buffet in the mornings (book the bed and breakfast package, it’s the best deal) complete with a cook-to-order omelette station, gorgeous pastries, and table coffee and drink service. Tips for the servers at breakfast are included in the breakfast rate, and they will graciously remind you of this when it’s time to sign the check. I absolutely adore this hotel. We are planning a visit in another couple of weeks and as many times as I have stayed here I know it will be special.

Reviews.Title: “One more night please!!!”
