Reviews.Author: Katzy61
Reviews.Content: This exquisite hotel is the best I have ever stayed in. When we checked in a bit early, our room wasn't early - would we like a complimentary cocktail in the lounge? Certainly! When our room was ready, we were shown up by an attentive bellman who provided us with all the needed instructions to 'work' our room. Oh, did I mention the upgrade to the 15th floor corner suite with a soaker tub deep enough to cover my head. The one with floor to ceiling glass on 2 walls overlooking Canada Place. Just stunning. The architecture and room furnishings are so stylish and functional. And then there is the staff - from the driver who drove us into town in the complimentary hotel BMW, to the server at breakfast who wrote us a list of suggestions complete with addresses, to the gorgeous girl who brought us room service, this is an experience that will long be remembered.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star but cold”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyHS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night at the end of an Alaskan cruise vacation. It is very modern and very big. The rooms are huge and the bathroom mirror/TV was a big hit with my daughter. The pool/spa area was small for such a large hotel. Beds are very comfortable.No free Internet which is silly considering how much this hotel is a night.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave the hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: Chubacca69
Reviews.Content: On a 5 week honeymoon and this was by far the greatest hotel we have ever stayed at. From the Nescafe Expresso machine, to mood lighting, to electronic drapes that open/close at the push of a button, to the jucuzzi, to the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, to the great view of Canada Place and the surrounding harbour. Oh ... and the service was good too! <I hope you got the huge understatement> Some even refused tips when requesting a jug of warm milk to go with our coffee. I was so impressed, that it was actually hard to leave. Truth be told, if I stayed one more night, they would have had to drag me away kicking and screaming. Oh ... and did I mention the cool Fairmont Umbrella's and the linen laundry bag. I want to go back ... The only downfaff was the price but as included in a package. I'm not complaining.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice While In Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Parlonny
Reviews.Content: In a city that boasts its fair share of Fairmonts (in fact there are several within mere blocks of each other, including historic Fairmont Hotel Vancouver – formerly ‘Hotel Vancouver’), Fairmont Pacific Rim is a relatively recent addition (just under 18 months old) to the line of luxury hotels and perhaps, arguably, one of the best hotels in the city. It is conveniently located downtown, just off Coal Harbor and other attractions like Canada Place – housing the Convention Center, the Olympic Cauldron, Vancouver’s seawall stretch and not to be missed Stanley Park. One thing you immediately notice upon arrival is the warm welcome by the bellhop receivers at the front entrance--smartly dressed in all black attire complete with fedoras and a welcoming smile—asking to help with luggage while directing you to the front desk attendants. Off to your right is as you enter is a lobby lounge and bar towards the back and, to your right sits the reception area and Concierge. On this particular stay check-in was pretty quick and efficient and we were able to get up to our rooms in no time. The hotel design aesthetic is the brainchild of Hong Kong born Canadian, James K.M Cheng (also responsible for the Shangri-La Vancouver and Tonronto) and is decidedly ultra-modern but functionally so. Rooms are well appointed and very spacious with either city or bay views and come equipped with all the standards, plus plush bedding, do-it-yourself coffee service by way of pretty smart looking Nespresso makers, expansive bathrooms with rain showers, TV in mirror, and luxurious bath products by Miller Harris. Oru, the onsite restaurant is a Pan-Asian bistro helmed by Executive chef David Wong who cleverly incorporates east and west flavors in his specialties. I’m a sucker for a nice breakfast spread and Oru’s is pretty much as good as they come. You have the choice to order a la carte or experience the buffet (which includes most things on the menu anyway). My recommendation: go for the buffet. It runs ‘roughly’ about the same amount, ~30 CAD (not terribly inexpensive, admittedly), as ordering a la carte, but with a better value in my opinion. For a grab-and-go option or a more casual alternative, check out bustling daytime café and nighttime wine bar, Giovane café which is also onsite. For a little R&R, the Fairmont Pacific Rim features a roof deck cabana lounge with a heated pool where you can take a plunge and order drinks pool-side till after dark, or for a more serene relaxing experience, try one of the services at Willow Stream spa. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and highly recommend this property. And, who knows, you may just run into a celebrity or two.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Jackswine1
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed at the service was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new hotel!”
Reviews.Author: evansemery
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for 2 nights before our trip on the Rocky Mountaineer. The Pacific Rim was highly recommended by our travel agent and it lived up to our expectations! It is very high tech and we had some problems dealing with the touch pads for everything including the TV in the bathroom mirror (loved this!). The small casual cafe downstairs was perfect for informal meals and free internet connection (not so in the rooms). Our room overlooked the pool and the mountains above, would have asked for a harbor view room because of the early/late noisy swimmers. The front desk (Dinera) were most helpful and professional. Concierge were also very knowledgable. Everything met our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay-cation!”
Reviews.Author: petey604
Reviews.Content: We are from Vancouver, and celebrated our wedding anniversary with a getaway in our own town. We enjoyed excellent service throughout our visit. When we arrived in our room there was a lovely plate of chocolate and fruit as a "happy anniversary" gift from the hotel (I had mentioned when I booked that we were going to be celebrating our anniversary). We were booked in a "deluxe harbourfront room" and the rooms are very beautifully designed and maintained. We looked Northeast, over Canada Place, and enjoyed watching the cruise ships leave for Alaska from our room. Though it was windy, we enjoyed our time at the outdoor pool--there are very nice lounge chairs set up around the pool and we enjoyed sitting after we had gone for a swim. We ran out of time this visit, but next visit I'll definitely book a service in the spa--there is a lovely terrace as part of the spa with outside seating and two hot tubs--it looked very inviting. We had a wonderful stay, and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Great staff, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CAH58
Reviews.Content: Lucked out and found the "bed and breakfast" deal for our reservation, which included 2 full breakfasts each day. We chose to have room service for these so that we could eat and get out the door. The food arrived at the chosen time, all was prepared well, and hot food was good and hot. The service staff were polite and efficient. Our room (2 queen beds, soooo comfortable!) was modern, comfortable and had plenty of space for our family of four. Lights and curtains were on a touch control system. Great once we figured it all out. The bathroom, quite large and modern, marble tile and a huge shower. There was even a T.V. in the bathroom mirror. (My daughter brushed her teeth watching cartoons!) We did not pay the extra for the water view but were not disappointed with the amazing city view. (Spent most of the day out and about with all sorts of water views) But the best thing about the Fairmont Pacific Rim is the staff. From the moment we arrived, we were greated and treated like kings. Smiling staff, (from the doormen to the in-room dining staff) tending to our every need, questions answered cheerfully, each genuinely interested and asking "How was your day?" Even though we had made many plans, read alot about Vancouver and brought maps and info, we needed and received help from the concierges for much of our sightseeing and outings. They gave us excellent advise, booking event tickets ahead of time and saving us from standing in ticket office lines. In hindsight, this alone made me so happy that we stayed in a "nicer" hotel. We took taxis, walked, biked and used the free shuttles (to Capilano and Grouse Mountain). We never did try the public transportation. The taxis were so convenient, parked and waiting outside the hotel. For about a dollar more than the bus, our whole family could come and go via taxi on our own schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Fairmont - Almost Great”
Reviews.Author: Bobandco
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, but don’t try and figure out the light switches in the rooms as they are so complicated that they defy logic. The front desk was not staffed when we arrived so it took about 10 minutes to begin checking in and finally they were having a party/rock concert in the little lobby that was just overbearing for such a small space. The views are tremendous and the rooms are large, comfortable, new, clean, modern. So on the whole we would go back if in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great View”
Reviews.Author: arjunlamba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 2 nights and we had a good experience overall. The USP of this hotel is its location. It is on the waterfront and you can see the mountains, coal harbor and stanely park form here. We stayed in a signature view room which had great panoramic views of the sea and the mountains. The room was big and so was the bathroom. The room had all the amenities one would want from a hotel of this kind. Service quality was good enough too but not great. The gym was a little bit of a disappointment as it didn’t have a great view and didn’t seem planned well. The lobby at nights turns into a party place with a very nice lively atmosphere. We didn’t eat at the restaurant but its comes highly recommended. The hotel is a bit pricey but the view is worth it I guess. Also another thing I would like to point out that the bell desk at all Fairmont hotels is very responsive and polite and that’s a big plus if you are travelling heavy. So full marks to them in that department.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Billyphx
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. It is truly a well run hotel. The property itself is incredible, but the staff made all the difference. The first tip I can give you is that you need to join the Presidents Club before you arrive. It is free and it entitles you to all kinds of free stuff. We got WiFi, the use of their bicycles and rides around town in their BMW’s all for free as Presidents Club members. The details…When we arrived we didn’t like the view from our room so we agreed to pay $20 extra for a room with a view of the harbor and mountains. It was worth it. The room (1808) even had a balcony. We had booked a bed and breakfast package which allowed us to have the breakfast delivered to our room each morning. Service was impeccable. The food always made it within ½ hour and they always picked up the plates right away too. Turn down service at night was also done really well. The room itself was super modern. As many other reviewers have commented, the lighting and electronics were impressive. It is uncommon to have an HDTV and we really appreciated it. The bed was perfect. The towels were a little lacking but not bad. The bathroom was phenomenal. The location of the hotel is incredible. It is right on the water front and very close to the shopping and Stanley Park. One day we used the Hotel’s BMW mountain bikes and we rode around the perimeter of Stanley Park. What an incredible day! We ate lunch at the lobby café, Giovane. It was very good and also convenient. We had dessert one night at the lobby/bar and it was also very good. The lobby itself has a really cool vibe. The Willow Springs Spa was awesome. My wife and I both had massages and we were both impressed. The spa facility is really nice. It has its own hot tubs and outdoor lounge area. When we decided to go to Vancouver we did a lot of research on where we should stay. There are a lot of choices and non are particularly cheap. Ultimately we decided to spend a little extra and we are glad we did. For that extra expense we got so much value!

Reviews.Title: “Modernity and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Honestray
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for business all week and had planned to take one day off. As a regular with Fairmont Hotels, Faimont staff had suggested to me to stay at the Pacific Rim. I was definitely impressed by the hotel. The best words that come to mind are Modernity and Luxury. I booked a Pool View Suite. It was spectacular. I had Vancouver friends for a drink and the kitchen was handy and we enjoyed the outdoor fireplaces. All and all, an excellent stay. I have booked a 3 day stay with my spouse later this year. I plan to come as often as possible. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Excellence - What A High End Stay Should Be...”
Reviews.Author: YVRme
Reviews.Content: I'll admit I'm a pretty tough reviewer...if there is a shortcoming, I'm not afraid to point it out. A recent and disappointing stay at another Vancouver hotel (not the Fairmont) on the expensive end of the spectrum made me appreciate all the more what the Fairmont PR provides. We are locals and have stayed at the Pacific Rim twice in the last year. The first time was to celebrate my sister's 25th wedding anniversary - we treated her and her hubby to dinner at Oru and a room so they wouldn't have to drive after dinner. We got a pretty good rate and booked a room for ourselves too. From check-in to check-out the experience was great - the staff are polished and professional without being snooty and were quick to respond to any request. The rooms are the very best of any I have stayed in...and I have stayed in many a high end hotel. Crisp, clean design, fantastic lighting and absolutely fabulous bathrooms. We had a room facing the harbour with floor to ceiling glass in the bathroom...in which we enjoyed the huge two person soaker tubs facing the mountains. I admit to arriving at the hotel stressed and harried from a horrible day at work, but a pre-dinner soak with a glass of wine and some chocolates had me melty and in the best of moods by the time we sat down at Oru. Bathtub bliss. The view of the harbour and north shore mountains is superb, even on a rainy day. The seaplanes do come and go below, which did not bother us, but if this is a concern, ask for a room on the northeast side instead of the northwest,. Northwest does get you a beautiful view of Stanley Park though. Kudos to the interior design team - this hotel is a visual delight without being fussy or overstated. The lobby and piano bar have the grand elegance a hotel of this stature should. Blackout blinds and mood lighting via switch controls in the rooms are a a nice touch. Not cheap, but if you are looking to spoil yourself, this is the place. Ask for a higher floor if traffic noise is a concern for you - also the views are much better. On our second stay we had a slightly different room with a less spectacular bathroom (but ultra-deluxe non-the-less), the tradeoff is that we got a walk-out balcony from which we could sip a glass and watch the sea planes take off and gaze at Stanley Park. Both were enjoyable - but in different ways. If I had to stretch to find a negative it would be that the Coal Harbour location doesn't have the density of cool shops and restaurants that a location like Yaletown provides within easy walking distance. It does get you the Stanley Park Seawall though - so it just depends on what experience you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place. Will return.”
Reviews.Author: SierraToGo
Reviews.Content: We made the decision to book on the Gold level, harbour view room. We were very pleased we did. This hotel is not where you go to save money so if you are trying to find a mid-priced hotel, this is not your place. It was pricey but we felt worth every penny. The room was one of the nicest ever. Great comfy bed, beautiful leather chairs facing the harbour, Nespresso coffee machine, gorgeous bath, nice linens, auto drapes, lights, View of Canada Place. Watched the ships come in and the sea planes land. Gold level lounge was very nice. Sitting out on the balcony watching the sun set having a glass of wine was beautiful. Nice breakfast in the am and fabulous food in the evening. You just can't top this experience in Vancouver. Plus, incredible location and great staff. Bellman will take you anywhere in the hotel's BMWs. 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Courteous...nothing short of the WOW factor”
Reviews.Author: 2Kolohe
Reviews.Content: Disney booked this hotel for my friends and I before our Alaskan Cruise. Being such simple people this was a WOW factor in our books. While none of us travel that often we were very impressed with this hotel from the first time we got out of our shuttle to the time we left we were treated with the utmost kindness, and being from the Aloha State this plays a big part. What did we like, well it goes something like this: 1. Bellhops were right on top of everything the moment we got out of our shuttle. 2. Lobby - OMG when we stepped inside the place was so immaculate. Our eyes were in amazement of the beauty and details. Marble throughout the area 3. Check in - thinking that our arrival was at 9:00am we didn't expect our room to be ready and hotel would hold our bags so that we could walk around the area. Much to our surprise our room was ready and we had the opportunity to freshen up after and early morning arrival. 4. Bell Woman (not man) - took our suitcases to our room and then proceeded to tell us everything about the room and how to work everything. Considering that the place is high tech, good thing she took the time to introduce us to all of the gadgets in the room. 5. Information - both in the room and at the front desk was great. Even told us where there was some good cheap eats in the area. 6. Bathroom - space, space and more space! Soaker tub, separate shower, amenities fit for a queen or king 7. Pool area - what a nice place to just sit and relax. Hot tub - great. 8 Security - best I have ever seen. You'll need a key card to activate the elevator when getting to your room or any other floor. Smart move! 9. Location - near Canada Place for cruise goers. Olympic Flame across the street. Convention Center across the street and a two minute walk to the other Convention Center located in the Pan Pacific Hotel. 10. Piano in lobby - take a good look, it's one of a kind Fazioli made in Italy at a whopping $225K. The sound it great if you're into listening to music while you drink. Now what didn't we like: 1. Internet service is not free! Come on guys! 2. We had to leave From the moment we entered this hotel to the time we left, every worker we encountered was incredible. Helpfulness every step of the way. No doubt that this is in fact a 5* hotel. If we ever have a chance to return to Vancouver the Fairmont Pacific Rim is where we will be staying. I can't say enough about this hotel. The workers were incredible! Too the staff, a big MAHALO from the Hawaii for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: nzmommy
Reviews.Content: We booked our cruise travel and hotel through our cruise line and they put us at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. We arrived by towncar from the airport and were assisted by the doormen in collecting our luggage from the car, and then directed to the check-in desk. Our room was ready at 1 p.m. and after being checked in, the guest services lady showed us to the elevator and how you need to put your card over the sensor to have access to the guest room floors. Our room faced Cordova Street. We were on the 9th floor. We liked that there was a small window that would open to let some fresh air in, especially having been on airplanes for much of the day. One thing about the area of Vancouver we stayed in - the air felt fresh and not city-ish. Our room had two queen beds that were absolutely comfortable. There were two side chairs plus the desk chair for adequate seating (the window ledge was also a good spot). There could've been more drawer space as one drawer was taken up with the "mini-bar" snacks, ice bucket, etc. This hotel has a lot of modern features, including push-button drapes and lights which took a little bit to figure out how to not turn off all the lights at once, but it was also nice to have the light control panels located in several places throughout the room so no one had to get up to turn off the lights at night :) The bathroom was spacious and we liked having the toilet in a separate area which made sharing the bathroom easier. The shower was good, but as someone else mentioned, it would be nice to have an extra place to hang a used towel. We had read about the bathrooms having tv's but didn't notice it was actually in the mirror until we wondered what the remote control was doing in the bathroom. The door has a doorbell and a light system so that you can mark it for privacy or for cleaning / service. They have nightly turn down service and bring bottles of water (but not plastic water bottles - these are reusable bottles that they fill and bring each night). The pool area is nice and quiet with plenty of sunbeds and cabanas which also had tv's. There's also a hot tub. The fitness room was available 24-hours and had plenty of equipment and also headsets to borrow. The lobby is big but very loud - louder than I expected - and that was my only disappointment - the lobby bar is very open and the music and conversations echo throughout the lobby area. After a busy day of sightseeing, there's nothing relaxing about being hit with so much noise in one space. Concierge was helpful in giving directions and information for various places we wanted to go including a grocery store and how to get to the Seabus terminal. It would be nice if the hotel offered free internet access, but as it turned out, Giovane, the cafe in the lobby, offers free wifi access to customers. I had a delicious hot chocolate one afternoon so I could use the internet. As it turned out, I didn't lose the signal or connection when I went to my room on the 9th floor. Just saying. The location of the hotel is very good for access to touristy things to do and the port for cruising. We walked several blocks up Thurlow to find restaurants and shops along the way. We enjoyed strolling along the promenade area by the convention center and Canada Place. We walked to GasTown in less than 10 minutes. There is a food court conveniently located for a quick bite or breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “New and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jaymsea
Reviews.Content: It's new, modern, a shining star. Different from the typical "grand dame" fairmonts. There are 3 Fairmonts in town. All within walking distance of each other. This one appears to appeal to the young hip set, but I'm over 50 and I was very happy. Spa is fablous. Staff is first rate. The rooms are very comfortable. If you like gadgets you'll be in heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, First Class Service, Beautiful Modern Furnishings.”
Reviews.Author: Rollerina
Reviews.Content: After a nightmare stay at the Sheraton Vancouver Wall Centre, which was recommended to me by a SPG employee, I high-tailed it to the Fairmont Pacific Rim and never looked back. It was my first visit to Vancouver, and I wanted to end my experience on a positive note. This hotel is one of the best I've ever stayed at, and I'm a fairly well-traveled person. The staff was so welcoming and professional throughout the entire stay. The doorman came to the front desk with my husband and me, even though we didn't need help with our bags. He had politely caught our names and introduced us to the clerk, who couldn't have been sweeter. Every interaction with the front desk was pleasant, whether calling down from the room, getting directions to the pool and restaurant or requesting a key when I'd popped in quick for lunch and didn't have mine on me. The concierge asked how we'd enjoyed our stay when we checked out and warmly wished us safe travels. The location is perfect. You're a block from the Sky Train and the waterfront. There are a ton of good restaurants close by, but the hotel's own is more than adequate. The gelato stand is popular from what I gathered, and the cafe was decent. We loved the look of the lobby and bar. The hotel is so well-designed! Our room was enormous with a European style bathroom, spa style shower and soaking tub. There was even a television in the bathroom mirror, not to mention a large LCD flat screen in the room. If you were going to have a party, there was a long parsons table in the entrance that seemed made to double as a bar. There were tons of details in the room from a suit rack with cufflink holder to a gourmet espresso machine to a suitcase stand. The pool was nice if a bit on the small side. (The hot tub was almost as big.) It's too bad you can't see the amazing view from it. If it were on a higher floor maybe, but they built some pavilion for the Olympics from the looks of it. There is a bar which wasn't open when we were there. But there is no better place to stay in Vancouver. I feel like I ran the full gamut, going from heaven to hell while I was there. The prices were not that far when all was said and done. If you're in Vancouver for pleasure, the Fairmont Pacific Rim is definitely worth a splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAPSoCal
Reviews.Content: We had a signature view room overlooking floatplane terminal. The rooms and view were beautiful. Staff very friendly and ready to please, attentive. The morning brunch is very good, but rather expensive (but quick and easy). They have good live music at the lounge nightly. Cocktails very good. They are making a wine bar in the hotel, which should open in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Crisp and Modern, Pricey but Worth It”
Reviews.Author: schippk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a worthy addition to the forest of blue and green glass towers that has sprouted over Vancouver's old brick-and-stucco skyline over recent decades. Our arrival was marred by the odd circumstance that Fairmont has two properties with similar names located only a block apart. We accidentally pulled in to the "other" Fairmont's parking garage, paid, and wheeled our luggage into reception, where we were informed that we were in the wrong hotel. Coincidentally another couple was checking in after having inadvertently gone to the Pacific Rim. The clerk noted that "this happens all the time" and pointed us to the correct destination. Annoyingly, we had to pay for our parking mistake. Finally parked in the Pacific Rim's garage we wheeled into their lobby, where we were ignored by the doormen who seemed focused on more glamorous-looking guests. We never once got a glance from them during our stay, which is hardly significant but a little odd for a property this expensive. Arrival was the only flaw, however. Check-in went smoothly and we zipped up to our room. Although it was the least-expensive in the hotel it was spacious and had fine views over the city. Traditionalists and chintz afficionados should beware: The decor is ultra sleek and of-the-moment. Being dedicated modernists, though, my husband and I found the room a paradise of pushbuttons. We could have spent the entire weekend doodling with the motorized drapes and lighting settings. The bathroom is a palace of granite, glass and mood lighting. The flatscreen television embedded in the mirror is sort of a gimmick, but a worthy one that I enjoyed. The scale was a nice touch but one I used less as the weekend and the meals progressed. We ate breakfast in the ORU restaurant. It was delicious and the service was attentive. Again, expensive but we thought the high quality of the food was worth it. We also had drinks one evening in the lobby. It was pleasant to sit next to the high style fireplace and again service was good. One of the nicesest surprises was Giovane, the espresso bar near the hotel entrance. WIth a beautiful modern decor and ecellent coffee and pastries it was a good breakfast alternative to the more pricey ORU. One of the hotel's best features is its location on Vancouver's waterfront. We were lucky enough to be there during a spell of good weather during an otherwise gloomy Northwest spring. We took full advantage of the opportunity to step outside for long walks along the promenade, watching the seaplanes come and go past the sheer green skyline of the Coast Range. For those who enjoy walking its also an easy trek up to Robson Street and the rest of downtown Vancouver. The hotel is also quite close to the cruise ship terminal. Althought the Pacfic Rim was a bit of a splurge we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - exactly what Vancouver needed”
Reviews.Author: JanetinVancouver
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous rooms; great vibe; awesome bar scene - food in the restaurant could use some work but it doesn't matter with all the options downtown. Spa was brilliant as well. Highly recommend staying here. This is probably one of the best hotels in Vancouver at the moment. Hope they keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “great service from initial contact to last minute good byes”
Reviews.Author: flamesfan24
Reviews.Content: Needed a property for my wife and I to take our 85 year young mother to for a convention she wished to attend.. The reservation coordinator - MS. Cervantes - discussed our situation on email and found a perfect solution -- the jr suite. It overlooked the water and was as gracious a room as we have had the pleasure of staying in. From Ms. Cervantes to our arrival and greeting by Chad to the Presidents desk and Nadine we were treated royally. The Pacific Rim is centrally located for the water and across the street from the Convention Center. The wheel chair supplied by the hotel made our mothers trip to the convention center easy and quick. We will return as this is a top notch property with top notch staff --- starting with the reservations coordinator.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best!!!”
Reviews.Author: SenoritaCanada
Reviews.Content: I'll try to sum it up....WOW!! Yup, that pretty much sums it up!! This hotel is BEAUTIFUL!! Very large, clean, comfortable, rooms...friendly, helpful staff. There is nightly live entertainment in the hotel lobby. Very talented singers on the nights we partook in the activities. We have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. Would definitely stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, except for a few hitches.”
Reviews.Author: BoraBuzz
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel around 3PM and front desk tells us that they're working on the room since it hasn't been completely cleaned up by housekeeping yet. No ready room at 3PM? That is something else! I went back every 5 minutes to the front desk to check. We were seated at the couch near the entrance. The lobby bar hostess asked us if we were hotel guests, and it seems like these hotel couches were only for lobby bar guests. Anyway, she did not turn us away, so that was OK. I went back a few minutes again to the front desk and asked if the room was ready, and the front desk staff sensing my irritation and impatience offered me to order drinks from the bar and have it charged to him. So I did ask coffee from the same lobby bar hostess. Ten minutes passed and no coffee yet, then I had to ask her again for it. Delivered my coffee after three minutes without any worded apology or any trace of it, looked like she intentionally forgot about it. Had our room after 3:45PM, almost 4PM. Everything else was ok, except for that snobbish brunette lobby bar staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Spa in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Anovin
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Pacific Rim is an amazing hotel first of all, but the Spa is exceptional. I've been to a number of spa's in Vancouver and this one is the ultimate winner. Starting from the front line staff that greet you from to the massage therapists, quality and customer satisfaction is at the top of their priority list. Paul, Spa Director, accommodated myself and a guest and ensured that we had a great experience. Let's just say that I stayed at the spa for about 4 hours enjoying everything from tea to their steam room. Their space is amazing, rooftop jacuzzi, lounge and great amenities. Like I said, best spa in Vancouver. If you need to relax after a long work day, or are visiting from out of town, head over to the Fairmont Spa and talk to Paul to get you set up for a relaxing day.

Reviews.Title: “If I die and go to heaven, I bet it looks like the lobby of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: l0ves2travl
Reviews.Content: the Pacific Rim is without a doubt the nicest Fairmont I've ever stayed in, bar none. The lobby alone is worth the visit, with the amazing decor, great deli/cafe, florist, bar, and beautiful lounge area with (sometimes) live music. The rooms are equally gorgeous and modern with great decor and a washroom that will make you want to sleep in the bathtub. TVs are built into the mirrors and the shower and bath are not only beautiful but sooooo soothing. I hardly wanted to leave the room. We didn't eat in the restaurants here but had appetizers downstairs in the lounge area and those were great. Drinks service and general customer service was also really attentive and helpful. At one point we wanted to go to an outside restaurant for dinner and the hotel gave us a ride in their car instead of calling us a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night, but what a night it was! This hotel is well worth the money. We arrived early (10:30am) after a long flight from Australia but they were able to check us into our room straight away which was a godsend. The room was amazing. We had a Deluxe Harbor View room and as a previous reviewer has stated, it is partially obstructed by a building but the view is still lovely, overlooking the pool area and also the harbour. There really isn't much to complain about for this hotel, the only thing that I would say is that there was only one towel rail which was also the handle to the shower (no huge deal anyway) and the lights are all clipsal electronic lighting and the master button is on the same panel as the other ones so in the middle of the night you can potentially turn on all of the lights when you only want the bedside table! Again, no huge thing, but I just thought I'd point it out. They don't have free wi-fi though, which is one thing that I think a high class hotel should offer. You are able to purchase it of course, but at the usual rediculously high hotel rates. We were very impressed with the service. I'm not sure if it is common occurance or if it was because we had emailed the hotel before hand in regards to our stay (and our friends who we also booked for are part of their executive club), but we had chocolate truffles delivered in the afternoon and they also dropped us down to Stanley Park in one of their vehicles. If this service is for everyone who stays then I think that's just marvellous! We didn't make it down to the pool or spa so I can't comment on that, however there were people in it and it was a cold day so I'm assuming it was nice. The bar was very lively with a nice solo guy playing live music. I would definitely spend the money to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.. really”
Reviews.Author: QuirkyCutie
Reviews.Content: We won a trip to stay at the place of our choice in Vancouver, and where else could we choose but the Fairmont Pacific Rim? I have to say our expectations were high before we even arrived and we were not disappointed! The suite was fabulous with a great view looking out over the harbour and the city lights at night. Staff were all friendly and helpful in an unobtrusive way. The only downside was that the lounge was quite busy since we were there on the weekend and we never got to experience it. The location was also very convenient, walking distance to shopping at the big downtown mall and close to the rogers arena where we had tickets to see a show. My darling boyfriend also surprised me with Spa treatments, which were nice. I loved the facilities, with outdoor hot tubs and multiple lounge areas to make use of after your massage. We went to the restaurant Oru for dinner one night, which was a great Asian style cuisine and had their tasting menu - yum! Otherwise we mainly had in room dining to get the most out of our getaway. If you have a sweet tooth I would highly recommend stopping by the Giovane Cafe on the grounds - the sugar buns are heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: hinaly
Reviews.Content: Rooms were beautifully appointed, the service was excellent and the location great. If you are coming off a cruise you can just walk to the hotel. The lobby with its huge fireplace was very inviting and they had live jazz. If you stay there, or at any other Fairmont, do enroll in their President's Club and you will have complimentary internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best Hotel in the world !!!!”
Reviews.Author: SigisB
Reviews.Content: I had HIGH expectations for this Hotel, based on the reviews I read & my attachment to the brand. My stay was AMAZING: * Welcome from the Valet & theam who took me directly to my room. * Room was amazing (Corner Suite) * Very friendly staff * In room breakfast: perfect * Went twice to ORU .... and loved it twice !

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience & Worst service”
Reviews.Author: jabo154954
Reviews.Content: We booked couple of rooms and a suite at Fairmont Pacific Rim for the weekend as we wanted to watch the game in Vancouver. They said we can check in early, but we didn't get our keys until 4! then they lost some of our luggage that we checked in. we couldn't leave the hotel until after the game started. they checked in our friends into a room that was already occupied and took them an hour to move them to a different room! we couldn't order room service because they changed their menu in the kitchen but had the old menu in the room! we complained but they did not do anything proactively nor received a sincere apology. They are just relying on the name and being a new hotel without offering a service of even a motel! We are easy going people but the stay at this "5 star" hotel actually ruined our trip! Stay away

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Judsonjak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfection. The staff was fantastic - friendly, efficient, knowledgeable, and generally wonderful. The room was gorgeous with amazing amenities. We had booked a room with a view of the harbor and mountains and we were fortunate to have lovely weather so we could stand on our balcony and revel in our beautiful view. The bed was so comfortable it took all our willpower to actually get up in the morning. There are several Fairmont hotels in Vancouver to choose from; the Pacific Rim is a bit more modern and the newest of them. You can tell they are trying to make sure it is the the best of them all. I can't wait to return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: drdan0113
Reviews.Content: This is simply just the best hotel in Vancouver. Excellent , friendly service. Rooms are loaded with technology , great view. The restaurant at the lobby is just overpriced , but there is a lot of other great restaurants in the area. I will never stay in another hotel in vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sarahsriv
Reviews.Content: Upon coming to Vancouver we had no real idea of where to stay and had a mild understanding of all that Vancouver had to offer. We used Trip Advisor to pick a general location and somehow landed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. (We went on orbitz and found a pretty good deal). Having traveled all around Vancouver, the Fairmont Pacific Rim was the perfect central location! Just 5 minutes walk from Gas town, 2 minutes from the waterfront (which takes you right into Stanley park), 10 minutes to Yaletown and 2 minutes to the public transportation Waterfront Station, we could literally walk everywhere. We also paid a little extra (I think it was $15) to stay on the Fairmont Gold Floor. TOTALLY worth the extra fee. You get free breakfast, appetizers, dessert and snacks and non alcoholic beverages all day. Also the Gold Floor has the most incredible views with a patio that overlooks the water. The rooms are wonderful and modern as well, though you should really request a waterfront view and ask if its possible to have a slightly bigger room. The staff is so nice and willing to accomdate as well. We asked for a later checkout and they accomodated with a 2pm checkout for free. Of everywhere to stay, this is BY FAR a very top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Chrissos
Reviews.Content: Great facilities, outstanding service and best location! Totally recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: TheBrownsAdelaide
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Pacific RIm before our "insight tour of Canada and Alaska" and again on our return. It is a great hotel, beautiful rooms (twim double beds) a huge bathroom with a TV in the mirror (a first for me). Great location and the piano bar has some great artists, so you can sit in front of the amazing fire with a drink and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: 00_Kevin_00
Reviews.Content: A model for all hotels on how to do things right for the business traveller. From reception to check out they provide a first class service. The rooms are modern and functional. Very well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quality service”
Reviews.Author: FLD81
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were helped from the car, until early morning checkout, the staff were more than helpful. The room was outstanding - modern with a great view of the sea planes landing and departing. All aspects of the hotel showed the same attention to detail - very high!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat this for luxury, service and great location”
Reviews.Author: QuakerBoy
Reviews.Content: What can I add to the great reviews of this new hotel? If you can afford it and want to "live large" for awhile in the beautiful city of Vancouver, pony up for a few nights in just about any room, but the Gold rooms on twenty to twenty two add a bit more flair, but trust me, all the rooms are large with high tech amenities and wonderful bathrooms. The lobby is usually buzzing and full of beautiful people enjoying live entertaiment. Even the "coffee shop," an upscale place called Giovanne's, is a pleasant surprise....and you have to try the Sugar Bun!

Reviews.Title: “So this is what defines great service ....”
Reviews.Author: SilverFlyer09
Reviews.Content: Unquestionably the most attentive, polite, professonal and friendly staff I have ever enountered - and that's only after being here for a few hours! Matched with a very comfortable, state-of-the-art and beautifully appointed room.

Reviews.Title: “The finest hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: magictouch76
Reviews.Content: Been to many great hotels...this one tops them all. It is a stunning facility. More importantly, the staff is outstanding. What a fabulous group of young hospitality professionals...attending to your every need. Kudos to Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “State of the art, cool, classy and unforgetable...”
Reviews.Author: Roberto6959
Reviews.Content: Just steps from the Helijet and Seaplane terminal you'll find this beautiful modern hotel. Well educated and helpfull staff from top to bottom. Groovy lobby bar/sushi bar with live music, Great Spa, outdoor swimming pool and swirl pool. Excellent room with amazing views of the harbour. State of the art touch-of-a-finger lighting and window coverings. VERY comfortable kingsize bed. Great Bathroom with soaker tub, seperate shower and even a small TV built into the mirror (not needed but cool technology)! Stay on the Gold level and enjoy the private lounge with breakfast, lunch, appys and desert throughout the day and evening. Treat yourself...you've worked hard, now play hard! An all around great time. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience and magnificent room choice”
Reviews.Author: dmmcrob
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Good location. choose the rooms with the view over the bay - wonderful! Hotel staff very polite and helpful if a little "cold". would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Decadent and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: VancouverSeatoSky
Reviews.Content: We have stayed he a number of times and as a fantastic Vancouver hot spot we head to their lounge often as well but on this certain occasion we stayed at the Pacific Rim as a quick staycation. The rooms are gorgeous and beautifully decorated. It seems like you are the first to stay in the room in this nearly new property. The restaurant "Oru" serves up amazing food for a lengthy sit down meal. The Chefs tasting menu is perfect for groups while the lunch Bento is great for a little taste of everything. A must do at the hotel is the Willow Stream Spa with their roof top patio and stunning treatment rooms. i could spend all day lounging in the pools and enjoying the amenities. I'll defility be staying here again and would recommend to anyone coming to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “You have arrived in heaven! Now relax....”
Reviews.Author: Royalty0606
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Gold floor which has to be the best ever. The Gold food, service, view, room is unsurpassed. The restaurant in the hotel was excellent with a great view of the harbour, delicious food and impeccable service. Our suite was stunning. We went to the Willow Stream Spa and were pampered by true professionals. The facilites in the Spa are lovely. The location of the Pacific Rim is great for shopping, walking, exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: rodneygirl
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from a trip to Vancouver, and Vancouver Island. All in all we stayed in 6, yes I did say 6 different hotels, all of which were really good. Our last two days before we were due to come home though we wanted some relaxation time, so we pushed the boat out and stayed at this hotel. We have stayed at a Fairmont Hotel before, the Chateau at Lake Louise, and although that was beautiful, I have to say that the Pacific Rim far outshone it it my eyes in terms of style, and service. From the moment we arrived until our departure the service was impeccable. Everyone seemed to know your name, nothing was to much trouble. An example of this was a young man Andreas from the front of hotel who brought our luggage to our room, he showed us how everything worked (all the drapes, lights, curtains, all operated off a touch screen by the side of the bed), later that night he drove us to a restaurant that we had chosen in the hotel car (a very nice series 7 bmw), and picked us when we were finished. This young man was extremely friendly, and helpful. That nights meal wasn't great, so he recommended another one, which was fantastic. Another person to mention was Sherie the concierge who again helped us out with recommendations for restaurants, and transport. A friendly face and a smile always. I have to say that they, and all the staff helped to make this a very memorable stay for my husband and myself, one we will not forget in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, but very high tech”
Reviews.Author: ventotto
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel in a great location. But like many of the reviews for this hotel, it is just a bit too high tech - after a long flight, the last thing you want to do is spend 5 mins figuring out how to close the drapes! Location is great, close enough to to robson st and Stanley park. It also seems to be a popular hotel with the local business people, with the bar and cafe on the ground level both very busy. Staff were exceptionally nice and cheery.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best in Vancouver...”
Reviews.Author: JuanStudioCity
Reviews.Content: Even the cab driver told us that the Fairmont Pacific Rim was a great hotel. It's one of the newest in the area and it has a great buzz. The service is by far a highlight. From the moment to arrive you are greeted and welcomed by the staff that helps you settle in and check in. What I liked the most were the views from the room and bathroom. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable, stylish yet homey. For a treat, fill the jacuzzi tub at night and it while watching the night skyline and views of Whistler. Staying here definitely made my first trip to Canada memorable. The Fairmont Pacific Rim is also located walking distance to many downtown hotspots, so once you park, you can travel on foot and get a real sense of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SteveMedicoff
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Pacific Rim hotel many times, and every stay was just perfect. The service, rooms, beds, everything the way it should be. Any Hotel can be great once, but only the best can do it every time. Keep it up! Although my office at Shaw is just across the parking lot, I would walk for blocks to stay at this gem.

Reviews.Title: “This IS the benchmark!”
Reviews.Author: WineTraveller
Reviews.Content: For the second time in less than a year, we were fortunate enough to stay here. This time was for five nights during our daughter's Spring Break. Fairmont is our favorite hotel chains (been to 21 of their properties), but THIS one is definitely at the top of the Leader Board!!!!! Yes, the fact that it is brand new with state of the art technologies makes it easier to love, but it is the combination of location, amenities, ambience and (most importantly!) service that makes it! Even though we were on vacation (usually dressed in jeans with our rented Toyota out front), we ALWAYS felt we were treated no differently than someone who was dressed like a fashionista and driving a Ferarri (quite a few of those!!!!!). The concierge we primarily dealt with, Matthew, was absolutely brilliant - taking care of our every need and suggesting alternatives when the original request was unavailable or when he felt there was a better alternative. Yes, it is expensive and highly-rated, but the Pacific Rim EASILY meets and surpasses the expectations one would have for a hotel of this caliber!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: AmberK
Reviews.Content: I try to always stay at Fairmont hotels. The service is unbeatable and the hotels themselves are almost always lovely. This hotel tops them all, (except for the newest Fairmont hotel in Beijing, which is in a class of it's own). The staff was excellent, despite a poor start of my room not being ready on time. I had to wait for over an hour and no concession was made to be (IE a cup of tea in the lobby after 9 hours of travel would have been nice) I was escorted to my room, shown the security features (excellent) and welcomed. I had upgraded to a suite and it was absolutely lovely. THe location is perfect for anyone visiting the conference centre across the street (there is a tunnel so you don't have to go outside). You can take the subway train straight from the airport ($3.75!!!) and arrive 3 blocks away. When I was leaving, the doorman drove me to the station! The only downside was the in-house restaurant. Located on the 2nd floor the ambience was excellent but the food was very poor quality and selection. This is quite strange as Fairmonts always have a terrific high end restaurant. Other reviews on Tripadvisor for the restaurant say the same thing. Fortunately, there are many places to dine downtown. Overall, the wow factor at this new hotel is high. Kids of all ages will be delighted with the TV in the bathroom mirror!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, just what I am used to!”
Reviews.Author: CasinoStan
Reviews.Content: I travel far and wide for business 8 - 10 time per year managing casinos. However, I am currently having a nice stay here at the Fairmont. Its my second time and this time is by far the best of the two. I am here for another 4 weeks so I do hope they are as comfortable as this week has been!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location. Few steps from the station. Within walking distance from everywhere we needed to go”
Reviews.Author: The_Lovely_One
Reviews.Content: All the female waiting staff in the lobby bar are stunning models in black dresses, just like in the Cactus Club and Joey Bentall One, both on Burrard St. Went to Vancouver for a conference. We had a great room with harbour view, that was really big and lots of marble in the bathroom. A huge bath and a nice shower. Quiet rooms. Easy to sleep. Huge comfortable bed. It rained all week and the hotel really kept our spirits high with a lovely treat on the last evening with a plate of fruit and Petit fours. The i-pod style buttons to adjust the curtains, privacy notice, clean room notice, and the lighting are a nice modern touch but not helpful for the visually impaired. The staff at the desk was always welcoming and cheerful and the complementary car took us through the rain to our restaurant with a nice chat about the area. We even had the option of phoning to be taken back. We did not have breakfast included in our deal but we did have Giovane, a cafe connected to the hotel that does take out and eat in. Good coffee and nice toasted sandwiches with a fresh fruit salad. Also the cinnamon bun was a good alternative to savoury. The sandwich and fruit salad were half the price of a typical hotel breakfast. The maid was excellent and laid out the our own toiletries that we had not put away onto a face cloth, in a comforting obsessive compulsive manner :-) that signalled he/she paid attention to detail. Stunning views of the Pacific and the mountains when the clouds cleared. Drawbacks: live music every evening was to loud for us to want a quiet drink downstairs in the lobby. We headed off to Joey's on Burrard St instead. No free internet- not good if you want to check into your flight. I don't really want to beg the staff downstairs to do this.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel is perfect”
Reviews.Author: bevben
Reviews.Content: The service at this Hotel is exceptional from arrival to departure they make it easy and enjoyable ----The Lobby Lounge has live music (excellent ) Very comfortable beds--beautiful view of Harbour ---simply THE BEST HOTEL in Vancouver oh and the restaurant for breakfast or dinner is very good

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ValerieMangan
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pull up in front of this ultra-modern property, you'll feel like a rock star. The service at this hotel is amazing. At every single position. I would love to single someone out, but they were all so friendly and outstanding, I wouldn't know where to start. The hotel itself is sleek, and stylish, with every high-end amenity you could want. My personal favorite was the complimentary car service that will wisk you to any destination in the downtown area in a comfortable white BMW (when available). We made good use of this service, and it did so much to enhance our experiance. Beds are super comfortable, and the bathrooms are huge. The only very, very minor quibbles I would have is that the in-room hairdryer wasn't very good, and the stand-alone showers could use a better rack to hold shampoo and such. But don't take those as complaints, since the hotel more then made up for that in every single way. If you enjoy luxury, and being pampered, this is a hotel for you. I know it will be my go-to destination in Vancouver from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vancouver - should be 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: AJCM
Reviews.Content: Just had a two night stay while en route to Whistler, and have been guests before. The hotel did not disappoint, and we are incredibly finicky travellers. The hotel is brand new, and therefore up to date and extremely clean. Housekeeping cleans and vacuums impeccably (as evidenced by the lack of even a trace of the Rice Krispies our kids were dropping like Hansel and Gretel). The beds are comfortable with a sumptuous triple sheeted duvet. The bathroom is a marble bath, with generous sized soaking tub, and you’ve got to love the TV in the mirror for entertaining kids during bath time, or while grooming in the morning. The pool and hot tub is also kept impeccably clean with tiles clearly scrubbed regularly. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub each day, and found the towels to be well stocked each time we visited the pool area (and this was during the off season – mid March!). As usual, it was the service that made our stay that much more comfortable. Every employee of the hotel goes out of their way to greet you, or help you. Concierge is exceptional, particularly Yvonne. If weather permits, use the hotels’ BMW bikes for a cycle around Stanley Park’s Sea Wall – this is a must do 2 hour adventure with breathtaking views. Bella Gelato is just around the corner and makes incredible hand crafted gelato (our daughter is allergic to milk protein, but sure enough, they make a delicious vegan version!). The bakery/cafe in the hotel is perfect for a casual breakfast, and once again, the employees provide top notch customer service and cater to your needs with attention to detail and a smile. In our opinion, this is BY FAR the best hotel in Vancouver. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Juneauite
Reviews.Content: The other reviews in this string say it all -- excellent hotel, wonderful service, terrific views over the water. Restaurant is pricey (especially for breakfast) likely because it is aimed at business travelers, and the lobby bar is noisy, but cheerful, hip and fun. Rooms are high tech, quiet and extremely comfortable. Concierge and front desk staff were extremely helpful and professional. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: KWKW727
Reviews.Content: Faultless service, extremely efficient concierge (Carla) , ayoung and hip lobby bar is THE hotspot to be from Friday to Sunday. Couldnt find a single fault with the place itself. Breakfast in Oru restaurant was probably it's weakest point. Buffet tended to be a bit cold and a la carte just a bit off the mark . That said there's a funky coffee shop at lobby level called Giovane which is by far and a way a nicer place to have a light breakfast without all the chopped potatoes that accompany leverything in Oru. All of our group seemed to be in agreement this was the best hotel we had ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Asian Westcoast Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Canadianmom1
Reviews.Content: My family of four had the pleasure of one night stay at this luxury hotel. Upon arrival we were greet by three friendly doormen who promptly assisted with unloading our luggage and the parking of our car. Note: the valet parking is included complimentary with the parking fee. Upon entering the hotel you are welcomed by the scent of jasmine. I thought it was wonderful but some who are scent sensitive might find it overwhelming. Check in was completed by the doorman so no need to stop at the front desk. The hotel room was large, beautifully decorated and quiet. My techy son was thrilled with all the electronics particularly the in-the-mirror-tv in the bathroom. I was there on business, so appreciated the complimentary wifi with my President's club membership. Take a moment to read the book about the hotel. It gives you an appreciation of the art incorporated into the design of the building and the connection of Fairmont to CP rail. We enjoyed the use of the lap pool and hot tub on the rooftop overlooking the water as well as the complimentary bikes provided for touring around Stanley Park (or wherever you choose to go). We ate around the corner from the hotel but the hotel has a great little coffee shop situated inside that makes the BEST sugar buns. An absolute must for those who like dessert. Upon departure, we were assisted by an extremely friendly doorman, Patrick, who later told us he is the hotel manager. Apparently, he likes to "work all the jobs" in the hotel. What a fabulous representative for Fairmont. Truly a great hotel with great staff. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wow the best of the best”
Reviews.Author: been_hereYT
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to stay at the Pacific Rim since it openend in February 2010, and I got my wish granted. What an amazing hotel, the service is out of this world, from the bell man (or lady) to the housekeeping staff. The rooms are impeccable, with clean lines and well thought design. Very spacious and comfortable, love the nice jetted tubs and floor to ceiling windows with electronic blinds. I am spoiled now, no other hotel will ever satisfy me, I normally stay at the 4 Seasons Hotel, which i now used to love, because the Pacific Rim is simply the best. I had a massage at the spa, what a lovely facility, again impeccable service. I wish the weather had been nicer to enjoy the terrasse, but I enjoyed the relaxation lounges and 20 head shower. If you like to travel in style and be pampered this hotel is for you. Beware that nothing compares to this hotel.. and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Staycation at the Fairmont Pacific Rim was truly 5 Star!!”
Reviews.Author: Julsndave
Reviews.Content: We needed a night away from the babies and wanted to enjoy every minute of it in luxury so we chose the Fairmont Pacific Rim. We were NOT disappointed!! The hotel is so beautiful and the rooms are stunning but most importantly the staff is amazing!!! We can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I was extemely well looked after - it felt great!”
Reviews.Author: stephen038
Reviews.Content: Great room, service, and vibe - it was lovely,calm and really well appointed. Service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: voyageurbear
Reviews.Content: one of my favorite in Vancouver, the other being the Shangri La. Modern, hip, very well located. Excellent service from the moment the taxicab arrives. Hotel restaurants are a bit pricey and not exciting. Lobby bar is fun and always well frequented. beautiful room, very comfortable bed and great bathroom with separate shower would go back anytime

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: nytrodave
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the boat show, check in was good, booked a deluxe harbour view room the view was half harbour half convention centre.TV in the bathroom mirror is kinda cool. Went out to dinner then came back to the room to watch a pay per view movie which didnt work in our room so they moved us to another room it did not work there either. Coffee maker did not work called down to desk they said they would bring coffee up, never did get it. You pay 280.00 + dollars and they want another 15.00 for in room wi-fi, I usually really enjoy Fairmont stays but this one was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daviduSeattle
Reviews.Content: I must have timed my overnight anniversary stay just right but I was able to reserve a deluxe room for the night for only $239. Our room was located on the 19th floor. The finish quality of this room was truly exceptional. Custom woodwork and furniture, quality details everywhere distinguished this room. Motorized shades, Three stage dimming for the room lighting and built-in tv in the bathroom mirror. Great bed, great thread count sheets, luxurious marble bath. I truly did not want to leave this room. I can't believe the value of this room! The hotel was equally incredible: rooftop pool, gorgeous, sleek lobby that managed to exude warmth, luxury & hipness all at the same time. We didn't have the opportunity to try the restaurant but we did snack and have coffee at the lobby casual spot called Giovanni. Hands down this was the best cup of espresso I have ever found in a hotel. Usually I go out of my way to find quality espresso and venture out in the morning to avoid whatever the hotel might offer. Thankfully I took a chance here and ordered a machiatto. It was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a great hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: One tip: when you arrive be VERY careful that you don't fall into the floor-level waterfall. I kid you not, it is exactly invisible at night, and there is no barrier. I put my foot in it when I arrived. I could easily have broken my leg, and it would've been the Fongmont Pacific Rim as a result. But after this moment, everything was surprisingly new, sumptuous, comfortable, soft, plush, modern, spectacular, cozy, coddling. The room was large. You're greeted with the "welcome" lighting scene which has a beautiful backlit mural of a forest. The marble surfaces are white/grey veined and jewel-like. A great HDTV system is pre-set to an urban jazz station, which perfectly matches the harbor/city view and the sparkling lights behind the motorized curtains and shades. The tub fills quickly, is deep, beautiful and you can disappear in the deep tub after watching TV on the embedded-in-mirror screen. Amenities were great (mouthwash would've been nice though). Wifi is free for President's club members and works GREAT throughout the entire hotel. That's a plus. The honor bar is stocked with a level of thoughtfulness I don't see in other hotels. The electronic outlets at deskside were great - everything is provided. The only thing that would've been a minor improvement is power outlets more adjacent to the nightstands, and the lighting control for the entire room exists only on the "right" side of the bed. The clock-radio on the nightstand has iPhone attachment, but even better it has a "nature sounds" mode which gives you sleepy music. This place is plush. The spa is top-notch. Breakfast buffet is about average, dinner and appies were above average. I'm in the room right now and it smells like a brand new car. Great place to stay in bed and nurse a flu!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: CarsonLewis
Reviews.Content: I just returned from our weekend stay at The Fairmont Pacific Rim and we could not be any happier with this hotel. We checked into our room and the staff was amazingly helpful, walked us to the elevator and informed us about everything that was going on for the night. We arrived at our room, which was two queens when we had reserved one king bed. We were a little upset, called the front desk and the problem was solved IMMEDIDATLEY. I paid a small fee to be upgraded to a room on the Fairmont Gold level. Trust me, it was worth every penny I paid. The room was a little small, but fantastic views on the Harbor and the mountains. The private lounge on the 20th floor is spectacular with amazing views and wonderful service! Butler service was great, private car to drive you around town, couldn’t have ask for more. I proposed to my girlfriend this weekend and could not have picked a better hotel to stay at. Thank you Fairmont for making this such a special weekend for the both of us.

Reviews.Title: “I hope I have a reason to return soon.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMedicineMan
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I have stayed at. The lobby was modern cool and even had a pleasant odor they piped in. The food was great. The room was so relaxing and comfortable I really enjoyed being in it. I was there for a conference and hope there will be another soon.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: k8hart
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip to Vancouver and Whistler and stayed at three different Fairmont hotels. We stayed here the last night of our trip and I'm so glad it was the last night and not the first. It was INCREDIBLE and I would have been disappointed to start here and expect this level of luxury from the others. Our first night of the trip we stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront which is right next door and about the same price. While the Waterfront was nice, the Fairmont Pacific Rim was incredible. As with all the other Fairmonts we stayed at, the customer service was incredible, but what set this one apart was the luxury of the rooms. The bathroom has a large, deep tub with a separate shower. There is a TV in the mirror which was my husband's favorite part. The rooms are very modern. There is a small reading light on each side of the bed, such a minor detail, but so cool! The concierge was very helpful and we were able to get a ride in the hotel car to and from dinner. We did not eat at the restaurants in the hotel, but they looked very good as well. Avoid anything in the mini fridge or snack supply in the room...very expensive...there is a food court downstairs in the Fairmont Waterfront where you can stock up on snacks if you need something! I highly recommend this hotel and if I ever come back to Vancouver I hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great night away!”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugVancouver
Reviews.Content: Booked here for my husbands birthday, and we had the best time! booked the Spa Package through Kiwi Collection. From the moment I checked in to our late checkout we had the greatest time. The rooms are modern and comfy. The staff is great. The views from your room whether you have city or harbour view are spectacular. We had a plate of fruit & chocolates upon our arrival. We had a huge soaker jet tub that looked out on the city. The only complaint is the spa (which is supposed to be the best) only had one shower in the ladies change room, and the massage therapists were not the best. The sent ini the lobby is WAAAAAAAAY too overpowering! & I've heard that complaint from many. Overall I highly recommend this package.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel..my local favorite.”
Reviews.Author: happyroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights to celebrate our 15th Anniversary. We booked a West Wing deluxe king room with a balcony that had a fireplace on it. The Hotel is across from the new convention center and a block away from the cruise ship terminal. There's a lovely seawall across the street which will take you ball the way around Stanley Park if you are ambitous, the view is spectacular. If you like walking, you can get to Robson Street or Denman Street within 20 - 30 minutes. The check in process with smooth with excellent service from the valet and front desk staff. The front desk gent stepped out from behind the counter to show us over to the west wing access elevator and happily pointed out where the hotel amenities were. The room itself was modern with a local flavor...lots of wood and eco decor. It had a tassimo coffee maker, a TV in the bathroom mirror (cool), large soaker tub, business/internet amenities and more. There is a turndown service in the evening and they leave a bottle of water at your bedside. Although we didn't use it, the pool area was very nice with a larger hot pool. The Willow Stream Spa was very helpful when I wandered in for some products...We tried to book a service but they were very busy and I declined an early morning appointment in favor of sleeping in. I would suggest booking prior to your arrival if you are looking for spa treatments and don't want an early morning...the Willow Stream Spa is worth it. We dined out at the hotel restaurant ORU for our anniversary dinner. The food seems to be a Japanese/Indian blend and it was fantastic. We ordered the tasting menu for $49 per person so we could sample a variety of their specialties. The food was so good and the service was excellent...we had a window seat looking out towards the convention center and a peek a boo view of the water. We also enjoyed a few hours at the lounge during our stay, service was fast and friendly...it was expensive for what we ordered but we liked it there. There was a live band on the first night....We ordered sushi from the raw bar and it was well presented and prepared. Overall this is my favorite hotel to stay at locally. I would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View of the Beautiful North Shore - Ahhhhhh”
Reviews.Author: meritagebc
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in December 30, 2010 for a quick romantic getaway. The front desk staff were superb at getting us settled in. Once in the room, we had fun playing with the remote controls that were hiding everywhere! The TV in the bath mirror was a great touch - I was wishing I had more time to take a bath, as the tub was simply gorgeous! Typical Fairmont amenities in the room, with a bonus of some bath salts to enjoy the tub. Plush towels & robes in the room...the only thing missing was slippers to keep my toes warm. We had a small issue with the wifi in the room - an engineer was sent right up to fix the problem right away. The bedding was sublime. I always sleep great in Fairmont beds - and what is better than waking up to the amazing views of Stanley Park, the North Shore Mountains and floatplanes bustling in the harbour! Sound wise it was great too, I had a hard time hearing the planes from our room. We treated ourselves to dinner at the Corner Suite Bistro not onsite - it was less than amazing - it closed a week later - we were not suprised! After dinner drinks in the lobby bar provided the perfect opportunity to people watch. The scotch selection was fair and not too pricy. Geovani is the place to go at this hotel - indulge in a sugar bun! OMG - the best sinful experience in downtown! Yum. They have good coffee too. Thank you Fairmont for another amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: marivic_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. I really enjoyed it. The hotel is very elegant and modern.Foods are great at the gold lounge, staff are very professional and friendly especially Stephen, not only did our turn down service but anticipated our needs. he gave us extra coffee pods and welcome us with complimentary chocolates in a cone (sooo sweet). I would highly recommend this hotel to any anyone who's planning to visit beautiful British Columbia.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Srg_Brazil
Reviews.Content: The location is superb, the building is luxurious and impressive. Check in was perfect and room was perfect. The room has amenities everyone will like - electric contains, Nespresso coffee maker, Lutron light controls, TV in the bathroom, marvelous beds, spacious. Breakfas is not cheap, but is marvelous, and the staff could not be more polite. If you do ot want to spend, go on the hotel cafeteria for a faster meal. The restaurant on the lobby is very good, do not miss.

Reviews.Title: “If this is a standard room then OMG!”
Reviews.Author: Alibongo42
Reviews.Content: Wow! Stayed here for one night following a ski holiday in Whistler. Our travel agent advised if we were looking for plush, then this was the hotel to pick. Impressive entrance and lobby, and a superbly smooth check-in despite being several hours early. The room has plenty of modern touches to thrill someone who likes that sort of thing (me, me, me!). Electric curtains, one touch lights with a choice of mood settings, tv panel embedded in the bathroom mirror ....... need I go on? Oh, and the bed was amazingly comfortable! No free wifi (why, why, why do hotels not provide this as standard?!), but cabled internet in the bedroom was free. Handy for the Sky Train to the airport, and close to Gas Town for sightseeing. Vancouver city centre is small enough that nowhere is too far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tricia2011
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Pacific Rim hotel is a beautiful modern hotel. The rooms are large and spacious and are so modern that you feel as though you are staying in a brand new condo as opposed to a hotel. I stayed there for two nights and overall enjoyed my stay. You can rent out bikes for free which I did to take a fantistic bike ride around Stanley Park. My only complaint is that one of the towels and my robe were slightly dirty. When I called the front desk to complain those items were immediately replaced. But for a 5 star hotel I would have expected a spotless room. I also expected the front desk to act a bit more shocked and thus more appologetic about the issue but they didn't make a big deal out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest”
Reviews.Author: SeattleToAnywhere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim for two nights in early January. Wow, oh wow!!! From start to finish we had the most magnificent stay. Upon arrival, we drove up to the valet and once giving them our last name, we were immediately checked in and handed our hotel card keys - never even had to visit the front desk. From there, we were escorted up to our room by a very nice, and very imformative, bellman. Turns out, we were generously upgraded to a deluxe harbour view room (had booked a standard room) with sweeping views of the harbour and mountains. The bathroom was so luxurious... equipped with our own jetted hot tub! The rainshower was great too! And for those ladies that worry about lighting, it was perfect for doing make up. We were looking for a nicer restaurant for dinner and the bellman recommended Gotham (great steakhouse - I'll need to do a seperate review for that!). We said we were happy to try it and from there, the conceirge made us reservations and informed us that the hotel's car would drive us there and pick us up. So super easy and we saved on cab fare! Our entire weekend was filled with great kindness and sincere help from everyone at the Fairmont. We never felt like a burden regardless of any random requests we may have had. By the way, don't miss Giovani's in the lobby level - we enjoyed a great breakfast & lunch there. Would highly recommend the paninis. Oh, and the sugar bun pastry! :) Thanks Fairmont Pacific Rim for a WONDERFUL and very memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel, beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: shaz_aussie39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on December 26 with my husband (it was part of his 50th birthday present as well as tickets to the Canucks game). Stunning hotel, we had a room (well the bathroom) which had views of Canada place, harbour & mountains. Breakfast was included which was chose to have in room as we were leaving early to go up to Whistler. Service, views and food were 5 star, spa in bathroom was a wonderful treat. Very happy we stayed but It was a lot of money for one night - recommend for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Tops”
Reviews.Author: jazimblue
Reviews.Content: I'm regularly in Vancouver on business and the Pacific Rim has become the only place I'll stay. Totally convenient to downtown offices and the floatplane terminal. Cool decor, feel and smell. Great rooms, beds. Service is great. The negatives - no sauna, spa massages our second rate, whirlpools are all cool, pool only 3 ft deep, gym has okay equipment but I much prefer great windows.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: ab0000
Reviews.Content: This is truly a great hotel with an amazing staff. Location is perfectly situated near the waterfront and a 5 minute walk to both Robson St. and Gastown.
