The room was beautifully appointment with an amazing bathroom and excellent closet space. Extremely comfortable bed with top quality linen....the mark of a true 5 star hotel. The front doorman gave us a great recommentdation for a sushi restaurant, which is located right across the street. When we return to Vancouver there is no doubt that we will choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 4bearsie
Reviews.Content: We have just enjoyed a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel en route to a white Christmas in Whistler. We had 3 rooms (should have been 4 but one daughter is stuck in London with the snow storm dilemma). The rooms were spacious, spotlessly clean and well equipped. The bathrooms were large and very modern. The tv in the bathroom mirror was a very interesting idea. Our meals at Oru restaurant were spectacular with equally good service and wine. It's very nice to have an alternative restaurant for breakfast and Giovanni's was perfect for a quick breakfast with lots of choices if you don't want a buffet breakfast. The hotel position is great. Views overlooking the harbour and mountains were a delight to waken to. The shops are all walking distance and with the underground malls it's easy to get around even when it's raining. GasTown is a short walk with all the restaurants and quirky shops. The hotel is 30 mins from the airport and it's about a 2 1/2 hr drive to Whistler. Sea planes operate from a terminal across the road if you choose to take a trip to Vancouver Is and the ferry operates nearby for a harbour trip. The beautiful fireplace in the foyer is a perfect spot to enjoy high tea or a cocktail and to admire the beautiful Christmas tree.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: gbcecanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed December 11th 2010. Incredible location with views of Stanley Park, the harbour and the North Shore mountains. Friendly efficient service. Rooms are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: rogjaminov
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim for my birthday weekend and were very impressed with the hotel. Here are some highlights: Service: The service is excellent, from the bellhops to the restaurant staff, everyone was friendly and interested in making our stay a memorable one. Do make use of the courtesy cars (BMW SUVs or 7 Series) which are driven by professional, personable drivers. Special thanks to Andreas, our driver while we were there. WiFi: Here's a shocker - it's free! So if you're tired of getting stung for $15 a day for an Internet connection, the Fairmont is for you. Rooms: Beautiful, relaxing rooms with very comfortable beds. The large bathrooms all have rain showers and televisions embedded in the mirrors. Fitness center: The fitness center is free and has modern workout machines, bottled water and towel service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel hands down in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: AmberAbbotsford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I tired the new Pacific Rim Fairmont in Vancouver for the first time this week-end. We have stayed at all of the other Fairmonts in Vancouver, Whistler and Seattle and love them all but I have to say that the Pacific Rim is a step above all of these other fine hotels. The service was top notch, we felt spoiled! The Hotel is set in one of the most beautiful settings in the world with views that will take your breath away. Our room was a Signature View King corner suite on the 17th floor. The room was outstanding, very high tech with remote curtains, spa lighting, beautiful decor and the bathroom was the nicest I've ever seen, even better than high end hotels in Vegas. The wrap around windows overlooking the harbor with the snow-dusted mountains and the 5 sails from Canada place in the background were amazing! The funky square soaker tub was the highlight as it was placed right against the window and you could sit and soak in the jetted lighted tub while looking out over the city. We booked the Breakfast in Bed/Spa package and it was a week-end of pampering! The spa was also one of the best I've ever visited and you won't find a more beautiful backdrop of scenery anywhere. The outdoor private hot tubs overlooked the harbor and the city. The amenities were incredible. The ladies change room went on forever including a cozy lounge with a fireplace, coffee, teas, snacks.....the showers and steams rooms were so nice. Don't leave the spa without trying the "Experience Shower". Valet service is expensive but so is the parking if you choose to park yourself. It's worth the service and ease that it adds to your holiday. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service with their own BMW's which is a classy touch! Most everything is in walking distance so you rarely need to worry about transportation I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is coming to Vancouver to experience the best the city has to offer. Also don't miss trying on the Sugar Buns at the cafe G in the hotel.....you will think you've died and gone to heaven. .

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Pacific Rim - Our new Vancouver hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dreve
Reviews.Content: In some ways I hate to share just how much we loved this hotel, afraid we won't be able to find a room in the future! Anyway, my husband and I were in town for a combination of business and pleasure and "pleasure" describes the experience at the Pacific Rim. We're always impressed with Fairmonts but this was the best so far. Beautifully appointed in a combination of modern and retro (think 60's cool), we enjoyed every aspect from the gorgeous lobby, chic lounge with oversized fireplace to the great quality and comfort of our room. The service too was outstanding - all staff seem utterly committed to the success of the hotel and to the comfort of their guests. Thank you, Pacific Rim, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: geriann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel once a year to try different Fairmounts or go back to the ones we like. We've only been to the ones in Western Canada and quite enjoy our weekend visit to Pacific Rim. It really is a treat! The rooms are amazing! They've thought of everything. We only stayed in the Suite with 2 person tub but it was big enough for us. The Hotel is very modern. We we're quite excited to see how it would be seeing that our all time favorite is the Banff Springs. The only thing that disappointed my husband and I was the spa. It is nice...but it's no where near the spa at Banff Springs. The chairs in the co-ed lounge are very uncomfortable and that is the only place really where couples can hang other than the tubs. As well...not sure why they would put the spa on that side of the building as it's not the side with the harbor view. The view is of other tall buildings. Little disappointing! The one in Banff has an awesome lounge area to order food, relax, put your feet up, read and hang for hours enjoying the breath taking views. ***Still...this hotel is one that will see me again.

Reviews.Title: “Heroic Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: RWCole
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how nice everything at this hotel was during our week stay. Carla at the concierge who went out of her way to find a screw for my glasses and fix them to all the friendly smiles from the staff - top notch! Rooms were very clean, was very impressed with all the technology, touch sensitive lighting and drape controls were all too cool. Bathrooms were very well laid out and the Electric Mirror with TV was something to tell your friends and family about. Only suggestion is to add some grab bars in the shower, can get a little scary for older guests. Fey and Linda did a fantastic job every day with the room and was a delight to chat with them about their jobs, housekeeping mobile packs, and Linda went out of her way to get me information on them for our hotel. If I ever get back to Vancouver your hotel will be my home!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel, Modern and Trendy, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelDeer
Reviews.Content: This is a brand-new hotel that opened less than a year ago. It is modern, clean, chic, and stylish. The service was very friendly, very attentive, professional, and helpful with advice about getting around and restaurants. The lobby was busy, especially at night. There was an active bar scene with live music (but not too loud). The rooms were clean and spacious. The beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was very large. The toilet was conveniently located in a separate alcove with door. The tub worked well and the shower had two showerheads. An amusing aspect of the bathroom was the built-in TV in the mirror. The main room had a large flat-screen TV. An odd part about the room was the lighting design and curtains. Everything is electronic/automated. There are no switches. Instead of switches, there are small buttons with which to change the mood lighting in the room and to open/close the curtains. I would have been happier with standard light switches and manually controlled window curtains. The hotel is located next to the Convention Center (with underground connecting walkway) and within 2 minutes of beautiful views over the water. From the hotel, I walked to many places in Vancouver including Gastown, Chinatown, and Yaletown. By the way, if you like ice cream/gelato, you need to try Bella Gelateria, located on the same block as the hotel. It was terrifically good!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelcanuck29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding. They have thought of everything to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are large, modern, clean, smell fantastic, comfortable, and representative of the locale. The staff is awesome, the lobby is fun, and the location is great. Additionally, the attached Willow Stream spa is amazing. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It may not be the cheapest, but it is completely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Rim”
Reviews.Author: MTVandendooren
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many nice hotels, and this one did not disappoint! The hotel is lovely, the rooms are great, location excellent, and the service is outstanding. Kudos to the Pacific Rim for their superior customer service - it's hard to find these days. We received a warm reception, the doormen were very friendly, and the concierge was terrific. There is only one thing that wasn't outstanding, and that's the food. To be fair, we didn't eat at their main restaurant (Oru). However, we had drinks/dessert in the lobby bar one night (love the lighting and 4 piece jazz band), and found the desserts to be "good". Then, we had lunch at Giovane the next day, and had their pizza, it was also "good". Given the high calibre of everything at this lovely hotel, I feel like the food should also be outstanding, or at least "very good". That is something they can work on though...the rest is great!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: katn00n
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and ready to assist with anything you require. The rooms are beautiful, cozy and comfortable. The bathroom is amazing. There is lots of counter space, a soaker tub, separate shower and a TV built into the mirror. The rooms are pre-programmed with lighting 'moods' you can select such as nighttime, spa or grooming. Housekeeping service was fantastic. They came in everyday, remade the bed, organized our belongings in the bathroom and at turn down service a bottle of water was provided by the bed side. The room we stayed in had a balcony overlooking the pool area and towards the Olympic torch waterfront area. It was equipped with patio furniture and a gas fireplace, so even on a chilly evening you could enjoy sitting outside. I think the only negative thing I could say, was that you had to pay extra for the wi-fi, but all in all everything was wonderful. This hotel was definitely a 'splurge', but for a special occasion, this would be my first pick.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HabsFan21
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable rooms. Everything is automated, lights, drapes, etc. Very comfortable beds. Evening turndown service. Best hotel gym ever! Great equipment, bottled water, fruit, etc... Lounge & Restaurants were fantastic. Valet service is brutal though. Everytime we need the vehicle, it was at least a 20 minute wait. We paid $379/night for a mountainview, king suite.

Reviews.Title: “An experience that I would like to repeat again and again and again”
Reviews.Author: VaTravel
Reviews.Content: We ended up in the Fairmont Pacific Rim for one night due to overbooking in our original hotel. I must say that stay in this property was a very pleasant surprise. I loved everything about it. We walked into a lobby on Saturday night, after 7 hours of traveling and found it bustling with a wedding party. Despite all that, we never felt out of place, the check in was brief and courteous and we were shown to our room within few minutes after arrival. Our room was facing an office building next door, but it did not deter me, in the city, it is rare to have a truly exceptional view, and I was not planning to spend lots of time in the room anyway. The beds were one of the best hotel beds I have slept on. I loved the level of firmness, the sheets and the cleanliness. The lights / curtain controls were interesting and I did not find them hard to operate. As many reviewers mentioned before me, there was TV in the mirror, and we all loved it since it was one of those things that you rarely see in hotels! Concierge service was exceptional. I have talked to 3 of them over the course of stay, and all three were very pleasant, and provided valuable recommendations. Location was very close to waterfront, Stanley Park and to Skytrain and Tram. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet at the hotel's restaurant. It had a nice variety and not crowded. I especially enjoyed my green tea that was served in the cast-iron tea kettle with the warmer! All of the staff that we encountered was very pleasant and helpful. Checkout was quick and we were on our way to explore the city. When I come back to Vancouver, I would certainly not hesitate to book this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great city!!”
Reviews.Author: texan4eva
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel: I just get off the skytrain which is a *tough* 3.5 blocks away (and I say tough because it's a series of uphills and downhills on what seemed like cobblestone sidewalks in downtown), I'm rolling a heavy suitcase with a laptop case piled on top and a heavy purse...needless to say, I'm huffing and puffing. And it's 60 degrees out. I finally reach my hotel and before I could even reach the front door, a doorman comes up to me and asks for my name. I reluctantly tell him and upon briefly checking his list, he informs me that I am checked in and he already has my key. You don't know how relieved I was to realize I didn't have to stand in any kind of line or even talk to a receptionist. All I had to do was walk to the elevators and go to my room. It was like spotting an oasis of water in a desert. In fact, there were two complimentary bottles of water (and chocolates) waiting for me in the room! The room: I booked a harbor-facing, king bed room on the 10th floor. Well, it's not the largest room I've ever stayed in, but they spared no expense when it came to the little extras and made it feel like I was VIP. The lights are ultra-high tech. All controlled by a touch switchpad. One by the door, the desk, and at bedside. Very convenient. It made going around a hotel room turning off lamps with a turn of a black knob seem so ancient and barbaric. I LOVED the tv behind the mirror. I loved the deep soaking tub even more. Especially because it was spotless. For once, I actually felt comfortable taking a bath in a hotel bathroom. With my clothes off. The plush, white robes were a nice touch too. Made me feel like a filthy rich millionaire. The bed was super-comfy. I actually want to purchase the sheets and comforter for my own house!! The view from my balcony was nice, but from the 10th floor, the view of the harbor was partially blocked by the convention center. Not horrible, but not great either. One word of caution: do NOT under any circumstances make a long-distance phone call. It costs $6.75 for the first minute and $2.50 for each additional minute. I found out the hard way. For a 9-minute phone call back home in the states, I had to promise my first born child. However if you sign up with the Fairmont's President's Club ahead of time, you get free internet access in your room everyday. That was a plus. The service: VERY friendly staff here. Every time I called the front desk, I would get a personal greeting and never waited more than 30 secs to get a real person on the phone. The housekeeping staff is also ultra-nice and meticulous. The bartending staff in the lobby was excellent. They are really friendly (in a real *friend* kind of way, not a fakey hotel-service kind of way). I enjoyed the drinks and food I had there. Although it was pricey, it was worth it for the people-watching and convenience. I never actually made it to the spa, but when I called there, the receptionist was very friendly and informative. They were even willing to extend their Mon-Thurs. special to me on a Friday. Usually day spas are not very flexible with their specials. Checking out: So, this is one place where the hotel could improve. Since I asked that my bill be broken down in a different way, it took upwards of 10 minutes. The couple next to me also ran into a snag and were there for longer than they wanted. It seems that during a time when every guest is presumably trying to catch a flight, they should have more knowledgeable and quicker staff at the checking out process. All in all, this is a very classy, modern boutique hotel that is in a very good location in downtown Vancouver. I would venture to say that all the action in Vancouver happens within 5 miles (or less) of this hotel. Robson street is within walking distance and Yaletown is 2 stops away on the skytrain. (I'm sure there are numerous other examples of fun areas around the downtown area that I'm not aware of.)

Reviews.Title: “The dream hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skofy
Reviews.Content: What to say about the hotel if you feel sorry every time when you have to leave the room ? Without any doubt - this hotel is one of the best city hotels I ever stayed. The rooms are simply perfect, the staff friendly and smiling all the time, breakfast is awesome, the location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janneghj
Reviews.Content: This is a super new Hotel, just recently opend (I believe 9 month ago). The hotel's style is very modern with stylish interior und large rooms. Located directly opposite the Convention Center and the coastline, 5 minutes from Stanley Park etc. almost everything is within walking distance. Breakfast is one of the best I have had in Hotels so far. A plus is also the gym and (small) outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable staff and service”
Reviews.Author: 9Adventuress
Reviews.Content: I stayed for more than 9 nights and spent over $7,000.00. There was no booze and no entertaining. I only had one spa treatment. I had a city view room (lower priced than harbor view) on the gold concierge level. I was with a large conference and would have checked out the same day I arrived but for the fact that the hotels in the vicinity of the conference were completely booked. At the Airport: The hotel booked transportation from the airport to the hotel. Their contract limo service could not find the hotel. After the second pass where I kept seeing the sign and telling the driver he had driven past it, he finally got me there. Then he did not how to get the doors unlocked and took about six tries as the hotel doorman is desperately trying to get me out. I could not get the door handle to release. That’s for starters. Recommendation for airport transfer to hotel: Make your own reservation for a sedan service. The taxis, unfortunately, are very hit or miss as to their competence. Check into a bus or sky train transfer. Check-in and Lobby Atmosphere: When you walk in the hotel in the late afternoon you are greeted by a loud wall of sound from an off-key singer in the lobby. It is so loud that one can hardly hear what reception is saying. I had to ask reception to repeat several times. It was so loud it hurt my ears. This seems to be the way the hotel runs its PA system. If you book a regular room, you get to go to the reception at the front lobby. If you book a Fairmont Gold room, you get to stand in line at reception at the front lobby and then stand in line for a second time at the Fairmont Gold check-in on the 20th floor. Odd isn’t it? Well, it gets more odd. Recommendation for Check-in: There is nothing you can do to avoid their check-in problems. The cost: When I checked in, the hotel had switched my reservation without my consent to a more expensive room charge. I caught it and my room was changed immediately. The Room: Lights: A computer that fails regularly and has to be re-set even twice a day, controls every light in the room. I was standing in the bathroom one evening and every light in the entire room went out leaving me in pitch darkness. I could not get the lights in the bathroom to completely turn off. The significance of it is that the door to the bathroom is glass. So, the light from the bathroom kept the beds lit up all night. The engineer for the hotel told me that he and his wife were required to stay in the hotel when it first opened. Same thing happened to him. It took him three months to get an answer from the manufacturer of the light system. And that answer doesn’t always work. You have to know the combination of LED’s to hit just right or it won’t go out. The light by the bed: When you want to turn on all the lights in the room-it just won’t work. If you try to turn on the light by itself, the light will turn on and then just turn off by itself!!! Try again! And when a light is off, you cannot see the writing on the led switch plate to determine which of the myriad of buttons will turn on the light. I put a book in front of the LED lights to get the room darker at night and had some ultra-bright LED’s taped over by the engineer. The window does open. But the gasket around the window keeps fresh air from entering the room The slightest sound in the hall could be heard in my room. I could have used more drawer space. The showerhead in the shower keeps sliding out of your hands and is just plain difficult. More noise: Seaplane traffic and the room: This hotel’s premium rooms face the harbor and are only a couple of hundred feet from the water’s edge. Directly across from the rooms is the take-off and landing zone for Canada’s busiest float plane airport and one of the busiest in the world. People commute to their jobs via floatplane. With poorly soundproofed windows and flights taking off from DAWN and landing through dusk, this is not a relaxing place to be let alone get a decent night’s sleep when you have early meetings or want to sleep in on the weekend. Requests for meals: I made requests for meals and found it very difficult to get the hotel to comply. The hotel’s description of their menu items is not complete and were an unhappy surprise to me time after time. For example, the hotel lists on its menu that it has steel cut oatmeal that has brown sugar and raisins on the side. What it does not tell you is that the oatmeal is pre-sweetened and pre-flavored. And even when I requested that the oatmeal be plain, it prepared it with the pre-sweetener and pre-flavoring. I finally had to tell them no pre-sweetener, no pre-flavoring, no milk and prepared with just plain hot water to get “plain oatmeal.” It took several days to work this out with the kitchen. This did not make for happy breakfasts during the first part of my stay. Another example is where the kitchen had written instructions from the chef to not include cheese in any of my orders. The kitchen ignored the chef’s written instructions. When the kitchen will not follow their executive chef’s written instructions, I felt quite helpless in dealing with them myself. I would also like to note that because the hotel made me make all my requests through room service, I had to pay a room service charge plus gratuity for every meal no matter where in the hotel I ate the meal. Transportation: I asked the Gold concierge to not to book me with the same limo service that brought me from the airport. When I needed another sedan and driver, they booked me with the same limo service. The driver was late and could not find the restaurant. When I used the complimentary hotel car service, it was late. Laundry: Don’t believe what is written on the laundry list that your laundry will be back BY 6:00 p.m. mine wasn’t back until 9:00 PM. The laundry department has contracted with an outside service that was NEVER returning laundry BY 6:00 PM unless you paid 50% more for express service. In addition, things that should have been pressed were not pressed. Gold Concierge Service: I was told, with a sneer, by one of the Gold concierges that the reason that the hotel was not operating very well was that the hotel was full of people from my profession. I believe the Gold concierges are inexperienced. ATM Machine: The hotel’s ATM machine accepts very few foreign cards. The one good department in the hotel is the housekeeping that cleans the rooms. The rooms were clean and the staff cleaning the rooms was good. Swimming pool is on the 6th floor and outdoors. It was quite chilly to get out of the heated pool and be in the wind. The pool could be 1-2 degrees warmer. I did not use the hot tub. It was adequate for laps. The other people using the pool were courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Vancouver? You can't go wrong with this choice.”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithChildren
Reviews.Content: I recently had to go to Vancouver for a week-long conference and was booked at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. Having never stayed at a Fairmont before, I was not sure what to expect. Well, what I got exceeded any expectations I could have had. From the minute I stepped out of the cab until the minute I left, the service was top notch (friendly and professional). It's hard to imagine the location being much better than it is (being close to the Olympic Torch, the convention center, the business district and within walking distance of various shopping and restaurant districts). The hotel itself is an excellent design, bridging modern and classic effortlessly. The room has a nice degree of high-tech gear. My only negatives would be that the majority of the hotel rooms (there are private residences as well) seem to have only partial views of the water and the light switches can be somewhat confusing/challenging. But don't let that keep you from going!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mdcubsfan
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - our first time to Vancouver. Went for business but brought the family along. Great location right near the waterfront. Brand new hotel that opened right before the Olympics, and you could tell. Everything about it was very nice, from the front reception to the lobbies and the other amenities. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fanatstic roof deck hot tub, very pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: Kstar1974
Reviews.Content: The two best features of this hotel were our room and the roof deck. We had a single king room on a corner of the building. Our bathroom had floor to ceiling glass windows and a huge jetted tub - so cool! The hot tub on the roof deck was fantastic, and because it was raining and October, not too crowded. At $279/night it was well worth it, though I know the rates can go much higher. Thanks to the Fairmont staff for being so kind to our pooch. They love dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Perch for Business or Pleasure in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: NomadicNina
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 spectacular days in British Columbia with husband, this past week, as mini -respite before beginning new job, but since everything was flawless, it actually felt like a grand vacation. And it is likely because we stayed at perfect places. Our trip had several components and I had spent much time researching and exploring alternatives, like all travel gurus, so I now want to share my findings and successes with my fellow trip advisor devotees. (See my posts on two other stops this trip: Blackrock in Ucluelet and Wickanninish in Tofino). Fairmont itself is a terrific property, spanking new as it opened last year for the Olypmpics, with zero apparent wrinkles. The hotel is completely modern yet with classic sensibility so as not to alienate the Four Seasons type. Conciege, front desk and bell staff all great. Special call out to Matthew (of the Concierge team) who I spoke with many times during my "research:" he was very helpful, and gave me honest and focused opinions regarding my 3 day jaunt to Vancouver Island. We checked in at 2:30 am (scheduled flight from JFK lands at 1:30 am): front desk and bellman were as alert as mid-day and the surprise platter of fruit and cheese was very welcoming and perfectly fresh. I have stayed at many top hotels and enjoyed many suites: this is among the best. Bathroom has 3 lighting categories: night, spa and groom---none of this leaving a wasteful light on all night in the bathroom, none of this squinting as you apply makeup. E-drapes are brilliant. Furnishings and artwork fit into BC landscape, but are comfy and beautiful. Morning coffee room service (I need my delivery before I can even contemplate my day) was reasonably priced (am used to being robbed at most places, often $20 for one person, here it was about $12 for two) and they threw in delectable pastries. Lobby food very good, tho somehow they cook the salmon in their sushi! Oru is delicious, and Emily (sommelier turned server) is delightful, pleasant and makes the evening feel like you are a friend's home. And when I spent the day walking the town, the hotel sent their driver to pick up my packages from my lunch stop. The IBA (international lawyers) was in town, so hotel was packed to capacity, yet we never felt unattended to or rushed. There were no crowds --just a great vibe in the lobby as the guests toted briefbags and shopping bags and greeted and exchanged cards and smiles. Wonderful environment. We had suite in new west wing --overlooking pool and convention center yet with larger views too, even from 7th floor. Join the the Presidents Club: costs nothing, gets you automatic free Wi Fi and access to upgrades etc. Their properties in Seattle and other locations are wonderful as well. I am a huge fan of this "chain" . In a word, this hotel is very user friendly: great location, every amenity and service you want or need, ideal location. Ths place gets my vote and will likely become my business base when in this area in the future. Kudos to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: jilldv10
Reviews.Content: We used an FPC suite upgrade certificate for our stay and enjoyed a Pool View Suite (PV) the first two nights and an Harbour View Suite (HV) the last night of our stay. The PV suite was amazing! We looked directly over the pool and had views of the convention centre and even some mountains! The room was very large and open. There are two full marble bathrooms and the master bathroom had a large jetted freestanding tub, a TV in the mirror and double sinks. There was a butlers kitchen with a full fridge and nice sized living area with lots of seating. There are two large TVs and the beds in both rooms were the most comfortable I've slept in. The patio had a gas fireplace, small table with two chairs and a lounger as well. The HV suite wasn't quite as nice, but it was lovely as well. It didn't have a butlers kitchen nor double sinks and the tub was smaller and not jetted. The view was just out the side windows and our bedroom window was very close to the pool so we kept the blinds closed the entire time. The location is good, right next to the seawall and close to the skytrain and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We booked the bed and breakfast rate for two days and it was great value. One day we ordered in room dining and the other we ate at the buffet in the restaurant. We didn't have any additional charges and the meals were good. One thing we weren't overly impressed with was that we requested an early check-in and our room wasn't ready early even though people checking in right after us were taken to their pool view suite immediately. The concierge was helpful and the hotel was very busy but it didn't feel hectic at all. We would like to return but I doubt we could afford it without the FPC certificates! It was a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here, You will love it!”
Reviews.Author: Lakehouse258
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 3 nights prior to boarding the Oosterdam. This new hotel has it all. The staff very helpful, and cheerful. Our room was large and the bathroom beautiful....marble, elegant, 1st class. The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious. We were on the 6th floor with a harbour view. Probably have a better view on a higher floor, but I like lower floors. The hotel is in a beautiful area and we even walked back from Stanley Park. Great area to walk about.

Reviews.Title: “The most accammodating Hotel we ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: tr9966
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the concierge floor, we found the staff extremely accommodating, they went above and beyond to make our stay pleasant. The room was beautiful, and kept very clean. We have traveled extensively, and we never had service of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay with our baby”
Reviews.Author: May0478
Reviews.Content: Located a very short walk from the Canada Line light rail, that took us directly from the airport to hotel. A mere 20minute ride! Beautiful hotel with the friendliness service ever! When we arrived in our room, there was crib set up and toiletries for the baby! There was also a baby tub, which was SO considerate. The room was large and the bathroom large and luxerious. Overall a fabulous stay! The only downside of room was the high tech electronic light controls and drape control. Could not figure it out! But cool none the less!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: CoTravelsalot
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at top notch 5 star hotels in many countries but the Fairmont Pacific Rim is simply one amazing hotel property. From the moment you are greeted at the door by a bellman WITH your room key in hand - this hotel knows how to treat and impress a guest. We checked in later at night but there was no problem our room was waited and we were upgraded to an amazing 1 bedroom bay front suite with a pool view. The room was perfect. A large patio overlooking the bay and mountains as well as the pool. A pull out sofa in the main living area a king in the bedroom and 2 amazing bathrooms. Perfect classy modern decor. We are now forever loyal Fairmont guests. Too bad there is no longer a Fairmont in Colorado :( .

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing City and Hotel, the Staff unbelieavable!!! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Audreeb
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often and all over the world, but I must say staying at this hotel and the City of Vancouver was an amazing experience. The Concierge David and the head bell staff Chris made this one amazing vacation. The best part of the day was coming back after seeing all the beautiful things that there are to do in this city and and the areas surrounding it, was coming back to the hotel to see Chris and David and the rest of the staff. This staff will go beyond the call of duty to make sure you have everything you need from the minute you awake to the minute you turn off the lights in your room.. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone who likes, modern, contemporary and a great location! The concierge will recommend and make all reservations for you whether it's dining or renting a car, to just plain taking a walk....I cannot wait to go back, and the staff at this hotel will be seeing me again, they made our vacation which consisted of my Aunt, myself and my mother a most memorable 5 days that I will remember for the rest of my life.

Reviews.Title: “can't rely on the Fairmont name.........”
Reviews.Author: scrapyardnow
Reviews.Content: Sorry, but this is a lovely hotel, nice facilities, nice staff, well when your paying over 500 bucks for 3 nights, that's what you expect, the rooms were small for the price band, the staff were very, very nice, but only because they had to be, this made me very uncomfortable, the hotel was full, the staff couldn't cope, very poor for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Marble”
Reviews.Author: Iloveboutiquehotels
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was unplanned, I left another hotel since I had bad sleep. The room was very beautiful, bathroom was a dream! Rain shower, tv in the mirror, adjustable lights, marble everywhere... The individually ziplocked bath salts were a big plus. I would love to have a bathroom like that in my home. The Nespresso machine in the room was a treat. I also was impressed with the refillable water bottle in the minibar fridge, very green. The bed was incredibly comfortable I had the best sleep that night. Breakfast buffet selection was extensive, service was very good. The gelato shop at the street level was so authentic and delicious. It may not be part of the hotel but amazing nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Paul&Anne
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff and excellent spacious room, including TV in the bathroom mirror! Breakfast buffet warm and expensive so after that we walked 100m to the food court near the Waterfront hotel. Paid for mountain view which was OK but spoilt by the new Convention Centre which is as high as the tenth floor of the hotel (we were on floor 10). So, ask for a room above floor 14 if possible. Finally excellent pool plus gym where they supply headphones.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in Fab Position”
Reviews.Author: 1307boss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 7 nights , we found the hotel to be faboulously responsive to our business and leisure needs. The position of the Pacific Rim is just perfect as it is walking distance to all we needed. I would highly recommend to stay here if you were boarding one of the many cruise ships leaving from Vancouver as it is within a easy walk. The view from our room was one of the best we have experienced over looking the Habour. The Bathrooms were amazing, I'm just loving the televsion in the bathroom mirror ...... will be looking into installing one of those when we get home!!!! The spa and pool area's are a dream, well worth at least one visit. I would highly recommend this hotel....It is expensive albeit you are getting what your paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Pacific Rim is THE best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: talula001
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with a friend in Vancouver for a couple of months. We stayed in several high end hotels (among them the Opus hotel & Shangri La hotel) and I can guarantee you that the Pacific Rim Fairmont beats them all. Like some of you, I like it to plan my travels in depth, and as such, I always consult websites like Tripadvisor & Kiwicollection, as well as magazines like Conde Nast. To give you an idea, we have stayed in many high end resorts all over the world before, so we are used to luxurious holidays. For all those luxury minded travellers like me, I can reassure you that you cannot go wrong with the Fairmont Pacific Rim, which has opened a couple of months ago. This is what I liked about the hotel : - location : it is next to Canada Place and in walking distance to everything (including the Canada Rail). Vancouver is surprisingly small and you can explore everything on feet. Having said that, the Opus hotel is definatly in a better spot for those looking to stay in a trendy neighboorhood, and the Shangri La hotel is a bit more centrally located. - service : top notch ; the personel is amongst the friendliest I ever encountered in a luxury hotel (but this may be a Vancouver thing as everybody in the city was so kind) - rooms : this was the most splendid room of a city hotel I have ever staid in. It felt like being home away from home. The rooms are oversized, very nicely decorated and lightened. The beds were heavenly. I can recommend everybody to stay in a poolside room : these rooms come with a private, covered balcony that has an openfire as well as table with chairs (to dine outside if you want to). It was so nice to relax there (no matter what weather) before going to sleep. I did visit some other rooms that come with quite a spectaular view, but personally, I prefered the poolside room with balcony and openfire (as the same view that some other rooms have can also be enjoyed from the waterfront). - Pool and hottube : this was genuinly the largest pool we encountered in Vancouver. Hottube was very nice as well. The whole pool area was very nicely done (with cabanas and palm trees). I can also recommend everybody to become a member of the Fairmont Club before arriving in the hotel, because this will give you access to complimentary wireless internet access (which will save you 20 CAN $ a day). Book the rooms in advance or look for specials on the Fairmont website, as there are some very good deals out there. The only thing that I did not like that much was the main lobby. Although luxurious, it felt not very intimate and has the ambiance of a shopping mall or small airport (very loud and crowded).

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern hotel but a little lacking in warmth.”
Reviews.Author: helen_sheard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is state of the art and ultra modern but certainly lacked warmth in our opinion. The staff were helpful and efficient but it did not feel at all cozy in the public areas, all a bit antiseptic and shiny and full of local business people having cocktails. Maybe it will acquire some character as it ages. I thought my hi tech husband would love all the gadgets in the room but even he thought it lacked character. Views from the room of Coal Harbour and the mountains were amazing and the room amenities could not be faulted, the spa was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Total luxury”
Reviews.Author: Conairaa
Reviews.Content: Although this is a new hotel, there were absolutely no glitches. From check-out to check-in, all the staff was friendly, helpful, and extraordinarily courteous. We had a corner room, and it lacked nothing: two chairs AND a desk chair, ample lamps and mood lighting, a comfortable bed with enough pillows, and the bathroom was amazing, complete with an in-mirror tv! The location is great--so convenient to either convention center, restaurants, the sea walkway, tour buses. My only beef was that the live music in the bar/seating area was loud--so loud that we couldn't have a conversation. Even moving to the outside bar area didn't help completely. And if the pool we could see from our room is the only pool, it isn't big enough to hold more than two or three people at a time. Otherwise, this hotel has set the bar very high for location, comfort, and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Georgeous Hotel, Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: luvjasperdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only 1 night during the Labour Day weekend in a Deluxe Harbour/Mountain view room. I only wish we could have stayed longer. The room was spotless. This is a very new hotel and our room looked as though we were the first people to stay in it. The bed was very, very comfortable with soft, lovely bedding and pillows. The bathroom in our suite was gorgeous. Lots of glass and marble, the television in the bathroom mirror. Everything is very modern and high-tech in the room and the espresso maker was a nice touch. When we checked in, the clerk at the front desk actually walked us to the elevator and couldn't have been more helpful. It's a long time since I've stayed at a hotel where I could say that absolutely nothing could have been better. If you want to stay in downtown Vancouver, this is the place you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zoezer
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is as good as all the reviews suggest. I stayed 4 nights in a deluxe harbor view room for a conference plus getaway and then returned for one night in a suite. Both were extremely comfortable and well equipped with amazing views. The suite was extraordinary with 2 balconies, each with a fireplace, tons of space and a fabulous view over the pool with the green roof of the convention center behind it, and the North Vancouver mountains in the background. Location cannot be beat - convenient to everything including Skytrain. The service was impeccable - especially loved the complimentary BMW rides to downtown locations. The gym was nice but running along the seawall even better. Food in the lobby bar was very good, and room service was quite good and prompt. The cafe in the lobby was so-so, everything looked better than it tasted. DO NOT miss the gelato shop located in the hotel building with its own exterior entrance. It is dangerously delicious especially if you are staying for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “My Guess is this hotel will shoot up the best hotel list.”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0517
Reviews.Content: Had the lovely experience of staying at this hotel for 5 nights in August. I selected it based soley on the reviews on trip advisor. It is a beauty! Everything is high tech and so much fun. We had a pool view room with an outdoor fireplace that we enjoyed completely. It was so relaxing and such a great hotel to unwind after a busy day of being "out on the town" . The lobby is so New York Shick - we loved it. The open fireplace and music and lively "bar scene" made us "old folks" feel young again. Great service from all the staff and always a smile and friendly greeting. Only complaint was with the hair dryer in the bathroom. I know this may sound petty, but it was cheap if best . We had just come from Seattle and Victoria and both the hotels we stayed in had wonderful icon hairdryers. With the price of the rooms at this hotel it was amazing to me they had them in the room especially with everything else being so upsacale.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated oasis living up to its five star standards”
Reviews.Author: atravelgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is going to be our go-to hotel when vacationing in Vancouver. It is ultra modern yet still warm and inviting. The spacious rooms have floor to ceiling views of the Burrard inlet, North Coast mountains and Canada Place. The marble bathrooms feature a large in-mirror t.v., soaking tub and rainfall shower. The raised outdoor pool area even offers partial views of the magnificent Vancouver waterfront. The location is across from the convention center and within walking distance to the major attractions. Having stayed at other five star hotels in downtown Vancouver, the Fairmont Pacific Rim beats them hands down, from its location to its amenities to its view. We greatly look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: I had a standard king room -- I was amazed. The room was incredibly spacious, well appointed, modern, and beautiful. Huge large screen TV and very roomy workspace. The bathroom was absolutely beautiful with both a rain shower and a hand held shower. Lots of towels and nice toiletries. Great restaurant. Terrific location. The staff were all wonderfully helpful -- I cannot praise these folks enough-- thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great service but stay away from one concierge!”
Reviews.Author: Cattledogs
Reviews.Content: I usually try to avoid a large hotel. But this one was a large hotel, and I relised why I avoided large hotels while I was waiting for our rooms to be ready after the check-in time. As I was so busy before the trip and I did not do any homework on the city, I used the concierge a lot. All the concierge were very helpful except one. She was the most allogant one I have ever met. She was on the phone for 5 minutes at least without even acknowledging. OK, she probably was helping other customers on the phone, but it was more like a business call. Waited, and waited, and she finally finished and asked me as if I was bothering her busy schedule if I have a question. And her answers were made up with one or two words. I wanted to know if I needed to take a taxi to Aquarium. She said yes. Can I work. Yes. Is it far? Yes. How far? About 40 minutes. Is there a bus? No. It is amazing that the hotel like this can afford to keep her as a staff to inteface the guests, Economy must be good in Vancouver enough to keep the bad staff. With one of the 2 rooms not being ready after the check-in time and this, I complained to the front staff. She was very quickly found another room for us, and the complaint was communicated to the manager. I know the manager tried to contact me but it was my faults not to get back to the manager. The rooms were very nice, quiet, and the TV in the bathroom was the best thing for my son. There were a couple of things that needed to be attended, and they were handled quickly and professionally. Although pets are allowed, no pets over 20lbs are not accepted. So this is not a pet friednly hotel. Recent UPENN Vet school research found that the dachshund and chi were too most aggressive breeds and they are both 20 lbs. The service was superb oherwise, and it is so sad that one bad apple can ruin the overall hotel impression. Will I come back? I probably would, but I would stay away from the concierge desk if she was there!!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in vancouver; large beautiful rooms, amazing staff....”
Reviews.Author: YVR_DXB
Reviews.Content: stayed for more than 2 weeks recently and was extremely happy with the hotel overall. Large rooms, great lounge/bar and more importantly absolutely great staff all over the hotel. Was greeted with a smile and a hello everyday by staff all over the hotel, and everyone was more than helpful with any requirements. Of course anyone will ask what about the negatives; late night room service menu very limited - even staff agreed with me (even won a bet with reception staff that there wasn't even a burger on the menu), $30something per day for parking and $20something per day for internet is quite upsetting.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel with really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WeekendGuest
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and had a pool room suite which was very spacious and had 2 patios leading out to the pool - these had outdoor fireplaces as well - we had great weather though so no need to use them.. 2 Rooms - master bedroom with large bathroom and then large sitting room with dining area. This had a sofa bed for the children in the evening and they also had an additional shower room with toilet. Separate small kitchen with a huge fridge and Nespresso machine. The hotel is new and so well decorated and with lots of gadgets in the room - including a TV in the mirror in the bathroom. Breakfast buffet is good and there is also a cafe on the ground floor. There was an English concierge from Northampton who gave us really good advice re which sightseeing company to use and getting around. I have stayed at the Fairmont Vancouver before and that is also nice - more grand older style - however I would definitely stay at the Pacific Rim again and would not hesitate to recommend it to families and business travellers - it is right opposite the convention centre

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: brbiii
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Fairmont Pacific Rim! We stayed on the Gold floor which offered some of the best service, an excellent lounge (overlooking the harbor), and nicely appointed (even if a bit small) rooms. The hotel pool was a highlight for the kids and had a consistent depth that my five year old could handle on her own. The location provides amazing views and easy access to much of Vancouver. The combination of friendly service, a newer property and excellent location makes this hotel an easy recommendation.. If the added personal touch and easy access to an excellent good food and beverage service is of value to you consider the Gold floor.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: BigTipper
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! Many of my colleagues are now converts, as well. Great location, down by Coal Harbour, and if you face the harbour, you can get a nice view. My most recent stay, I was on the other side, facing the street, so no view, but I had a nicer room. The electronic lighting system is both good and bad. It's a neat system, when it works... Both rooms I've had in my stays had quirks. Both times, one bedside lamp would flash on and off for 5-10 minutes at a time. This last visit, I had turned all the lights out to sleep, and about 10 minutes into it, one of the bedside lamps started to flash on and off. Just a tad annoying. As well, the vanity lamps in the bathroom mirror were not working, and the Privacy lamp was stuck on, the first morning, but I reported both issues to the front desk and they were repaired before I returned in the evening. The room I had this past stay was quite nice, although lacking a view. It had a walk-in closet, and a massive size bathroom. There was a computer controlled pedestal tub, and two walls were floor to ceiling windows in the bathroom (I never lifted the shades, however, as the windows are not covered with a reflective finish, like you would expect). There was a walk-in shower, and a large vanity. The only thing surprising was that the toilet was positioned at the end of the vanity. Some couples might not appreciate this. My previous stay, although the bathroom was smaller and less elegantly appointed, the toilet was in a separate stall. They have panel of connectors, at the end of the desk, that will allow you to connect anything to the entertainment system. Every type of connector known to exist, is on that panel, including VGA, HDMI, 3.5mm audio, composite, etc. Coupled with the 40" LCD TV and the surround sound speaker, it's great. Great lobby bar. Always musicians playing. Very cosmo vibe to the whole lobby and reception area. Fairmont's usually use BMW vehicles for hotel shuttles, but one of the BMWs at the Pacific Rim is actually a 750Li. Very nice car to get driven around in (~$120,000). They'll drop you anywhere within the downtown core. As nice as this car is, though, it won't be the most expensive one you see parked out front. There are always lots of exotic cars out there. Being a downtown Vancouver hotel, and a Fairmont, prices are a bit on the high side. Great staff, great location, and beautiful rooms make it worth it, though.

Reviews.Title: “Westcoast living at its best!”
Reviews.Author: ToniaYVR
Reviews.Content: Had to rush to an appointment I was running late for and to my amazement I was given my room key by the doorman (Patrick) who was to take care of sending my bags to my room :) Fantastic start! The view from my room was just awesome.. Canada Place, English Bay, seeing the cruise liners coming in and leaving, float planes taking off and landing.. Housekeeping service at its best... Candice was so proud relaying to me what one can do in the city and while cleaning up notice a tear in one of my shirts so went and had it mended! and brought it back herself in less than 30 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We Have Ever Stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: Bustnpook
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the St. Regis, Millenium Hilton and Ritz Carlton in NYC and many Marriott and Hilton Hotels around the country, but NOTHING COMPARES to the exceptional amenities, service and outstanding stay we had at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. We stayed on the Gold Level with a view over the Harbor and never wanted to leave the room. Remarkable electronics in the room. EVERY possilble thing has been thought of. EXTREMELY CLEAN and Phenomenal Bathroom Shower and Tub. The service was of the highest caliber and every detail is dealt with professionally. Can't wait to visit this amazing city and even more amazing hotel in an absolutely fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Flo-and-Manu
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Fairmont Pacific Rim from July 23rd until July 25th 2010. We were a party of 2 adults and a 2 yo child. We stayed in a “Deluxe Harbour View Room”. We loved : the view – with a nice view over downtown, Canada Place and the harbor, our waking was great. the bathroom – wide spa bath ou walk-in shower are perfect. Shampoos and body lotion provided are of good quality. the bed – king-size and confortable, we had a good sleep. the restaurant / breakfast – nice breakfast room including a terrace, large buffet and good choice of “English breakfast” dishes. the staff – professional and very kind, the valets used to offer an apple juice to our 2 yo son every time we are going out. We would have liked : a swimming pool with a view (and not a view on the swimming pool). Swimming pool is on the 6th floor between 2 far higher building... less noise in the lobby. The lobby is very nice with a bar to get a drink and comfortable couches but is far too noisy...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Best in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: crl701
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very nice. Staff was excellent, rooms were amazing. The rooms were very quiet at night, and views were great. Would def return to this hotel. Room service for breakfast was very good, and the restaurant in the lobby was great for pre-drinks...Hotel was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: DutchTravelagent
Reviews.Content: the hotel and staff service were both excellent ! the only comment that i have is about the number of sunbeds at the pool. In three days, we were unable at any moment during the afternoons to find available sunbeds so we have not actually been lying in the sun near the pool which we wanted to. The rooms were spacious and luxurious, the location is perfect...no complaints at all !

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: EarthAirFireWater
Reviews.Content: The location is downtown, on Coal Harbour close to the Seawall, and a nice walk or run to Stanley Park. The Hotel is new and luxurious. Our lovely room was filled with the latest in electronic controls for lighting, temperature, and window coverings, which were elegant and fun to use. There was a docking station for a variety of personal electronics. Unfortunately, there was a fee for high speed internet. The personal espresso machine was a treat. We heard no noise from other guests. The pool and hot tub were outside, with a view of the grassy roof of the Convention Centre, and a bit of the Harbour. It was shaded until the afternoon, when it drew so many guests that there weren't enough lounges to go around. There were "cabanas" (outdoor living rooms) with flat screen TVs, for rent. The staff was attentive and friendly. We did not use the spa or restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “very posh and well situated”
Reviews.Author: DHSS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July 2010. We were taking a cruise and wanted to be close to Canada Place where the ships dock. So we decided to get in the night before and stayed at the Pacific Rim. We really liked the location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is very well appointed and in great shape. The rooms are very modern (plugins for everything, all connected, all online) and have great views of the city and the wharf. If I had one compliant it would be that their main lounge is right across from the lobby and a bit on the loud side... but this is a very minor complaint. Price matches the style and type of hotel... would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of flash, lacking substance”
Reviews.Author: juls10
Reviews.Content: Lots of shiny fancy surfaces and electronics [TV in bathroom mirror]. In 'accessible' rooms, the floors were smooth slippery marble, with a step-up a sloping surface to enter shower space. NO nonskid surfaces in shower space or floor outside shower. No hand grip to assist to enter the space. Too much flash not enough attention to how people actually function. Electronic panels glowed at night, rooms noisy = could hear traffic and people noises. Beds comfy. Not enough drawer storage space altho a walk in closer. STAFF super and tried to make the experience better. Would check whether accessibility problems fixed prior to booking. Fabulous workout facilities for those able to use them. Couldn't check the amenities as no boxes appeared on website.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hollydaysSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim for one night in July, before heading over to Vancouver Island. We arrived early, and because there was no room available in the class we booked at that time, the hotel upgraded us to a sea/mountain view room. We loved this hotel. It is brand new and in a great location right on the water (right near the sea plane terminal so was super easy for us to get the sea plane the next day). The view from our room was lovely, and the room was really comfortable and very modern. We had come from a 20 hour plane journey and this hotel made us feel relaxed right away. Service was excellent. We had drinks by the pool in the afternoon, and although we did not swim it looked very nice. A very highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Adonbar
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel, fabulous rooms with lots of natural light, air and refreshing views of water and mountain. Clean fresh rooms and amneties. Very friendly staff and we all enjoyed our stay here. A week was just too short. Will definitely return soon for more and will definitely reccomend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best Modern Luxury Hotel for Business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: DnpJnp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early July 2010. The Fairmont Pacific Rim is a brand new, undeniably 5 star hotel! The only thing is it doesn't resemble any other Fairmont I've been too as its very trendy, not traditionally decorated. That said it has absolutely amazing rooms bordering on excessive :) -- electronic curtains, light switches, a high end espresso machine, soaker tub, and even an LCD tv build into the bathroom mirror! And that was just the standard Fairmont room, so you can only imagine what the other rooms would look like. The hotel has a nice outdoor pool & hot tub, with cabanas and pool-side drink service. Very high end, however when we were there it was crowded with kids in the hot tub and obnoxious people at the bar. Would be great on a HOT day though! The hotel staff provided excellent serivce. The hotel also has a few complimentary BMW bikes to tour the city -- we biked around nearby Stanley Park. The hotel is a perfect location for tourists & business -- only a few minutes walk from the financial district, from Canada Place/Olympic Torch Statute, and the seawall walking & biking trails. We had the Bed & Breakfast package which included a fantastic buffet breakfast with omlete bar, eggs benedict, fresh pastries & fruit, etc. Highly recommend doing their breakfast buffet at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Two words: Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: SWriter
Reviews.Content: It's true what all the reviews say: this is THE PLACE to stay in Vancouver. We think it could be a destination vacation in and of itself. When pushed, we chose to stay in the hotel for the day, basking in the wonderful service; the poolside cabanas (perfect for reading and looking at the distant view of the harbor and mountains); and the terrific food. The photos on the Trip Advisor page are accurate . . .the bathrooms are a step above any others we've been to . . .and the beds are ideal for a great night's sleep. Oh, and the coffee service in the rooms is excellent too. Any criticism? Can't really think of a thing . . .except I wish they didn't charge for internet access. In this day and age, it seems it should come with the room charge. Otherwise, this place is an ideal spot to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with unrivaled service and exceptional food, a must stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Zaraine
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in the door of this hotel to the moment I left, I was wowed! The front desk staff as so helpful and friendly, and it's always nice to get a big warm hello from the doormen as you walk in. The room was amazing! So unbelievably spacious. The king bed was large enough to fit four people and the pillows.... always a highlight in a Fairmont hotel! The bathroom was again spacious and elegant. I found the tv in the bathroom mirror a great feature. Our room was pool-side which was very convenient. You walk through your large patio doors onto your patio with fireplace, open the gate and you are at the pool. The view of the harbor and of the main hotel tower is quite impressive from here. Their restaurant, Oru is another must see. The food is just amazing, such flavors! The servers are also most helpful and informative. Their restaurant manger is also worth a mention, he came to the table several times to make sure we were enjoying everything, it was as though you were a guest in his home rather than just another client in a restaurant. We were so impressed with dinner that we returned the next morning for their buffet style breakfast, so much choice and everything was so fresh and tasty! After breakfast and check out we decided to take a look at their cafe, Giovane. I have to say, they have a great atmosphere there. The staff are so friendly and helpful and with the music playing, the windows down and the smell of tasty food, I could have relaxed there all day. A must try is their Sugar Bun.... wow! All in all, I couldn't recommend this hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: satherton1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. The location is outstanding, service was wonderful, room was fabulous (6th floor, pool level suite), amenities perfect. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again. Very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kiki_fm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim for two nights in July. I booked a Fairmont property becuase i have stayed at three other Fairmont hotels and loved all of them and I wanted to try this newest one. It turned out to be the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The hotel itself was beautiful. My room was wonderful - super cpmfortable bed, big tv, marble bathroom, huge soaker tub, electronic bathroom mirror with embedded tv screen. I had good food at the lobby loung on two occasions and good drinks. But the best part of the hotel was the service. Right from check-in, which I was early because of a spa appointment, was no problem for them. The desk clerk gave me a short tour of the lobby of the hotel and walked me to the elevator, made sure I knew where everythign was, which I didn't even ask for but made it feel very personalized. Every staff member I passed for the whole two and a half days smiled, greeted me and made me feel like they were there to help. There was poolside bar and food service on the pool deck. And the nightly turndown service was fantastic. There was no detail overlooked. Lights set, soft music turned on, a second tidying of the room, a card with the next day's weather forecast, even a fresh bucket of ice left in the evening without even requesting it, but just in case. It was the best service I have ever experienced and what put it on the top of my list as best place I have ever stayed. I would love to go back again because it was total luxury. There was only one minor issue, and that was with the spa, so not specifically the hotel. I did chose this Fairmont over the other two Fairmont's in downtown Vancouver becuase of the spa. I have been to the spa in the Fairmont Banff springs and its was the best spa i had been too (pure heaven) so I was expecting the same quality here, especially since the hotel itself was even better than banff. I came early hoping to enjoy some of the spa before my treatments as in Banff there are soaking pools, etc. lots to do before and after treament. But there wasn't much. It lacked a spa jacuzzi or hot tub. Instead i went up to the public pool deck. it did have a steam room. There was also construction going on outside the lounge on what i assume will be a spa pool/hot tub, so perhaps when that is done the spa will have more amenities. But i was a little disappointed. Best hotel did not equal best spa. Also, when I booked my appointemnt, one of the services i booked was a facial peel. When i got in the treatment room, the attendant said i coldnt have the peel as my skin had a bit too much sun for a peel. I had been out kayaking for two days prior and the reason for the spa day was relaxing after this physical activity. if they had asked at the time of booking what the purpose of my visit was, I would have told them and they would have been able to tell me that my skin would not be able to have a peel after two days of kakying in the sun. I could have chosen a different more appropriate service. This was just a minor setback, the attendant did a good job of picking something else out at the time and I was still satisfied with the service. But, it could have been avoided with asking what the purpose of the visit was at the booking time, since my sun exposure was planned, and not unexpected. So just two minor disappointments that really only styood out because everything else was so fantastic. I'm sure when the construction is done the spa will be up to the quality of the hotel, and now i know to ask the question myself about a peel. I still hada very relaxing day. My second treament was fabulous, and I would definetly come back again for another experience. Overall, my stay at this hotel was wonderfully luxurious and I would love to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “fabolous location and facility but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: happycamper1234567
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at the waterfront which has the best location of the city . The view is amazing, and the property is very trendy and stylish with a $225,000 white Fazioli piano sitting at the Lobby Lounge. Willow Stream Spa is one of the nicest and greatest spa I haver ever been to and the spa thereapist is very attentive and professional. The pool is a must go place as there is a poolside bar and there are 5 cabanas with fireplace and 3 with HD TV. The only thing we were not happy about was the front office staff. We were put into the wrong category of room . When we told them that was not what we wanted but we were told the hotel was almost fully booked and the front office girl kind of gave me an too bad so sad answer so I was like really? was that how you would response to you guest when your hotel made a mistake and couldn't you upgrade the guest just to make them happy? Service definitely needs to be polished but the hotel is fabulous otherwise

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: leeloovancouver
Reviews.Content: After arriving to the wrong Fairmont a block away, the hotel kindly shuttled us to the correct one (the Pacific Rim). As this is a brand new hotel, nothing to complain about in the way of decor or cleanliness. High tech, high cosmopolitan with androgynous staff. Felt like I was in a sci-fi movie set. Room was spacious enough for us both. A little more masculine than we would have liked (all browns, tans and gold). Our room overlooked the pool and the new confrence centre - liked the grass roof - softened the landscape. Took a while to figure out the light switches (auto this, auto that). The TV in the bathroom's mirror was fun to play with. Bed and linens were very comfortable. Central location, close to the sky train, Gastown, Robson Street, restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: 2traveles
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at all the Fairmont Hotels surrounding Vancouver, all the way to Whistler, and they all have been great. The Pacific Rim, while an excellent location, was lacking. We had to sit in the lobby and wait for our room, which was not ready, no apologies made. Many of the young employees were talking and, and the usual level of Fairmont service just was not there. They have got some kinks to work out. It is a slick, high tech hotel, the rooms are European-sized, small, okay for a night or two. They don't tell you that you can self-park, it is assumed that you will valet, which is more expensive. But we loved the location, by the marina, you can walk down to the water, a great first evening in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and drab”
Reviews.Author: syd_matt
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel but I found it really drab - really small rooms and I'd chosen one of their best on their "executive" floor. Colour schemes all beige on beige and just sucked the life out of me! Compared to another more boutique hotel I stayed in in Vancouver this trip, the Pacific Rim was so so overpriced and over rated!

Reviews.Title: “you don't get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: br-latin-wcs
Reviews.Content: I had friends visiting for two days, and wanted to show them how beautiful Vancouver is. They like to stay in 4 or 5 star hotels so I booked one that is self claimed as 5 star.I booked two "Harbour View "rooms at $500 a night each. The front desk person was very friendly on the phone and said she is booking two rooms that are close together and have beautiful views of the harbour. ( these are listed as "harbour view rooms" on their website}. Don't believe it! One room was at the pool deck,another had a view of an office building- the cruise ship terminal was also in view. I was very polite and asked for better rooms when I got to the hotel-and she changed one room to one with a good view (it strangely had some chocolates on the desk and a card welcoming "MR. Wiggins",nobody I know.I had our freinds stay in this room. Our room had a dirty bathroom floor, a dead clock,and a defective fridge.The lights and drapes were controlled by finicky touch panels. A maintenance person replaced the fridge with a repaired one but the clock still didn't work. Parking was ridiculous! I self park because i don"t like the way valets handle cars.At $35 a night it should be convenient to park your car. Information should be printed somewhere on how to do that. I went to the front desk and they appeared puzzled , so handed me off to a parking manager. He then told the front desk person to print a pass for two days of parking. The pass did not work- the exit ticket reader said the pass was invalid,so it would not open the gate,I had to back down the exit ramp then go up to the front desk again. A parking "manager" was called and walked down with me and opened the gate with a remote. I was told a pass would be delivered to my room that night -nothing. As a last aggravation, charge for one local phone call $1.95

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Clean, Great Location, Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TerryPower123
Reviews.Content: Outstanding experience at a truly top-level hotel. Outstanding location 1,000 feet from the Olympic Torch, a 30 minute walk to Stanley Park, a 15 minute walk to Gastown. Lobby bar is modern and always buzzing with energy. Staff was wonderful from the doorman to the housekeepers. I was there with a conference and the food we had was outstanding. Just a teriffic experience.

Reviews.Title: “modern, stylish, and chic best describes Fairmonts' new Vancouver property”
Reviews.Author: ricski64
Reviews.Content: Breaking away from their historical roots, the Pacific Rim offers guests a modern upscale look and feel. You will find as soon as you enter the lobby the feel is young, trendy and vibrant. the lobby/lounge area can get loud in the evenings but that adds to the experience. We ate in the lounge too , it has it's own sushi bar to make sashimi, rolls and hand rolls. Was pleased with the taste and quality on each experience. We had breakfast at the restuarant upstairs. Great selection of buffet iteams. Well worth the money if you can eat a large breakie !!! the room we had was a signature room that over looked the Convention centre and to our side, viewable thru our windows was the swimming/lounging area. The rooms are made up with walnut, marble and granite finishes and are top quality. A constant complaint are the light switches, hard to read LCD panel, just hit the top button and work your way down to correct light level. Will definitly be back to this property time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “stunning views, amazing hotel - strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Shmees
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new, and everything is shiny and beautiful and clean. The staff is very well trained, friendly, helpful, terrific, on par with the best hotels I have ever stayed at. I had a room with a balcony on the 18th floor, with a spectacular panoramic view of the north shore, water & mountains as well as Stanley Park, the cruise ships, etc. I cannot begin to describe how beautiful the view is - worth whatever the room costs (it was a business trip, so I don’t actually know how much this room costs.) The only slight problem is the noise of seaplanes taking off (if the window is open) but this is also rather scenic so I didn’t mind. The room itself was not huge but had more than enough space, with a very comfortable bed, and a huge and gorgeous state of the art bathroom (e.g., with a flat-screen TV somehow built inside the mirror above the sink) with Kohler faucets and marble everywhere. Electronic switches to open/close the drapes and even to select “do not disturb / clean the room”. Plenty of electric outlets for cells phones etc. The location of the hotel is also amazing if you want to be right on the water, a thirty second walk to the Olympic torch, next door to the convention centre, about a five minute walk to “Canada Place” where the cruise ships dock, and a short walk to Gastown and the downtown core. You can also walk along the seawall, and Stanley Park is very close by. The Willow Spa is very nice, although not entirely completed, and the treatment rooms with outdoor windows also have a not-very-relaxing noise of city buses periodically driving by.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: MrWindUpBird
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. I'm not usually bothered about staying in top hotels, but we got an excellent deal on a night here and it was well worth it. The design and quality of the hotel is top-notch - and the service lives up to it. The food in the Oru restaurant is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC ,MAGNIFICENT,EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Brats
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to be given a Birthday Gift of a night at the Pacific Rim Vancouver I can say nothing but positive remarks regarding this property. The location is prime opposite the Vancouver Conference Centre ,steps to Canada Place,walking distance to all of Downtown Vancouver, The lobby is beautiful chic ,elegant,with a beautiful fireplace and grand piano,it is a very comfortable for a afternoon drink or pre dinner appies.
