All the staff were happy,with smiles and acknowledgment to all guests where ever you were in the hotel you were greeted. The room was gorgeous a very good size feeling of spaciousness ,everything was electronic,lights ,drapes, The bathroom has an Electronic Mirror ???? its a TV in the centre of the bathroom mirror wonderful luxury which when turned of just looks like an ordinary mirror .....beautiful tub and spacious separate marble shower with rain shower + hand shower,completely separate toilet . Our room had a wonderful view of Canada Place with the Cruise Ships coming and going, the King Bed was I'm sure the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in with surround sound this was a great experience. We had an amazing dinner at Oru with incredible service ,spectacular views of the Cruise Ships and Canada Place The Willow Steam Spa was immaculate ,soothing a beautiful spa

Reviews.Title: “Yet another amazing Fairmont hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: gabigoose
Reviews.Content: Fairmont has the BEST collection of hotels in Vancouver. I've stayed in all over the years and have been impressed with each. I finally had a chance to stay one night at the new Fairmont Pacific Rim for a business meeting. First my room (room 1017) was incredibly sleek, spacious, and modern. Things that stood out: The closet was the size of a room, the lighting and curtains were all electronically controlled, the bathroom mirror includes a nice embedded TV, the main TV had incredible sound. The most impressive feature of the room was the wall of windows. Two sides of the room were all windows and even the bathroom had two walls of windows. Very interesting. The hotel design was very impressive and unique. On the exterior several large words wrap around the windows…the words were visible from my room. The location is also stellar…right along the water and across the street from the Olympic Caldron. The service was also very polished which can be hard to achieve in a newer hotel. I was especially impressed during my business meeting. After setting up and waiting for others to arrive I glanced down from my second floor conference room to the lobby through a window in the room (neat design touch). The doorman noticed me observing the lobby and gave me a warm wave. The wave was very warm and personal. This a great new hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel In Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: avalon1025
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation at the Shangri-La, but upon arrival they had no rooms to offer me, so they had arranged mfor me to move to the Fairmont Pacific Rim. It was wonderful, every staff member was super, the room was fantastic and the public spaces beautiful. I can not say how pleasantly surprised I was by the entire stay. Hopefully one day I'll get to stay at the Shangri-la, but I would be more than happy at the Pacific Rim!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, service was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: TravelCanadaGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so wonderful, from check-in until we left. We had such a great time and enjoyed all of the amentities this hotel had to offer. I was a bit disappointed that the pool wasn't open yet though, as I am sure it will be beautiful. Staff: Staff were all very friendly, check in, restaurant staff, etc. One girl in particular, I think her name was Stephanie, when we asked her where an ATM was, she went out of her way to walk us there rather than just tell us, which I thought was great. Housekeeping staff was also very friendly and quick. Front desk, concierge and doorman were all also fantastic Rooms: Beautiful. The bathrooms were fantastic. The bed was very comfortable. Restaurants: Drinks in the lobby were great, as was Oru. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “If I visit Vancouver again, this is the only hotel I will stay”
Reviews.Author: skyone
Reviews.Content: This is probably the only 5 star luxury hotel located in Vancouver. Because of my job, I visited many hotels in Vancouver back in Dec, and by far this is the best When I first saw this hotel from the outside, nothing really impress me, but when I walked into the lobby, that is what really opened up my eyes, very modern and luxury. 1. Staff - their staff is very friendly, make sure you're taken care of during my stay 2. Location - right by the waterfront and the convention center, around the corner is a sky train, cost approx $4.00 and it can take you all the way to the airport, walking distance from everything in downtown area 3. Room - I stay at one of the Harbour View Room, and I gotta tell you, if you ever stay in this hotel, you must spend the extra money to get the Harbour View Room, is "your' vacation, so make sure you will get the best out of it 4. Restaurant - I never really into hotel restaurants we all know they're all over price, and so it is, their lunch menu is small, not really a restaurant menu, is more like a cafe menu 5. Spa and Gym - This hotel got probably the best spa ever, back in Mar of 2010, the spa is not yet finish, but is usable, it will be very nice once they complete Hotel lobby- at night time, they're a small band playing different type of music, depending on the night of the week, everyone really enjoying them self, and if you're traveling alone or with someone but your company went to bed early, you can always go down to the lobby and enjoy the music, everyone is very friendly. If you visiting Vancouver and want to get the best out of it, this is the hotel for you If you visiting Vancouver and just want to sleep and shower in the hotel, this is not for you, because I promise you, if you stay at this hotel one night, you will not want to leave

Reviews.Title: “Poor security/personel.”
Reviews.Author: RussJohnson
Reviews.Content: Our GPS was stolen out of our car while in the hotel valet care. After being interviewed for over a half hour by the hotel staff, no compensation and little remorse was offered. In the room there were bright light panels which stayed lit at night. You could almost read by them - rather irritating. Also, when booking, we were told the pool was open and available. When we got there it was "sorry, not open yet". We would have chosen a different hotel with a pool had we known, as our kids love to swim. Clearly dishonest. One day (evening) we had to call to have our room made up.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: viajeramx1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, views, just minutes from the Seawall and from Robson St . Oru, great restaurant for breakfast. Beautiful and trendy decoration. Good tips from concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, excellent service - VPR will be the only hotel I stay at in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: quank
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Fairmont Pacific Rim for 2 nights in April 2010. We were celebrating a recent achievement in her studies and had let the hotel know in advance. We had a wonderful stay from the moment we checked-in to the when we left Vancouver. The service was personal – staff did many little things to acknowledge our travel preferences – and rooms were extremely comfortable. This will become the only hotel I stay at in Vancouver when I visit as I believe they have something special going here. Service (5/5): *Our room wasn’t ready when we arrived at 8am but the staff gladly stored our bags and the agent who checked us in said she’d call me when the room was ready (which she did a few hours later). I ran into the same agent the following afternoon and she asked me how my stay was going and referred to me by my name. A small touch but made me feel like a personal guest at the hotel. *Concierge at the hotel was EXCEPTIONAL. I worked with one person in particular before the trip, who asked great questions and followed-up on a timely basis and exceeded our expectations on every level. This concierge added various personal touches throughout our stay. For his service alone, I would rate VPR as 5/5. *The availability of the courtesy vehicles was inconsistent. Of the 4 times I requested the vehicle, I was able to secure a ride 2 times. I’m not sure if they only have 1 car or if there is a shortage of drivers. Rooms (5/5): *We stayed in one of the ‘signature suites’ which was extremely comfortable and spacious. Room was warm which was great considering we had two blustery days while in Vancouver. As noted above, my wife has allergies to certain scents and cleaners so the staff prepared the room accordingly. Staff cleaned room on both days and also turned down the room in the evening. Overall very clean and well-maintained throughout our stay. *The common area was huge, and included both a sitting area with large flat screen TV, a dining area and two large closets. The balcony had great view of the harbour, Convention Centre, Olympic Cauldron, and the eastern side of Stanley Park. Also very interesting is the Chairman’s Suite which is still being built. It has two levels of floor-to-ceiling windows and I was told the roof of the suite would become an entertaining area for the suite. *The main bathroom had a TV in the mirror which was a great feature that you could use while in the shower or in the tub. Shower had one of those rainfall showerheads which I love. Second bathroom was very large and also had a shower. *Bedroom had a view of the habour and Stanley Park and was very comfortable. Room also has a large flat screen TV, a ‘Nespresso’ machine that makes decent espresso. *All of the lights were activated by touch pad and had preprogrammed themes although I’m not sure if they were functioning appropriately as the ‘relax’ and ‘entertain’ theme seemed to either dim the lights so low you couldn’t see anything or made the room really bright. Restaurants (4/5): *Giovane (Café) – Enjoyed their fresh pastries, savory scones and well-made coffees. Really nice area to sit in with lots of windows. A bit pricier than local cafes which is typical for hotel cafes. *Oru (Pan-Asian) – Overall thought it was an authentic Asian restaurant with excellent service. They had a tasting menu with various land animals but they were able to accommodate all of our dietary restrictions. Our favorite dish was the Sake Kasu Sablefish (perfectly cooked) which had a miso glaze (not salty and comforting). Their homemade tofu with mushroom truffle sauce was earthy and light although a bit difficult to eat with a plate and chopsticks – I’d recommend they serve it with a serving spoon and small bowls so you can ‘shovel’ the tofu out with your chopsticks. The steamed rainbow trout with ginger/scallions tasted great and was a very generous portion that could easily have fed 4-5 adults. My wife particularly liked the ‘tanryoku’ cocktail with chili infused vodka, saké, giffard ginger, lime, fresh cilantro. *Lobby area – Did not have drinks or food here although I’d point out the Fazioli piano that played in the evenings – what a beautiful looking and sounding piano! Location (5/5): *Ideal location downtown and just a few blocks from the Canada Line and Skytrain stations *Across the street from Canada Place and the Convention Centre (where the Olympic Cauldron stood and where you can see the Olympic rings that turned gold when Canada won a gold medal during the Olympics) *Short walk to water and a few minutes by bike to Stanley Park

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply, the best hotel I've stayed at in North America...”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Pacific Rim is the best hotel I've had the pleasure of staying at in North America, especially for the value. When I travel it's mostly for business and I usually try to keep the hotel rates reasonable (i.e. <$200/night). I managed to get a grand opening special rate and stayed for 4 nights during the tail end of the para-Olympics. The hotel is new (opened during the Olympics) - the cabbie I had had not heard of the hotel (there's 2 other Fairmonts nearby) so be ready to have the address handy as a precaution. It's downtown on the waterfront - good location. Also, the entrance is off to the side a bit. I travel to China quite a bit and this hotel reminds me a lot of the hotels in China - at a reasonable price. They definitely transferred that model to this hotel. The lobby is very impressive. Very grand, chic and modern. Great fireplace and sleek design. Very nice staff. The room is very spacious. Big flat screen tv. Complimentary internet, water and shoe shine service. Very cool/funky bathroom - separate room for the toilet. Separate shower and tub AND a tv built into the mirror but stands as part of the mirror when it's not on. The decor is modern and very nice. Sliding barn doors were a nice touch too I thought. Safety deposit box in the room but it didn't seem to work (not a deal breaker). Room service is good but they do automatically add a gratuity but that makes it easier, in my opinion. Other amenities: Gym is nice - lots of modern cardio equipment. Ok free weights and machinery. Free bottles of water, free fruit and muffins - again, stuff you'd only see in China it seems. There's a nice bakery/brunch place in the hotel and the main restaurant is supposed to be really good but I didn't have the pleasure of trying it (other than room service). Too often I'm resigned to the fact that I'm spoiled in China and slumming it in N.A. but alas, I finally found a hotel here that offers a true hotel experience. Of course, once the rates go up, it'll probably be out of my league but until then, try to book a stay and enjoy your stay while you can!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebKel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim from April 2nd - 6th. From the moment we arrived the service was awesome. When we got out of the taxi the bellman asked for our last name and said that we did not have to go to check-in, he had our keys. He handed us off to another gentleman who took us to our room and showed us how everything worked and where the buttons were (remote lights, curtains, coffee maker, TV in the mirror......) The location of the hotel is great. The 2010 Olympic Caldron as directly across the street to the left and Canada Place was directly across the street to the right. The elevators are the fastest that we have ever had in a hotel. The longest we had to wait was approximately 2 seconds, they seemed to anticipate us needing to use them. The rooms are large and comfortable. The hotel just opened in January 2010, so the pool area is not finished yet (it's due to open in June 2010). You may want to ask for a room on the other side of the hotel until the pool is finished, as the workers seemed to start working outside between 7:00 and 7:30 am. I went to the spa and it was great. I decided at the last minute to get a massage, that was around 4:00 pm. I called down and they said that they were all booked up, I said that was fine. About 10 minutes later I received a call from the spa saying that a masseuse said that she would stay to give me my massage. I went directly down and had an awesome 60 minutes massage. If you want to be pampered and have great service, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chen5930
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Pacific Rim Hotel is a top notch hotel with excellent harbour & mountain views in the rooms. We stayed in a deluxe room which was very spacious, clean and modern. Although our room was located next to the elevators we were never bothered by any hallway noises. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable and we were greeted with smiles every time we walked thru the lobby. Another nice unexpected bonus was that we were able to web check-in and print our boarding passes for free in the Business Centre on the day of our departing flight which allowed us more time to spend in the city. The hotel is also closely situated to the Canada Line Sky train, about a 3 minute walk eastward. The hotel is also within walking distance to Gastown, Chinatown and Robson Street. Also try the Giovane Cafe located in the hotel, very delicious breakfast pastries (try the sugar bun)! The only downside was the rooftop cabana pool was not open yet when we were there but I'm sure it will be amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading description of room view & hotel not suitable for vacation”
Reviews.Author: BuongustaioSempre
Reviews.Content: Although our room view was described as Harbour View, what we could actually see from our room was the roof of the conference centre. When we requested another room, we had to wait a very long time, and were shown a room in front of an ice machine and close to the elevator, even although we have a preference stated for a quiet room away from elevators and ice machines (both in our President's Club profile and on our reservation). In such circumstances, good hotels normally offer one or two upgrades at little or no charge, just to compensate the guest for the inconvenience. This hotel did offer a minor upgrade, but to another totally unsuitable room. When we asked for a higher upgrade, for which we were willing to partially pay for, we were asked for the full amount of the upgrade. Ultimately, we had to cancel our reservation and move to another hotel. However, it was not until we informed this hotel of our decision that the Assistant Reception Manager came to speak to us, even although he was close by during the previous discussion. Also, we highly recommend that anyone looking for an enjoyable and relaxing stay in a 4 star hotel atmosphere should avoid this hotel, because it certainly does not have a 4 star hotel atmosphere, but rather appears, sounds and feels like a typical business hotel full of convention delegates, with the associated high level of noise and constant bustle and delays in service. Due to this hotel’s extreme proximity the convention centre, the choice of rooms is very limited for individual travellers, due to the common block-booking for conventions. The only slightly redeeming part of this experience was that the hotel provided us with free transportation to our new hotel. I should also mention that I have been satisfied with my stays at many Fairmont hotels over the years, but this experience has now unfavourably changed my opinion of the Fairmont brand.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, yes!”
Reviews.Author: Peace-L4
Reviews.Content: Fabulous suite… eager-to-please staff... stunning views… delightful experience! Pet friendly notes – our dog enjoyed happy greetings, a quiet room, and exploring the waterfront neighborhood. The bustling lobby could be overwhelming at times, and it felt like a long walk to a good “doing his business” spot — but never a problem. The cat and dog room service menu was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: wlross
Reviews.Content: A gem in the city of Vancouver. Everything about the Pacific Rim was five star quality. When we arrived, my wife and I were greeted at the front entrance by Patrick who welcomed us with a warm smile and took us right up the the front desk. Our check in was very smooth and pleasent. The front desk staff were very warm and welcoming. Brianna walked us right to the elevators instead of just pointing them out or telling us "they are over there". The room was beautiful with awesome views overlooking the water and mountains. We almost felt like we were at home and not in a 'hotel". My wife wanted to have a look at the Spa. We left our room and found Les in the hallway and asked him where we could find the spa. Just like earlier in the front lobby, we didn't just get pointed in the right direction, he took us to the elevators and down to the front reception area in the Spa. The Spa staff were more than welcome to answer all our questions and give us a small tour. You guys should be proud. Best staff interaction I've had in a hotel. You made our stay very pleasent and comfortable. Won't hesitate to return to your wonderful establishment on our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Nagnew
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. From the moment my husband and I checked in till we left we felt pampered and well taken care of. The lobby is great for people watching and for having a drink before dinner listening to some great live music. The whole place is open, comfortable and relaxed. We had dinner in Oru with some friends and had the Chef's selection. I highly recommend this if there are 4 or more of you. You have a selection of appetizers and main courses and each one was divine. Our room was lovely and as everything is automated we had fun opening and shutting the drapes and turning on an off the lights... we were like a couple of kids giggling. The beds are so comfy and the bathrooms are very well done with a great separate shower. We felt well taken care of and had a great night away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Room and View in Vancouver!!”
Reviews.Author: RPKVancouver
Reviews.Content: Brand new and simply the best in Vancouver. No details spared in these rooms. Electric drapes, great views, tv built right inside the mirror in the bathroom. Very nice comfortable room! They had a AAA rate and BC rate which was only 182.00 per night! Ate at the Oru restaurant in the hotel and would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “The Utmost in Taste”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: Based on the buzz and building, I had a hunch the Fairmont Pacific Rim would rival, if not exceed, the nicest hotels in Vancouver. This past weekend, my hunch was confirmed. It is indeed a hotel for the discerning traveller displaying the utmost taste in design, staff, fare and facilities. Lobby The modern, yet welcoming marble-clad lobby is bright and full of life. Although the design is clean-lined and simple, the lobby is nothing but with its dramatic set of wooden chandeliers, oversized fireplace and custom-made $225,000 Italian piano. There's even a flower shop. Restaurants All the food options you'd need are viewable from the lobby. Oru, the hotel's signature pan-asian restaurant towers above the lobby. Oru's (meaning: to fold) bar provides an excellent perch for drinking, chatting and people watching. The food is excellent, the service personable, yet professional and the environment spacious and airy. The Lobby Bar serves drinks, high tea, appies and fresh seafood. Each drink comes with a trio of olives and nuts. Giovane is an Italian-inspired breakfast, lunch and snack bar. Eat-in or take out. Love the food, love the decor, love the convenience. Staff In addition to its services and offerings, the Fairmont Pacific Rim is attempting to set themselves apart in their high level of service, and it shows. The did all the right things --when things went well and when things were bumpy. For example, the moment we walked in the doors, the doorman asked us if we were checking in, found our name on his daily list and then escorted and introduced us to the front desk agent. Our room was not ready when we checked-in and because it was after the regular check-in time, the front desk agent kindly offered us a drink in the lobby bar while we waited. After 25 mins, our room still wasn't ready she offered us another drink and some food. This was the right, classy thing to do. Because they handled things well, it didn't bother us that our room was a little tardy... Rooms The rooms are contemporary and high-tech. All the bathrooms have TVs embedded into the mirrors, the mattresses are made by Sterns and Foster (same company who supplies the White House) and there is a nespresso pod-like coffee maker. All lighting, electronics and curtains are controlled by electronic panels throughout the room. Tips - The Fairmont Pacific Rim is one of 4 Fairmont properties in the greater vancouver area - There is a high-end grocery store (urban fare) 3 blocks from the hotel - It is across the street from Vancouver's award-winning convention centre - It is across the street from Tourism Vancouver, making it easy to pop-in and ask for directions, recommendations or help - It is a 5-min walk from Vancouver's shopping district (robson street)

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view, outstanding service, gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: ASASG_7
Reviews.Content: Weekend getaway (Fri - Sun) at the Pacific Rim exceeded expectations. The service is friendly, prompt, professional -- really seem to enjoy their work! I've been to a dozen Fairmonts and this new one proves that Fairmont is striving for quality in a world that seems to be drifting towards mediocrity. The best location in town, right at the start of the Sea Wall. Our corner suite view stretched from Stanley Park to Canada Place: we had friends up for a drink & everyone who walked in had the jaw-drop experience. The suite is intelligently designed and furnished in a clean, modern look. The wonderful beds you expect at a Fairmont and lovely bathrooms. Def. worth being a President's Club member: upgrade the room & ask for a corner suite, get the loaner BMW bikes (President's Club) -- a highlight of our weekend -- and free wi-fi is becoming a must. One v. small quibble: better selection of room service appies would be nice and parking a tad high even for Vancouver at $35/night.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I think it even surpasses four seasons..”
Reviews.Author: deliciousVancouver
Reviews.Content: gorgeous and brand new. and the service oh my the service, everyone is on point at this hotel no one misses anything. i loved the gym and the service at the gym, the food was good at oru went there for breaky. The little cafe forgot the name, but they make yummy flat pizzas. I used to think Fairmont waterfront was the nicest, nope this one is by far more beautiful.
